loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 24 years old, married to Faith, and not yet blessed with children. He owns a retail shop in Tala. He has been doing this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 6,000 (~$68) per month.

Stephen is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase stocks of sugar, flour, cooking oil, paraffin, salt, rice and tea leaves. He will use the anticipated profit to support his family.

He hopes to have a stable business and support his family economically through the expansion of his business to a high yielding profit business. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, flour, cooking fat and many more.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is fifty years old, married and lives in Kakata, Liberia. He has three children ages fifteen to twenty-nine; one lives at home and attends school while the other two are working and live away from home.

For the past ten years Amos and his wife have operated a mini-restaurant in their community. He has also been running a grocery store where he sells many types of food. He make a good profit and intends to grow his business.

Amos is requesting a loan of 70,000 LRD to purchase more goods for his store. He hopes to purchase a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his store.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: As is known, the fish is the main vital fresh food for everyone, and in particular, the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Eam is among those people who currently depend on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Eam is a humble mother who has been blessed with two lovely young children who are attending school. From this business, Eam gains approximately $2 per day. To upgrade their living, Eam and her husband would like to purchase fishing materials but they lack money, so Eam has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva. She expects that this fund will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all the kind lenders who always help her family

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Shirinbay

texts.ru:
Ширинбай родился в селе Карл Маркс (Ошская область, Кыргызская Республика). Женат и имеет 4 детей.
Ширинбай родился в простой семье чабана. Он был самым старшим из братьев, и поэтому большую часть времени посвящал домашним хлопотам, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом. Окончив школу, в 1979 году его призвали в армию, где отслужил два года. Отслужив, Ширинбай поступил в Сельхоз техникум в городе Ош, по специальности технолог зерновых производств и в этом же году женился.
Первое время жил с родителями, в родном селе  устроился на работу в колхоз. В 1991 году накопив немного денег, Ширинбай покупает небольшой дом в селе Кара-Добо (Панфиловский р-он, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). На выделенной им колхозом земле они выращивали овощи и содержали небольшое хозяйство. Постепенно семья Ширинбая росла, росли потребности, и было решено  переехать в село Новониколаевка, так как это село находится вблизи города Карабалта (Жайылский р-он, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан), который является центром района. Постепенно хозяйство разрасталось. На доходы от продажи приплода и молока Ширинбай купил себе автомашину, на которой по сей день предоставляет населению услуги такси. Так же на доходы от животноводства, Ширинбай выдал замуж дочь, женил двух старших сыновей и помог купить одному из них дом по соседству.
В данное время, благодаря предприимчивости и упорству Ширинбая в хозяйстве насчитывается 20 дойных коров. Для дальнейшего  увеличения поголовья скота, Ширинбай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  В будущем, Ширинбай мечтает со временем женить младшего сына и собирать всю свою дружную семью с внуками за одним большим  столом в своем доме.
texts.en: Shirinbay was born in the Karl Marx village (Osh region, Kyrgyz Republic).  He is married and has four children.  Shirinbay was born into a simple family of a shepherd.  He was the oldest among his brothers and, thus, devoted the most time taking care of the household and helped his father to take care of livestock.  After finishing school, he was drafted into the army in 1979, where he served two years.  After the army, Shirinbay went to the agricultural college in the city of Osh to learn the profession of a grain production technologist.  He also got married that same year.  At first, he lived with his parents in his native village and got a job in the agricultural collective.  Having saved some money, Shirinbay bought a small house in the Kara-Dobo village (Panfilovsk district, Chuysk region, Kyrgyzstan) in 1991.  The family grew vegetables and kept livestock on the land allotted to them by the collective farm.  As Shirinbay's family grew, so did their needs, and they decided to move to the Novonikolaevka village because it is located near the city of Karabalta (Jayilsk district, Chuysk region, Kyrgyzstan), which is the center of the district.  Their business gradually developed.  Shirinbay used the profits from selling livestock litter and milk to buy himself a car, which he uses to this day to provide people with a taxi service.  Also using income from animal husbandry, Shirinbay married off his daughter, two older sons and helped one of them to buy a house nearby.  Currently, thanks to Shirinbay's entrepreneurship and persistence, his business has 20 dairy cows.  In order to continue increasing livestock headcount, Shirinbay requested a loan in the of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  In the future, Shirinbay dreams to eventually marry off his youngest son and bring his friendly family with grandchildren together at one big table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 41 años, se destaca por ser una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, convive con su pareja y el menor de sus hijos, pues los tres ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. Su fin es dar lo mejor de si para mejorar su calidad de vida y progresar, por tanto trabaja en el mercado central de su ciudad, ahí posee una tienda de venta de abarrotes y productos variados. Tiene un año ejerciendo éste negocio, y aún desea seguir continuando para consolidarse como comerciante, por ello trata siempre de exhinir la cantidad de mercaderái que tiene, así sus clientes no dejan de comprarle. Ella espera mas adelante ampliar su tienda y surtirla con más productos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continaur con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Marlene is 41 years old, and stands out as a very dynamic and hardworking woman.  She lives with her partner and the youngest of her children, as three of her children are already adults and are independent.  Her family lives together in their own house.  Her goal is to do her best to improve her quality of life and make progress. She works in the central market of her city, where she has a store where she sells groceries and a variety of products.  She has been running this store for a year, and she wants to continue to establish herself as a merchant.  To do this she tries to always exhibit all of her merchandise, so that her customers will not stop buying.  She hopes in the future to expand her store and stock it with more products.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and so she awaits the support of each of you so that she can continue with her work.  With the sum requested, she will buy more merchandise in the form of basic consumer goods, so that in this way she can meet the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is 23 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three months. She is still single and a registered nurse in this country. During these months of operating her business, she has been in the process of healing from a car accident. Before that accident, she was just waiting her visa to fly to Canada and work as a nurse. 

But because of what happened, she is not be able to work anymore in Canada. This causes her to stay indoors and built her own sari-sari store. It was hurtful for her to be in an accident but she needs to accept it and continue the journey of life. 

Right now, she is asking a loan of 7,000 PHP from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. to buy additional groceries to her sari-sari store, such as candies, canned goods and biscuits. She hopes this will be a big factor in increasing her usual income every month. Selling in her business is her hobby at this moment of her healing process, she can't go out of their house because she has been struggling to walk up to now.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her sari-sari store such as candies, canned goods, and biscuits

loans.name: Kokuvi

texts.fr:
Kokuvi est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire.  
Kokuvi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2007. Il achète et revend des cartes de recharge de téléphone à tous ceux qui le désire, dans une cabine téléphonique à un carrefour non loin d’une station d’essence. Il achète les cartes auprès des grossistes du quartier. Il travaille avec une personne. 
Kokuvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge destinées à la vente. Il veut avec les profits supplémentaires agrandir sa baraque. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kokuvi voudrait devenir grossiste. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit dans un avenir proche avoir une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Kokuvi is a single man who is 28 years old.

Kokuvi has been working as a retailer since 2007.  He buys and sells top-up cards for phones to everybody who wants them.  He makes his sales from a phone booth at a crossroads not far from a gas station.  He buys his cards from wholesalers in his neighborhood.  He works with the help of one other person.

Kokuvi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy top-up cards to sell.  He would like to use his extra profits to increase the size of his sales location.

In the coming years, Kokuvi would like to become a wholesaler.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy top-up cards

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men is a responsible mother who resides in Ang Snoul, a suburb area of Phnom Penh city. She is now 67 years old, a widow and the mother of two children. Since her husband passed away, Mrs. Men has tried hard to raise her children. And now, both of them have their own careers: one is a construction foreman and the other is a policeman. Mrs. Men earns a living by purchasing and reselling rice. She has been in this business since 1990. She really enjoys this business and she typically makes a profit of $6 USD a day. Every day Mrs. Men goes to work by riding a bicycle and sometimes by walking which is difficult for her. Thus, she is taking out a loan in the sum of USD1200 to buy a motorcycle to use in her business. In the future, she wants to become a well-known tradeswoman in her community and expand her rice selling business largely.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for the family and in her business.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFONSI est formé de seize personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Micheline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Micheline est âgée de 31 ans, et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Marc. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Micheline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Micheline fait la production de la farine de manioc (à base de manioc), qu'elle vend dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Micheline vend de l’huile de palme et du pétrole dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Micheline achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Micheline et les autres membres du groupement FIFONSI sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d’affaire, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi Group consists of sixteen persons living in the same village. The representative of the group, Micheline, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo.

Micheline is 31 years old and is married to a carpenter named Mark. They have two children, of whom one attends school and both are under their care.

Micheline has not attended school. For the past twenty years, Micheline has been producing cassava flour (made from cassava roots), which she sells in the region. Alongside this activity, Micheline sells palm oil and petrol in her neighborhood. This allows her to share responsibility for all household expenses with her husband. Micheline gets her supplies from a village in Benin.

This is the first time Micheline and other members of the Fifonsi group seek a credit from ALIDé. This credit loan will allow them to strengthen their business and increase turnover to better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: Buy cans of palm oil, petrol and bags of cassava.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase three bales of maize flour, two bales of wheat flour, sugar and beans for resale. In the future, Saumu aspires to continue improving her business.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Saumu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase three bales of maize flour, two bales of wheat flour, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Khaka Group

texts.en:
Samson is the facilitator of the Khaka group. Samson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samson takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samson had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Samson was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Samson will educate his children and repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Khaka group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

the picture shows Samson and his group with the field officer far right.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine operates a food stall to earn a living.  The 39-year-old lady is married and has two children, aged 4 and 7.  Catherine has employed two people to assist her in her business.  She works hard in her business so as to improve her living standards.  She has requested for 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 36-years-old and is married with two children. He is a firewood seller and has been in the business for the last four years. He gets a monthly profit of about KES 10,000.

The client was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kes 30,000 which he plans to use to add more stock of firewood for selling. The client will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family. 

In future, Mathew hopes to grow his business and have his own fired wood depot and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fire wood stock for sale.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de SIDO, préfecture de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des produits cosmétiques, de mèches, etc.
CHATA, qui est la présidente du groupe ayant un paquet de mèche tendu dans ses deux mains sur la photo, compte acheter avec son prêt, 400 paquets de mèche de diverses qualités avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de SIDO à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour entretenir les enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the DEMBAGNOUMA group are all married, are aged on average twenty-six years, and have on average three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Sido, in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are at their eighth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The group of women does business selling cosmetics, hair extensions, etc.
Chata, who is the president of the group, with a packet of hair extensions in her hands in the photo, counts on buying 400 packs of hair extensions from the wholesalers in Bamako with this loan, which she will then sell retail, for cash and for credit, in the Sido market to a clientele essentially made up of women. 
She imagines making an average monthly profit of 50,000francs, of which one part will be used to look after her children and the other part will be invested in her occupation.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.ru: Угул 59 лет. Она жительница города Худжанд. Угул развелась с мужем. Она живет вместе сыном, невесткой и внуками. Сын в городе занимается таксистом. Угул серьезная и талантливая женщина. Она любит готовить и у нее золотые руки. Угул хочет начать свою любимую делу. У нее имеется столовая, где она хочет заниматься поваром. Но ее столовая без ремонта. Угул за счет кредита решила купить стройматериалы и отремонтировать столовую, чтобы скорее начать новое дело. Но у нее нет денег для завершения данной операции. На оставшуюся часть кредита Угул хочет приобрести приборы  для приготовления пищи. Она очень нуждается на Вашу помощь. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Ugul is 59 years old.  She is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is divorced from her husband.  She lives with her son, her daughter-in-law, and her grandchildren.  Her son works as a taxi driver in town.  Ugul is a serious and talented woman.  She loves to prepare dishes and she is a very good cook! She wants to start a business doing what she likes best.  She is planning to open a cafeteria and to start working as a cook.  She is taking a loan to renovate a cafeteria.  With the extra money, she has decided to buy some utensils for the preparation of dishes.  She really needs your help.  This loan will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Для купли стройматериалы для ремонта столовая, и  для приборы приготовления пищи.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal aged 41 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 1 and 14 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Silvia Yamileth

texts.en: My name is Silvia L. and I own a food business that sells items such as chicken tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, steak burritos, salads and various special plates.  I have had my business for five years, and it is located in front of a factory where many of my customers work. My goal is to increase my inventory so that I can cover the high demand for my products. With the profits from my sales I hope to be able to rent a space for my family so that we can set up a permanent cafeteria and continue to support ourselves.

loans.use: To purchase meat, chicken, tortillas, fruit, vegetables, rice, salt, sugar, bread, cheese, chile, bags, plates, cups, silverware, beans and butter for my food business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel operates a phone use service in her surbub. She is a long-standing client of Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH lending skills training. Mabel requires $950 to improve her business operations.

loans.use: Mobile and Accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of hibiscus for processing and selling soft drinks

loans.name: Yanina Berenice

texts.es:
Yanina Berenice is married and she has a little girl. Her husband works in construction, but his salary is not enough to cover the basic necessities for the family. Since Yanina is an entrepreneur by nature, she decided to start her own business by opening up a bakery. She specializes in baking cakes for any occassion. Due to her passion for baking, she has acquire many clients. She wants to offer to her clients only the best and high quality products.

In order to increase her production and to continue growing, Yanina is requesting a loan in the amount of $375 USD which she will use to purchase baking cookware and baking ingredients. She hopes to fulfill all her cake orders and to continue to offer the best customer service. She will repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by helping this family! They greatly appreciate your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanina Berenice es casada y tiene una pequeña hija, su esposo se trabaja en una refaccionaria pero el salario que obtiene es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, como Yanina es una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio elaborando pasteles caseros, su gusto por este oficio le ha permitido realizar un muy buen trabajo y ganar muchos clientes, ofreciéndoles productos de excelente calidad.

Para incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio Yanina está solicitando un crédito de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de utensilios de cocina e insumos, con esto espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar ofreciendo un buen servicio, ella regresará esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients and baking cookware

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en: I am from a small town in Pakistan and have been living here for many years. I am a housewife and have eight children, three girls and five boys. Three of my children have completed their education and are currently working, but the other five are still in school. Three years back, my eldest sons started his own book binding business with another partner and he is doing quite well. Now, my son is planning to diversify his business and wants to include copies and pencils in his small store. Therefore, he needs a loan to purchase stock of copies and pencils.

loans.use: diversify the book binding business to include stationary

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate N. lives in Nansana, a rural village on the outskirts of Kampala Uganda. Her home is located off a small path that wanders past babies and children playing with mothers close by visiting with neighbors. Often the women gather on rolled out mats on the concrete stoops of their homes.

Kate is 50 years old, single, with 3 children and 2 dependents. On a bench in front of her home, she sells matooke ( a banana in the plantain family), onions, tomatoes and kyangwe, which is grown on vines in trees and is used as a scrub sponge when bathing. Across from where this picture was taken is a small plot of land, 20’ x 10’ where Kate grows her matooke. Under the banana trees she raises pumpkins. And within sight she has a space for pigs.

Kate would like one day to have enough matooke from her garden to sell as a wholesaler, but for now she plans to use her loan to buy more seeds and plants for her garden, so she can increase her produce for sale.

loans.use: Kate plans to use her loan to buy more seeds and plants for her garden. She will then sell the produce at her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Mr. Paul N. is 42 years old, married and has 5 children.  He lives in Benin City.  He sells cooked food and drinks to people living in his community.  He is a dedicated LAPO member and he needs a loan of $250 to buy more foodstuffs for  cooking food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S., 40, is a mother of four children and work selling various kinds of fruits to the people in her community. She earns about $ 5 each day in revenue from this activity. Her husband is currently unemployed, which means that Mrs. Heng S. has to cover all the expenses of her family, including her children's tuition. With the small amount of income she makes it is difficult to meet her family’s needs. To help ease their troubles, Mrs. Heng S. has requested this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he will be able to generate more income for the family by operating  a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he may operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Katwe A(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan K.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to buy more clothes. Suzan is 26 years old and is married with a husband who has a butcher's shop. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a residential house. Suzan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more clothes and the loan was paid back on time.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Fatuma K., Joy W. and Fida T.. Fatuma K. has a business selling fabrics and wants to add more stock. Joy W. is currently operating a bar business and wants a loan to add furniture and purchase a television. Fida T. operates a business in used clothing sales and wants to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To add capital to clothing business and to increase clothing purchases

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena started her business selling new and semi-new clothes 15 years ago with a small nest-egg she had, selling a few pieces in order to improve her household’s economic situation which at that time was very precarious as her husband works in transport and earns a low salary, and also to assure a dignified future for her 3 children which at that time were adolescents and are now 30, 25 and 24 years old.

She is asking for a loan of $1150 USD which she will repay in 6 months in order to remodel her office/store space and renovate the sales area to improver the level of service offered to her customers. She trusts that with your support she will be able to make these improvements.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

María Magdalena inició el negocio de venta de ropa nueva y seminueva hace 15 años con un pequeño ahorro que tenia vendiendo pocas piezas para mejorar la situación económica en su hogar ya que en ese momento era muy precaria ya que su esposo es transportista y percibe un sueldo bajo, además de asegurar un futuro digno a sus 3 hijos, que en ese momento eran adolecentes ahora tienen 30, 25 y 24 años.

Ella solicita US $1,150 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y acondicionar un área de ventas para mejor la atención a sus clientes. Ella confía que con tu apoyo podrá realizar estas adecuaciones.

loans.use: Rennovate office/sales area

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.en: Ana Daisy is an entrepreneur who works extremely hard to support her two daughters, who are 8 and 13 years old, respectively. Ana recently started a small business where she sells jewels, and she operates this business from her home. Ideally, she would like to operate her business out of a separate location, but she will accomplish that goal down the road. She is hereby seeking a loan to buy a collection of new items to add to her stock in order to hopefully increase her sales volume and to thereby generate greater revenue. In turn, she believes that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of additional jewels for a small business.

loans.name: Marcelina Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs Marcelina Antonia is requesting her second loan that she will invest in improvements in her house. She is changing the roof and a door of her home. She obtains her revenue from her local grocery store. She is a hard-working woman who has the support of her husband. He is a cattle merchant and a bricklayer, and he supports the family expenses every month. She has a young child who is in elementary school. She works every day with lots of effort and love to be able to fulfill her dream, which is to obtain better life conditions and to have better options in society. This lady has an enterprising spirit with her life and family. Her family is very humble and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcelina Antonia esta solicitando su segundo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda para poder realizar el cambio del techo y de una puerta de su vivienda, esta clienta obtiene ingreso de su pulperia, es trabajadora, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que es comerciante de ganado y albañil, quien mensualmente aporta para los gastos familiares; tiene un niño menor de edad que estudia educación primaria en la colonia San Juan, realiza su actividad con mucho cariño y amor para poder cumplir su sueñor que es obtener mejores condiciones de vida y tener mejores opciones en la sociedad, esta señora tiene espíritu de emprededora con su vida y su familia, su familia es muy humilde y responsable.

loans.use: Change the roof and a door in her house.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin L., 58, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Tob Tang, and their five children. She works  in the fields as a farmer as she has done for the last 28 years, typically making US$1.50 each day, while her husband raises ducks and makes US$2.50 each day. She has asked for a loan of US$600 to expand her husband’s business and to hire a farmer to work her land. With US$400 she would like to purchase some more ducks for her husband to raise and sell in the market, leaving her US$200 to hire a farmer to work her field. She is an elderly woman who has concerns about her health and would not like to spend too much time out on the farm. She believes these two investments can both increase her family’s daily income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase ducks; hire farmer to work land

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 49 years old. She is a widow with 6 children aged between 2 and 21. She also takes care of a 70-year-old person. She has been a seller of snacks since 1993. Every day, she works from 6 AM to 4 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Tatu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Mrs. Pao N. was born in 1956 and she now lives in Lvea Sor Kandal Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small store in the local market, where she sells clothes. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Pao N. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell to her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Erm Sroeurn, is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at better price. Mrs. Pao N. has two children. One is employed in a garment factory and can earn around $50 per month. The other helps her with her current business. Mrs. Pao N. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una gran mujer, a lado de un gran hombre, a quien ayuda en sus labores de agricultor, aúnan esfuerzos para salir adelante económicamente por el bien de su familia, sobre todo por su pequeña niña.Este  trabajo obtuvo más  participación de Julia cuando su esposo fue brutalmente atacado por un toro luego de regresar de su chacra, lo dejó gravemente herido y tuvo que ser llevado al hospital de la cuidad más cercana, donde podían atenderlo, afortunadamente no tuvo complicaciones mayores, pero fueron como dos semanas donde su esposo no podía levantarse, fue ahí donde Marina asumió la responsabilidad del cuidado de sus chacras. Desde entonces, ambos trabajan en sus terrenos y ambos desean poder progresar como agricultores para brindar lo necesario a su pequeña hija y es por ella que se animaron a solicitar un préstamo, para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos. Esta pareja espera que puedan ayudarles a cumplir con su deseo.
texts.en:
Julia is a great woman, next to a great man, who helps in his work as a farmer. They join forces to succeed economically for the good of their family, especially for their small daughter. This work took more participation from Julia when her husband was brutally attacked by a bull after returning from his ranch. It left him seriously injured and he had to be taken to the hospital in the nearest city where they could take care of him. Fortunately, he did not have any major complications but there were two weeks when her husband could not get up, and it was then that Julia took over caring for their ranches. Since then, they have both worked in their fields and both want to be able to progress as farmers to provide what is necessary for her small daughter and it is for her that they are encouraged to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer for their land. This couple hopes that will help them fulfill their desire.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for their crops

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 39 años, vive con su madre y con su hijo. Desde hace 3 años decidió tener su granja de cuyes, con la finalidad de venderlos y obtener las ganancias que requiere, su madre fue quien dio la iniciativa, con el paso del tiempo, se dio cuenta de esta era una buena opción de desarrollo para ella y su familia. Cada día va a recoger el pasto de sus tierras para dárselo a sus cuyes, siempre está al pendiente del crecimiento y de las nuevas crías, para lo cual hace un cuidadoso y estricto control, luego los vende de acuerdo a su peso, el crecimiento de su granja se dio por la constante dedicación de Isabel, tiene cerca de 360 cuyes, esto le genera buenas ganancias, es por ello que sigue dedicándose al cuidado de su granja de cuyes.  La mayor motivación para Isabel es su hijo, ella desea a poyarlo hasta que sea profesional. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de corrales de madera, ya que en su granja está aumentando la población de cuyes. En el futuro, quiere ser una granjera de éxito.
texts.en:
Isabel, 39, lives with her mother and her son. Three years ago she decided to undertake a guinea pig farm, with the goal of selling them for the income she needs. Her mother gave her the impetus, and over time, she has realized that this is an excellent means of development for herself and her family. She goes out every day to gather grass from her lands to feed her guinea pigs. She is always on the lookout for growth and for new litters, keeping careful and strict control, then she sells them by weight. The growth of her farm is the result of Isabel's constant dedication, now up to about 360 guinea pigs, generating a good income. This is why she continues to make her living from her guinea pig farm. Isabel's first motivation is her son, whom she would like to support until he becomes a professional. She is requesting this loan to purchase wooden pens for the increasing stock of guinea pigs. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wooden pens for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Avria

texts.ru: Рахмонова Аврия жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 24 года. Не замужем. Живет у родителей. Семья очень большая и , чтобы ее прокормить нужно много работать. Она занимается бизнесом . Имеет торговую точку на рынке , небольшой столик , где продает продукты питания. Кредит планирует получить для того,, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцкв.
texts.en:
Avria R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 24 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Her family is very big and they have to work hard to sustain it. She does her own business and has her own vendor space on the market, a small table where she sells food products. Avria plans to get a loan to increase commodity circulation. She plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario LAS DIVINAS esta compuesta por 5 miembros ellas pertenecen al barrio buena vista  de la comunidad de Nindiri además de ser vecinas ellas son amigas y siempre han trabajado juntas, unas a las otras se ayudan en la comercialización de sus productos.
Doña Jessica es la coordinadora  ella elabora tortillas todos los días en dos turnos por la mañana y por la tarde, es madre soltera de 3 hijos los que le ayudan en la elaboración de productos 
Este grupo nace de la necesidad de hacer crecer sus negocios para obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su nivel de vida, ellas se sienten agradecida  tanto de los créditos como de las capacitaciones que ha recibido a lo largo de dos años, en los que ha visto crecer y florecer su negocio. Sus mayores sueños es tener una tortillería en su casa para trabajar todo el día. Producir lo suficiente para que sus hijos  vivan en  buenas condiciones. 
Están mas que  clara que para lograr su sueño necesita ser puntual con sus créditos con ADIM.
texts.en:
The group The Divine is comprised of five members who live in the Buena Vista neighborhood of the Nindiri community. They are both neighbors and friends, and they have always worked together and helped each other sell their products. Jessica is the coordinator; she makes tortillas every day in two shifts - the morning and the afternon. She is a single mother of three children who help her bake her products. This group was born out of the necessity to grow their businesses through loans to improve their lives. The women are grateful for both the loans as well as the training they have received over the past two years, through which they have seen their businesses grow and flourish. Jessica's greatest dream is to have a tortilla shop in her home so she can work all day and earn enough so that her children can have good living conditions. These women are more than clear on the fact that in order to realize their dreams, they need to make their loan payments in time to Kiva partner ADIM.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow the businesses and earn more profits

loans.name: Azra M.nawaz Group

texts.en:
Azra baji is the wife of M. Nawaz and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 16 years. She is 53 years old and the mother of six kids: four sons and two daughters. Her oldest son works in a workshop. The others are receiving an education from a school which is located near the house. Azra baji’s husband sells gentleman's shoes from a cart. As everybody knows that winter season has started and he has already sold his warm shoes collection. Azra baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a new loan so that her husband can restock his shoe inventory.

Azra baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Sugran baji is requesting a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business. Bashiran baji is requesting a loan to buy decorative vases to sell. Shahida baji and Nasreen baji each are requesting a loan to buy bangles for their bangle selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib was born in 1955. He lives in Baku city and has worked the in construction supplies business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy construction supplies for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
A comfortable life is what Helen wants for her children.  Therefore, she is striving to attain her goals by working patiently and diligently.  She is 33 years old and married to Carlito, who is working as a farmer.  They are blessed with two children named Hannah - 8 years old, and Carl - 1 year old.  Helen is always looking forward to the future of her children.  At present, they live blissfully in Manano, Mallig, Isabela. 

Helen is operating a “talipapa”, the common name for a vending stall of meat, fish, vegetables and some pieces of fruit.  The business is located in front of their house.  She decided to engage herself in this line of business to support her husband in providing for the needs for their family, especially for their children’s education. 

Helen is earning a net income of 700 pesos per week, which maintains her vending as a major source of income.  To run her business better, Helen wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP4, 000, which will be used in purchasing other kinds of vegetables that are nutritious and are not easily spoiled.  Helen hopes to set up a business stall in the market.  However, due to lack of financial support, she just patiently operates in their village.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian K. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lilian is 39 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Mrs. Niza A. is 58 years old and a resident of Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband,  Alfredo, is a fisherman. The couple is blessed with 5 children. 


Niza and her husband started this business last year, buying and selling seashells and sea cucumbers.  Niza is one of the founding members of Jackfruit 2 Center in Punta Sulong, Baliangao, and continues to be a member in good standing.  She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative's micro-finance program in April 2004, and has used the credit services offered by the program 14 times. This loan request is her fifteenth, for Php 14,900.00 to expand her existing business. 


For Niza and her husband, Paglaum has contributed to her family's success.  Three of her children have finished their courses as a result of Paglaum's support for tuition fees.  With this loan,  the couple wishes to expand their business so that their other two children can also finish their college degrees.  Niza adds that while she is still a member of the Paglaum cooperative, she will do her part as a member so that she can have the opportunity to use its programs and services to support her family's dreams of educating their children.

loans.use: Expand buying and selling of seashells

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Amanda tiene 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanas y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace un año tiene una tienda, aprovechó la oportunidad de que su domicilio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada, en una carretera central y constantemente acuden a consumir sus productos los transportistas y viajeros. Sus vecinos también compran en su tienda, por ello, cada día se levanta temprano para atender a sus clientes, los fines de semana sale a comprar algunos productos de su mercadería para abastecerse con lo necesario de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes. Para más adelante Amanda desea implementar su tienda para ser tipo minimarket. Esta es la primera vez que Amanda está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy  entusiasmada con el trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, ya que es su primera experiencia, pero tiene expectativas positivas. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en gaseosas, dulces y fideos para su tienda, de esa manera incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Amanda is a 29-year-old woman who lives in her parents’ home with her sisters and her 3 children. She has owned a general store for a year. She took advantage of the fact that her house is located in a very busy area by a central highway that travelers and truck drivers alike constantly frequent to purchase her products. Her neighbors also shop at her store, which is why she gets up very early everyday to attend to her customers. On weekends she goes out to purchase goods to restock her store with everything her customers need. In the future, Amanda would like to convert her store into a mini market. This is the first time that Amanda requests a loan from MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about working in a solidarity group in her microfinance institute. Because it is her first time in a group, she has high expectations. The money will be invested in purchasing goods such as soft drinks, candy, and noodles for her store, so that she can increase her business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati L. is 44 years old. She is married and has seven children, four sons and three daughters. Fati says some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer. 
Fati is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetables: tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs (similar to eggplant), etc. She sells her produce on a table top in the market square. She procures her vegetables from farmers in nearby communities at a good price. Fati has been in business for more than 20 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A., 51, is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns ~2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku Frieda is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials. Kaku is 40 years old and is widowed. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a big bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase brewing materials

loans.name: Ni Kadek Suci Astini

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Suci Astini - (DNR.M-0582) is a 25 year-old female living in the town of Palasari - Melaya. She is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To making a living, Ni Ketut Suci Astini owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Suci Astini has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 150,000 Indonesian rupiahs (about $15 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Suci Astini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Suci Astini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 rupiahs from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 rupiahs which will be used to purchase additional animals. The loan will be the second loan she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Ketut Suci Astini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Suci Astini - (DNR.M-0582) merupakan 25 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Palasari - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Suci Astini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Suci Astini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Suci Astini menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Suci Astini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Suci Astini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli hewan tambahan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Suci Astini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
H., 58, is a widowed mother of five children. Two of her children are married and live separately, and the other three live at home and attend school. She plants different kinds of vegetables behind her house and grows rice on the farmland she inherited from her parents in 1980.

She owns a rice-milling machine that serves the whole village, and this supports the family with reliable income. In addition, the eldest son of the children still at home sometimes works part-time to help the family.

Recently, H. has had some difficulty with her machine, which endangers her primary source of income. For this reason, H. has decided to take on a loan of $300 to repair her rice-milling machine.

Her main goal is for the rest of her children to pursue their educations and finish university.

loans.use: To repair her rice-milling machine.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 29-year-old father of one who runs a transport business in Nairobi. He is requesting his third loan of 80,000 KES, having successfully repaid two previous loans. He intends to spend his loan money on vehicle repairs. James desires to raise a happy family and give his children the best education possible. He also hopes to own a cab company. James describes himself as sociable and ambitious.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To repair his vehicles

loans.name: God Help We Group

texts.en:
This is Makuta T., Matenneh C. and Kadiatu K.. They are businesswomen in Waterloo small-town, twenty miles from Freetown city. They named their group God Help We. This will be the first loan these women are receiving from SMT, a Partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, these women will be able to add more goods to their businesses make better profit and consequently improving their standard of living.

Makuta T. (middle) is the leader of the group. Makuta was born in Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is now approximately fifty years of age. She is married to a motor-driver and the two have four children together. Three of her children are now married and is in class one. Makuta sells cigarettes, matches, milk, coco, sardine, butter, chewing gums, mints etc.  She has been a businesswoman since childhood days palm-oil, the most popular cooking oil in wholesale. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar vive en casa de su suegra en la calle las flores de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una niña pequeñita, la actividad que el realiza es la de chapería por tal razón instaló un taller en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas (martillos, combos y soldadores) y de esta manera dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Es cliente de Impro  desde el año 2008 y tiene un buen historial de pagos, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in his mother-in-law's house on Flores Street in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. He has a young daughter. His business is car repair, which is why he has set up a workshop on Avenue Jaime Freyre in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He is soliciting a loan in order to buy tools (hammers, kits, and soldering irons) and thus provide better service to his clients. Cesar has been a client of Impro since 2008, and he has a good record of repayment, which is why he has been able to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra herramientas, comoser martillos, combos y soldadores para su negocio de chapería.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is 46 years old and she is married with four children. She sells frozen foods and kerosene. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and she says that the loan will go a long way to lift her business above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Henrrita Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Henrrita II es nuevo miembro de Adim y esperan con este primer préstamo seguir progresando. Las integrantes son Egna María L. Valdivido a  de 32 años quien vende ropa al comienzo ella compra pequeños encargos pero cuando fue creciendo empezó a comprar según colocaba. 

Las otras integrantes son Erika P., ella vende frijoles cocidos, helados, chocobananos y hielo y Alicia M. vende gaseosa, caramelos y chiverías.
texts.en:
The Henrrita II group is a new member of Adim. They hope that with this new loan they will keep progressing. One member is Egna María L. Valdivido, 32. She sells clothes. In the beginning she bought small orders. But, as the business was growing, she started to buy according to what she could sell. Erika P. is another member. She sells cooked beans, ice cream, chocolate bananas, and ice. The other member is Alicia M.. She sells soft drinks, candy, and yogurt.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Arlyn and her family make most of their income from farming. She is 32 years old, married and has four children: Jefferson, 12 years old and an elementary school student; Jenilyn, nine years old; Mica, seven years old; and Allysa, four years old. They live happily in the village of Rizal Santiago City. Arlyn would like to improve and expand a small business selling cosmetics. She started this business as a way to increase her income from farming, which is not enough to support her family. She has applied for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy additional products to sell, and also to buy supplies for her rice farm.

loans.use: to expand a business selling cosmetics

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia H. vive en alquiler, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Julia es costurera, elaborando deportivos para una empresa que le da el material de trabajo y su esposo es empleado en una tornería de la ciudad de El Alto. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una maquina de coser, que le permita mejorar su producción y sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia H. lives in Alquiler, in the Pasankeri zone, on the west side of the City of La Paz. She is a seamstress who makes sportswear for an enterprise that provides the work material. Her husband is employed in a lathe shop in the City of El Alto.

The loan she solicits is to buy a sewing machine, which will permit her to improve production as well as her income.

This is the first time she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis that has been done qualifies the couple favorably, enabling them to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A SEWING MACHINE TO IMPROVE PRODUCTION AND RAISE HER INCOME

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana, thirty-six years of age, is married and the mother of three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing.

Joana is a petty trader. She sells bags of cement. She sells in a store by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Accra. According to Joana, she has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: G. Tungalag is 37 years old and lives with her parents in a house in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Both of her parents are retired. She operates a clothing trading business out of a rented stall at a local market. Tungalag started her business in 2008 and has established herself well in the local business community over the last year and a half. With her hard work, she has increased her working capital to a level exceeding 1,250,000 tugrugs (~880 USD). Tungalag has many plans for the future and is working diligently to expand and improve her business. She hopes to one day own her own workplace. She says, "My goal for the future is to provide quality products and grow my customer base." Tungalag is requesting a 1,350,000-tugrug loan to purchase clothes from China to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Satou Ibou

texts.fr: Satou Ibra F. est une femme de 47 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine depuis plus de 3 ans. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et d'aider à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Satou Ibra F. is a woman of 47 years. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for three years. She has worked in the fattening of cattle for over three years. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and help to support her family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her business

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mrs. Math S., 40, and her husband, 37, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Mekong river. They wake up at dawn every day to gather the fish from their nets which they put in the water the night before. After that they re-set the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon.

After gathering the fish from the river, Math S. hurries to the market so that she can sell at a suitable price. If she has some fish left over, she will turn them into dried fish or fish paste. Because Math S.'s house is located along the river, it is affected by flooding and also needs repair. Math S. requested her second loan to buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house

loans.name: Pan

texts.en: Pan V., is thirty-one years old and is married. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of producing silk products, earning an income of approximately US $1.30 per day. By doing this, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially for her children’s education. She has been in this business since 2001. Her husband is a construction worker; he earns an income of US $4.50 per day. The family's standard of living has improved since V. began working in this business, so she is requesting a loan to expand her business. V. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase pigs to raise at home when she is not at work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe A. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Felipe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Felipe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Felipe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of relatives and other family members. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “Juntos Para el Éxito” se encuentra ubicada en el distrito D. El Agustino, departamento D. Lima; está conformado por 10 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, están iniciando L. experiencia D. trabajar con  EDAPROSPO – prosperidad. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades D. producción, comercio y servicio.
María natural D. Huancavelica quien es socio del grupo y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 24 años, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo D. 2 años D. edad, se dedica al comercio D. prendas D. vestir desD. hace 3 años; anteriormente realizo trabajos D. vendedora en una tienda, y fue así como se inicio debido a L. necesidad que había en su hogar, además se dedica a L. venta D. anticuchos por las noches (ayuda a su suegra), con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria María ha mejorado su vivienda y ha logrado comprar un televisor y un equipo D. sonido. Sus ingresos cubren los gastos D. alimentos y lo que le queda lo invierte en su negocio. El gran sueño D. María es tener un local granD. D. ropa. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en L. compra D. mercadería para cubrir L. demanda D. sus clientes.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En L. foto los niños son hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
The communal collective “Juntos para el Éxito” (Together for Success) is located in the district of El Agustino in the Department of Lima. It is comprised of 10 enthusiastic and entrepreneurial members who are beginning to experience working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperity. Its members perform diverse activities of production, both of traD. and service. Maria is a member of the group and takes her turn to assume the office of president. She is 24 years old, lives with her partner and has a 2 year old son. She has worked in the garment traD. for 3 years. Earlier, she worked as a salesperson in a store. She started working due to the need that existed at home. She also works at night helping her mother-in-law selling “anticuchos” (small skewered pieces of grilled meat). Through her daily efforts Maria has improved her home and has managed to buy a television and a stereo. Her income covers the food bill and what remains is invested in her business. Maria’s great dream is to have a large, local clothing store. Her most recent loan was used to buy merchandise to meet the demand from her customers. All our member appreciate the support given them and are committed to making their payments on time. (The children in the photo are the members’ children.)

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to meet demand

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro trabaja como albañil; la esposa es artesana y teje aguayos de lana, mismo que son comercializados en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto (aguayos son mantas que tienen varios usos, como ser manteles, o pequeñas camas, etc.); Estas dos actividades generan sus ingresos principales con los que cubre la manutención de su familia, que consiste en dos hijos.

Vive en casa ubicado en la zona Ciudad Villa Tunari – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  material de construcción (estuco, pinturas) con lo que podrá comenzar a trabajar en la obra fina de su casa.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Teodoro.
texts.en:
Teordoro works as a bricklayer. His wife is an artisan, and she weaves “aguayos” from wool. ("Aguayos" are blankets that have various uses such as tablecloths or small beds, etc.) They are sold in the popular fairs in the city of El Alto. These two activities generate their primary income, which covers supporting their family. They have two children. He lives in a house located in the Villa Tunari – Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction material (stucco, paints) so that he will be able to start the finishing work on his house. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies Teodoro for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stucco and paints to start the finishing work on his house

loans.name: Charmalou

texts.en:
Charmalou U. is from the village of Miputak. She is 29 years old. Charmalou is married, has 1 school-aged child and 1 infant child. To make a living, Charmalou owns & operates an agricultural business raising pigs for sale. Charmalou has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2008, Charmalou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Charmalou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pigs needed to make products for sale. Charmalou is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Charmalou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Paulino, él  tiene 42 años de edad es casado y tiene  4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos tienen  15 y 13 años de edad, Nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, nuestro socio tiene terrenos de cultivos y también tiene 3 toritos y una vaca; él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para sus tierras y comprar una vaquita.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate, Mr. Paulino belongs to the Communal Bank "Pacaha Illariy." Our associate lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province, in the state of Cusco. Our associate is Mr. Paulino. He is 42 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are 15 and 13 years old. Our associate is devoted to agriculture and cattle. He has cultivated land, 3 young bulls and a cow. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizing agenda and fertilizer for his land, and to buy a calf. Our associate appreciates and values the help provided by these means, and he promises to complete payment of his debt by the established deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his land and to buy a calf

loans.name: Biléyor

texts.en: This woman sells maize and other cereals out of her home. She has requested a loan of 150,000 CFA in order to purchase sacks of grain and pay for their transportation. She started her business in 2007. The income she receives helps her to raise her only child on her own. This is her first micro-loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of grain

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a member of Prosper group in Faulu Kenya. He sells shoes and saves part of his income with the group. He started this business five years ago, after he left his job as a casual laborer. He gets more income from the business than from his previous job. He also does quarrying for more income. Antony’s living standard has improved and he bought a motorbike for transporting his goods.

With the loan of Kes.50,000, he plans to add to his stock of shoes. Antony is married and blessed with two children.

loans.use: To add shoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children from Lebanon. She has been selling a selection of food products from her home for the past 5 years and has 15 years of experience in food production. She also sells Lebanese olives and oils. She is well known in her town and its surroundings for the delicious products she prepares. Thanks to her business income, she is able to help her husband with the family expenses. 

She is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a big quantity of milk to produce Lebanese dairy products to satisfy the demands of her clients in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: buy a big quantity of milk to produce Lebanese dairy products

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 58 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 6 children between the ages of 12 and 30. Four of his children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya, where he has been farming for 20 years. He has two employees and he sells his milk, vegetables, maize, cassava, millet and fish to the local market. He solely depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the family's needs. His biggest challenge has been the high cost of dairy feed which makes it hard to break even.

Fredrick has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.62,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With this loan, he will be able to increase his milk production and this will earn him more income that will enable him cater for the family's needs. 

He hopes to acquire another dairy cow that will increase his milk production in future. He is grateful to Juhudi for uplifting his economic standards.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida C. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Zenaida owns and operates a business raising cultured vermi-worms (worms used to compost organic waste) to produce fertilizers. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vermi-worms to raise. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
