Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additonal vermi-worms to raise

loans.name: Belibetua

texts.en:
Belibetua is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four children aged between 12 and 30. One of her children still attends school. She has been practising mixed farming for over 30 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea leaves, millet, chicken and vegetables, which she sells at the local market and at the Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also earns income by selling both new and second-hand clothes and operating a kiosk.

Belibetua has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her cereal business. The proceeds from this loan will enable her to educate her child and feed her family well. In the future she plans to open a big retail shop in her locality specialising in East African agricultural goods.  

Her major challenges have been a lack of capital for expansion, bad debtors, pests and diseases which affect her crops and animals.  Nevertheless, she appreciates Juhudi’s partnership and is thankful to them for being part of her family’s lives.

loans.use: to expand her cereal business

loans.name: Nkaiwatei Shadrack

texts.en:
Nkaiwatei Shadrack K. is 23 years old. He is married to Miriam and he is a father of a one-year-old child. He has been raising cattle for the last three years. His target is to buy young heifers during dry season when they are not very costly, then place them on his farm, which he has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season and the bulls have fattened, he sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

He learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy six more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His dream is to become a large-scale farmer raising cattle. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy six more young bulls for fattening to sell latter

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza S. lives with her big family in Tyup village. She is 40 years old and has the status of being the treasurer of the group. Her husband is a farmer. Together they have given birth to six children (3 sons and 3 daughters). The eldest son contributes to the family's income by working in Russia, the second son helps his parents keep house, and the rest of the children are still in school. 

In order to support such a big family, and with the initial sum of 3,000 KGS, the main family members decided three years ago to engage in cattle breeding. By working hard they have managed to increase their stock of cattle. The total sum of their monthly income is about $34. 

The family wants to realize their plan to purchase two calves for their further fattening and resale. In order to make it come true, they need a loan. In the future Nargiza wants to continue to increase their stock of cattle, give education to the children and organize her son’s wedding. 

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Daniel Michael's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the WCSL Primary School, Kalangba village, near Makeni. WCSL Primary School was founded in 1942 by the Weslyan Mission to help educate the children of Kalangba Chiefdom. Currently, the school is staffed with 21 teachers and 422 pupils. This school is proud of the many doctors, teachers and other professionals that have passed through it.

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Daniel M. M. is their leader and headmaster at the school. Daniel, age 53, was born in Kalangba village and has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. He is married and has nine children: four in secondary school, three in college and the rest are now grown-ups and living on their own accord. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay their loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mr. M., leader of this group, has requested this loan in order to pay for the school charges of his children.

Included in this photo is loan officer Mary Y. Conteh, in green, hugging Daniel M. M..

loans.use: To pay school charges for his children

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson P. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 39 years old. Nelson is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelson provides motorela or motorized tricycle transport services to local community members. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nelson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorela. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorela or motorized tricycle

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin C., a widow in Preaek Touch village in Kandal Province, has four children, two of whom are farmers, another a seamstress in a garment factory, and another who assists her in selling groceries. A farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to support her family, Bin also owns a general store in the local village.

This is the season to grow rice, but due to a lack of funds, Bin is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer, with the rest of the loan to be used to buy more groceries and fix the motorbike.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Salesio

texts.en:
Salesio K. is thirty-five years old, married to a business lady, and they have three children aged between ten years old and eight months old. They hope to give their children good education to the university level. His business is located at Mwingi town and is served by the Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. 

Salesio has been selling assorted items which include stoves, bags, radios, suitcases and plastic containers to local people. He has been doing this business for nine years now and has two employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has are financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to add his stock to expand the business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in future. He describes himself as patient, social, aggressive and innovative.

loans.use: Bags, plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” el banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, La socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia trabaja desde hace 8 años en maderera, la socia comenta que ella y su esposo traen maderas por pies cúbicos desde la selva peruana ellos traen camiones de maderas para depositarlo en su maderera, los cubican y los ponen según el tipo de madera y los ofrecen a todos los posibles compradores. La socia nos comenta que en esta oportunidad ella desea viajar a traer una nueva carga y este dinero le serviría para los pasajes y para el combustible del camión que ella alquila para traer la madera desde la selva; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en los pasajes y combustibles para poder trasladar la madera desde la selva de Perú hasta la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian". The community bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Lourdes. She is 34 years old and she is married.  She has three children. She has been in the lumber business for the past 8 years. She and her husband bring lumber in cubic feet from the Peruvian forests. They import truck loads of lumber to stock, measure, and sort according to the type of wood, and sell to the general public. At this time she wants to bring another load of lumber. Funds are to be used to cover the fares and the fuel required for the truck they rent to transport lumber from the forests. She requests a loan to pay for the fares and fuel to transport lumber from the Peruvian forests to the city of Cusco. 

She is very grateful and she values the loan she is being granted. She is committed to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To pay for fare and fuel needed to transport lumber.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La señora Delfina nació  en  Chuquisaca el 25 de diciembre,  es viuda, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores,  ella tiene su parcela en Pampa del Coscal a 32 km de San Luis, ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería en agricultura ella siembra maíz, maní, poroto y todo lo que ella cosecha lo saca a vender al mercado de El Torno, sus hijos le ayudan en el transporte de mercadería, en cuanto al ganado cría ovejas y vaca,  ella hace también queso para vender,  la Sra. Delfina  es primera vez que está sacando crédito, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas para la siembra, también para el preparado de la tierra y esta muy feliz y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Delfina was born in Chuquisaca on the 25th of December, she is a widow, and has two older children. She has farm in Pampa Del Coscal, 32km from San Luis. She dedicates herself to agriculture and ranching. She plants corn, peanuts, and beans, and sells what she harvests in the El Torno market with the help of her children who aid in the transport of her products. In terms of ranching, she also raises sheep and cows, and makes cheese to sell.  This is Delfina’s first time requesting a loan; with this loan she will purchase seeds to plant and also to prepare the land. She is very happy and thankful to institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora Ana C. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la comunidad 24 de Mayo que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 51 años, es viuda hace 8 años y tiene 3 hijos de 32, 29 y 28 años de edad que son casados y viven  independientes. Con el sacrificio de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Ana se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vende  leche a los carros lecheros que existen en el sector o en su comunidad, también se dedica a la cría de animales los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 10 años. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca. Su meta es mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana C. is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in the 24 de Mayo community which is in Cumbe parish.  This parish is notable due to its fields full of crops because its residents are farmers and cattlemen.  Many of its residents find jobs in the city to help household economy.

The member is 51 years old, has been a widow for the last 8 years, and has 3 children who are 32, 29, and 28 years of age, are married and live independently.  Through sacrificing in her work she has managed to build her own house.

She works in farming and cattle raising.  She sells milk to dairy trucks that exist in her community and she also raises small farm animals that she sells whenever she has financial need.

She has been in the communal bank for the last 10 years.  She will use the money from her loan to buy a cow.  Her goal is to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Edgar Jeovanny

texts.es:
Edgar Jeovanny L. B. tiene 28 años de edad, Es soltero vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

 Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Edgar Jeovanny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  estudiar.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edgar Jeovanny L. B. is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his mom in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The JESUS NOS AMA (Jesus Loves Us) community bank is located in Los Amarillos, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Edgar Jeovanny has been growing corn, rice and cacao for 5 years.  He buys his products in Agripac Eicopa and sells his products in Ventanas market.  He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his corn and rice crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to study.

Edgar Jeovanny enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of Faisalabad, a big city in Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mai de jughi. She moved here 17 years ago. Perveen is 45 years old, married to S. A. and has 4 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Perveen is a caring woman, managing her household tasks with great responsibility by staying at home.

Perveen's husband has had a business selling scrap for the past 10 years. He provides scrap material to different factories and to other scrap dealers to earn an income for the family. Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase scrap such as used papers, plastic bottles, iron, etc. in bulk to help him complete his orders and make a good profit. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will have a good impact on the business and will earn her husband more income than before. Perveen is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and who paid her installments on time.

Note: In the photo, the woman raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es: Bethy tiene 25 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Francisco, esta casada con Cipriano de 27 años y tienen 01 hijo llamado Hedrick de 04 años de edad;  juntos viven en su  propia casa  en la comunidad de Palmapampa anexo del distrito de Samugari. Con mucho esfuerzo Bethy y su esposo Cipriano, han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Bethy es agricultora y tiene una extensión de 06 hectáreas de terreno donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y café, que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha Bethy tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Viene trabajando 08 años y es conocedora de sus responsabilidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco lugar donde le  ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao y café. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras e incrementar más plantaciones de cacao. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para realizar las cosechas de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Bethy is 25 years old and a native of the District of San Francisco. She is married to Cipriano, age 27, and they have a four year old son named Hedrick. They live in their own home in the community of Palmapampa Annex in the District of Samugari. Bethy and Cipriano have been able manage the crop rotation on their land to achieve very productive returns. She is a farmer and has a tract of land that contains six hectares where she plants cacao and coffee, products that provide sustainable income. At harvest time, Bethy must hire workers to quickly pick the fruit off the plants. Bethy has been working for eight years and knows her responsibilities. What she enjoys most about her job is caring for her crops since it makes her happy. She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from the field to the city of San Francisco, the place where she is offered the best prices for cacao and coffee beans. Going forward, she wants to buy more land so that she can plant more cacao.

This is her first loan with MFP. Bethy believes this support will greatly help her make progress in her work. She is grateful to Microfinanzas Prisma for granting her this loan. The disbursement of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to pay workers for harvesting her crops.

loans.use: Pay workers to help with her harvest

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Pich, a married woman who was born in 1980, is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members.

She is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mao, is a security guard in a private company. With their jobs they are able to earn small salaries to support their family living. This couple has a child who is attending a local school. 

Currently they do not have their own house, so they rent a house to live in. They want to build their own house, but they do not have enough money to build. Therefore, Pich would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a house.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a house.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia V. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Del Norte. She is 39 years old. Delia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Delia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
The three entrepreneurs in this group all live together in a house in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their fourth loan with ALIDE, following successful past repayments.

Catherine was born in 1969 in Adjibhoun. She moved to her current neighborhood in Cotonou 12 years ago and now lives with her husband Albert and their four children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past 10 years, Catherine has run a stall outside her home, selling various foods and household goods. This loan will enable her to purchase palm oil, rice, soap, and sauces from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to expand her business. She claims her strength as an entrepreneur to be her ability to diversify her business to attract new clients.

loans.use: to restock her stall with palm oil, rice, soap, and sauces

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, who graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is rent. She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

Mary's major challenge in her business, is high cost of transportation.  She dreams of expanding and doing a wholesale charcoal business in future. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will help boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: El Futuro 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Gladis is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future)1 & 2. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Gladis is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a Colmado (a food store selling daily meals). The loan will allow her to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil, etc. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. 

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business and improved it. Her dream is to have a supermarket and to like safe and tranquil at her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is widowed. She owns a retail business selling various agricultural products like seeds, fertilizers, bug killers, etc. Tatyana has a large assortment of products, affordable prices and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Tatyana has been in this business for 17 years. The business is seasonal, with items selling mostly in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Tatyana's goods are in demand. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase seeds in bulk for planting the second crop. She hopes to develop her business further and have more clients who would use her services.

(on the picture Tatyana is with her worker)

loans.use: to purchase seeds in bulk for planting the second crop

loans.name: Chimedtseren

texts.en:
Chimedtseren is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters, who are 10 to 21 years old. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. His youngest daughter attends public school while his middle daughter is a student. Chimedtseren’s wife and oldest daughter work at a local restaurant.

Chimedtseren helps support his family by operating a folding door business. He makes folding doors to sell to retailers. 

When he first began his business in 2005, he didn’t have his own equipment and working capital, but he has since expanded and now he has equipment and a truck, which carries his handmade products, and 800,000 MNT in working capital. He recently purchased his truck with his business earnings so his working capital decreased. 

Chimedtseren is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to increase his working capital to make more folding doors. He says, “I want to improve my business with this loan and to be able to build our own small house, so my daughters and wife can enjoy better living conditions.” 

Chimedtseren is hardworking and responsible. Thus, his main goal is to give high education to his daughters.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making folding doors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es: El señor Hugo Alberto es padre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, uno se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Psicología, otro estudia la preparatoria y la única mujer en secundaria, por lo que esto le genera mayores gastos, pero todo el esfuerzo que hace es para ofrecerles una mejor estudio para que ellos se defiendan en un fututo. Hugo recurre  es cliente puntual en su pagos con este será su tercer crédito donde ha demostrado tener una muy buena cultura de pago y agradece porque de esta manera realiza su proyectos. En este momento se ven en la necesidad de pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos que ya están próximos a pasar al siguiente año escolar. Hugo y su esposa trabajan en la maquiladora y en ocasiones se quedan trabajando tiempo extra para tener un ingreso mas para poder cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
Señor Hugo Alberto is the father of 3 school age children.  One is studying for a career in psychology, another is studying in high school, and the only girl is in secondary school.  Because of this he has higher expenses, but he makes every effort ​​to provide a better education for them so they can have a good future. 

Hugo is a punctual client with his payments.  As this is his third loan, he has demonstrated that he has a very good culture of repayment and he is grateful because in this way he is able to achieve his projects.  At this point he finds himself needing to pay the tuition for his children who are close to moving into the next school year.  Hugo and his wife work in a factory and sometimes work overtime to have more income to cover their expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition expenses.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casad y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida y lo hace por las noches en el patio de su casa, no le quita tanto tiempo ya que todo lo cocina al carbón.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 parrilla más grande, 1 batancito para  que prepare los tacachos (comida típica), 1 saco de carbón., 1 espátula para voltear los asados.
La venta de comida es muy rentable porque las personas por las noche prefiere comer sus asaditos calientitos, Engela está muyu tranquila porque con su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de estudio de su último hijo, quien vive con ellos.
texts.en:
Angela is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" of the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, married, and she has four children. She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for four years. She sells prepared foods in the evenings from the patio of her house. It is not very time consuming because everything is cooked with charcoal.

Her new loan is in the amount of S/3000 nuevos soles and she will purchase: 1 larger sized grill, 1 container to prepare tacachos (a traditional meal consisting of thin roasted meat), 1 sack of charcoal, 1 spatula to flip the roasts.

The sale of prepared foods is very profitable because in the evenings people prefer to eat her hot roasted meals. Angela is very content because she is able to help her husband with the school expenses of their youngest son, who still lives with them.

loans.use: to purcahse a new grill and kitchen implements.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.  Rufina has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & rice per kilogram.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.  Rufina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rufina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Wende La Panganaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Noëlie est la représentante du groupe WENDE LA PANGANAABA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus a âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois.2 vont a l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge. 

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont ceux qui fréquentent le marché ou elle vend et ses voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter une douzaine de pagne et quelques tenues pour bébés.

Mme économise pour s’acheter une moto. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagnes et scolariser ses enfants pour leur assurer un avenir.
texts.en:
Mme Noëlie is the representative of the WENDE LA PANGANAABA group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is nine and the youngest nine months. Two of them go to school, and Noëlie is responsible for seven people in all. 

Noëlie has been selling African print cloth for three years. She buys her wares in the Sector 10 market. Her customers are people going to the market or she sells to her neighbors. She wants to buy a dozen lengths of African print cloth and some outfits for babies. 

She is saving to buy a motorbike. Her ambition is to open a African print cloth store and to have her children attend school to assure their bright future.

loans.use: to buy a dozen lengths of African print cloth and some baby outfits.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. She is a fruit vendor. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years with a monthly income of KES.4,000. 

She is applying for her first loan with which she plans to buy more stock. She hopes to grow her business and to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit

loans.name: Wagne

texts.fr: Madame Wagne est mariée et âgée de 44 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le secteur du commerce. Sa spécialité concerne la vente de produits vestimentaires. Elle capitalise une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Depuis sa tendre enfance  Wagne aidait sa maman et a fini par pratiquer la même activité de commerce.  Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000. Une partie du crédit est prévue pour  s’approvisionner en thioups et l’autre partie sera destiné a renforcer son activité d’aviculture, tout pour les besoins de son commerce en cette veille de ramadan et  korité.  Ce financement lui permettra d’élargir son activité et mais d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Ms. Wagne is married and 44 years old. She lives in Senegal and is active in commerce. Her specialty concerns the sale of clothing. She capitalizes on three years of experience in her business. When she was very young, she used to help her mom. Now she works in the same business. Wagne has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2011. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs. Part of the loan is for stocking up on thioups cloth (dyed fabrics), and the other part will be for bolstering her poultry business. All of this is for business purposes for Ramadan on the eve of the Korité holiday. This financing will enable her to expand her business but also to grow her profits.

loans.use: to buy "thioups" fabrics and hens to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda tiene un puesto de venta de comida. El crédito lo requiere para aumentar capital y comprar al por mayor productos como ser arroz, fideo. papa, carne y verduras. Esta actividad de venta de comida es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa propia  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos. Yolanda se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente y pudo mejorar sus ingresos. Es cliente  de IMPRO desde el año  2010.
texts.en:
Yolanda has a food stand.  She needs the loan to increase her capital and buy such products as rice, noodles, potatoes, meat and vegetables at wholesale.  This food selling activity is the source of income she has to cover her expenses. 

 She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Copacabana zone.  She’s divorced and has three children.  

Yolanda is very satisfied with the loans she got previously and was able to improve her income.  She’s been an IMPRO client since 2010.

loans.use: to buy such supplies as rice, noodles, meat, vegetables and potatoes for her food stand.

loans.name: Magben.comm.hosp.iv Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of medical practitioners from one of the hospitals in Makeni.

They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 8,600,000.00 SLL to invest in projects that their mere salaries alone are not enough to finance. For example, some will use the loan to buy a plot of land or house-building materials, while others will use it to pay their children’s school fees, etc. At the end of each month, they will repay SMT/Kiva using their monthly salaries. Their finance officer is directly responsible for repaying the loan on their behalf.

Fatmata, the leader of this group, is 39 year old, was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone, and is the married mother of four children – two in secondary school and two in primary school. A professional nurse for four years now, she has applied for this loan in order to pay her children’s school fees and invest the rest in her house-building project.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees and contribute to her house-building project.

loans.name: Jean Didier

texts.fr:
Client de HOPE Congo, âgé de 36ans, marié père de 3enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 11 ans.il a commence avec la vente des sacs de voyage et les sacs à main en 2002 quand il ne pouvait plus poursuivre ses etudes.
il est aujourd'hui à son quatrième prêt et a fait preuve  de bonne gestion.
Ses revenus journaliers ont augmentés, il vend 60.000 F par jour et  la valeur nette de son entreprise est estimé à 700.000F environ.
Vu ses recettes, la stabilité de son activité , le prêt actuel lui est accordé, il va renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant : les sacs de voyage, les sacs à dos,   les sacs pour ordinateurs et les cartables , il va aussi mettre les sandales de tout genre pour élargir son commerce.
pour le moment, il, s approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la ville et à Kinshasa.
son objectif est  d'atteindre un fond considérable pour aller s'approvisionner à l'étranger et devenir un grand fournisseur des sacs et des sandales.
En tant que bon père de famille , il soutient  financièrement la scolarité de ses enfants.
les gens le respecte  et le considère par rapport à  son activité.
texts.en: He is a client of Hope Congo, 36 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 11. He began selling suitcases and handbags in 2002 when he dropped out of school. He is now requesting his fourth loan and has proved he can properly manage a business. His daily sales have increased.  He makes 60,000 cfa francs per day and the estimated net worth of his business is about 700,000 cfa francs. With his sales and stable business, the current loan will allow him to increase his inventory by purchasing suitcases, backpacks, computer bags and school bags. He will also buy different types of sandals to increase his sales. At the moment, he purchases his inventory at the large markets in town and in Kinshasa. His goal is to have enough money to purchase inventory abroad and become a wholesaler for bags and sandals. As a committed father, he finances his children's education. He is greatly respected as a business man by others.

loans.use: to purchase suitcases, school bags, and sandals for men, women and children.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais todos são maiores de idade. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Saiu da sua terra natal para distrito de Boane ainda em Maputo, é comerciante ha mais de 18 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.200.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Já teve emprestimos na CCOM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades nenhumas, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada, para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 7.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, ambos para o negocio. 
Pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial e diversificar a sua mercadoria, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Joana was born in the Namaacha district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is divorced and the mother of 4 adult children.  She completed school through the 6th grade but did not continue due to her financial situation.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

She left her homeland for the district of Boane, also in Maputo.  She has been a trader/seller for more than 18 years and earns around 5.200.00mt per month.  She uses this for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (BIM).

She previously had loans with CCOM and was able to pay them back without any difficulties.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase bundles of used clothes, to increase her stock of merchandise.  The first loans were for 7.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt, both for her business.  She plans to construct a shop and diversify the products she sells, and she will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Bình is a 43-year-old woman living in the Yen Phong district of Bac Ninh province. She is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Bình owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Bình has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately VND 5,000,000 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Bình joined Kiva's partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bình has successfully repaid a previous loan of VND 4,256,000 from SEDA. This previous loan was used to renovate the existing shelter for her livestock. Bình is now requesting a new loan of VND 6,048,000 which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the sixth loan Bình has borrowed from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bình là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Bình Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Bình thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bình kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, Bình đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bình đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng nâng cấp chuồng hiện tại cho gia súc của người vay.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua con giống.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Bình dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Gbenonkpo9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO9 est composé de trois membres qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Mahoutin Alexandrine est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Mahoutin Alexandrine est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Ludovic. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Mahoutin Alexandrine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Mahoutin Alexandrine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Depuis onze ans, Mahoutin Alexandrine vend des vêtements de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Mahoutin Alexandrine  vend de la bouillie. Mahoutin Alexandrine s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Mahoutin Alexandrine et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO9 sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO9 group is made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, named Mahoutin Alexandrine, has her hand raised in the photo.  With the goal of increasing their business activity in order to better meet demand from customers, this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the first time.  

Mahoutin Alexandrine is 30 years old and married to a teacher named Ludovic.  The couple has three children, some of whom are in school.  Mahoutin Alexandrine did not go to school. She lives with her husband and children. For the last eleven years, she has been selling clothing on foot. In addition to this business, she sells porridge. She buys her stock in a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening their business activity to better satisfy their customers, Mahoutin Alexandrine and the other members of the GBENONKPO9  group are requesting their first loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children who go to school.  Since 2007 she has had a variety of businesses including a clothing shop, selling cosmetics, hair braids and drinks. She works from 7 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling cosmetics and increase all her businesses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. This loan is to increase her stock of cosmetics.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kichangani" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (pictured above), age 31, is a garment worker. Her husband, Thol, age 30, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2002 and have two young children -- one son and one daughter.  The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophea is asking for her first loan of $250 to add to her own money to buy a new motorbike for her husband to ride to work. Because his old motorbike breaks very often, it is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Kavling Jaya Group

texts.en:
Djuniara is 48 years old. She is married but she doesn't have any children. She has been selling daily basic needs for two years from her house. Her business is going well but she wants to sell more variety of merchandise such as instant noodles, coffee, sugar and rice. That is why she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She hopes she can have her own store and sell more merchandise.

Other group members are using their part of the loan to improve their business, which include selling snacks and selling clothes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 32 years old, married to Joseph. They have two children. She has been in business for the last 4 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She hopes to use the profits to buy more computers for commercial use and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more computers for commercial use.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She sells charcoal in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last three years earning a monthly income of about Kes 9,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her third loan of Kes 20,000, which she intends to use to buy additional stock of charcoal for resale. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children.

In future, the client hopes to grow her business and open her own depot in the local area.

loans.use: To buy stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 47 years old and 2 of her children are in school.

Gemma has a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her 2 children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mauricio Alfredo

texts.es: Mauricio de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su  microbús desde hace 6 años, posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la amabilidad que tiene y  porque es muy responsable a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante a su familia, Mauricio está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar repuestos, llantas y darle mantenimiento a su microbús ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 54, lives in his own house with his life partner and his 3 children. As of 6 years ago, he has been making a living driving his microbus. He has many customers who prefer him because he is a very friendly and responsible driver. With the money makes from this job, he is able to provide for his family.

Mauricio is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL to buy replacements, wheel rims and perform maintenance on his microbus, since this is his only source of work. This way he will be able to continue to provide for his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy replacements, wheel rims and perform maintenance on his microbus.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: Florentine âgée de 42 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Florentine est mariée à un certain Timothée. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florentine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Florentine vend depuis quinze ans dans un marché du Bénin, de l’huile de palme et des chaussures. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Florentine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Florentine sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de l'huile de palme et des chaussures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYES SURGERY

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 45 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 5 and 7 years, Both of them  go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Milton Camilo

texts.en:
My name is Milton S.. I work in the transport of people. I´ve had my business for 5 years. I have two taxis; I work one and my brother works the other. We have lots of good clients since we are located in the taxi stop at the national university. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to better condition my vehicles in order to provide better service to my clients and with the earnings that I obtain to be able to buy another unit and give work to another family member.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Milton S. me dedico a transporte de gente, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo dos taxis uno lo trabajo yo y el otro mi hermano, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estamos ubicados en el punto de taxis de la universidad nacional, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es acondicionar mejor mis unidades para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar otra unidad y darle trabajo a un familiar.

loans.use: Purchase of parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Wangui Lesit intends to expand her business premises and buy about five bags of cereals and other household goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: “I am from Pakistan and have three children. I live in a small conservative town and have trouble working outside my home. My husband used to work as a plumber before, which did not yield much income but then he began providing transport service to people on a Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle). We would like to borrow money to have it repaired. Hopefully the additional income will help make ends meet” Parween B., Pakistan

loans.use: Refurbish Rickshaw

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martin is 45 years old, and married to Bernarda Roja. The couple have three children: the oldest is 20 years old and is a university student, their other son is 16 and is studying at middle-school. Their youngest daughter is 11 and is still in primary school.

In his youth he worked in the Yacyreta hydro-electric plant, where he was able to accumulate capital through saving his money through much personal sacrifice and then establish his own workshop for car electrics. Now he has 20 years experience in the business. His wife cares for a store that operates from their own home which also generates extra income for the family.

One part of the loan will be used to buy spare parts related to his business, which can be obtained for a better price if bought in bulk, and the other part of the loan will be used to purchase merchandise for the grocery-store. In this way, they will increase the family’s income and consequently its members quality of life.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Martín de 46 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Bernarda Rojas. La pareja tiene 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 20 años y es estudiante universitario, otro varón de 16 años que esta cursando la etapa media y una menor de 11 años que sigue en la escuela primaria.

En su juventud trabajo en la hidroeléctrica de Yacyreta, donde se hizo de capital ahorrando su dinero con mucho sacrificio y luego monto su propio taller de electricidad de automóvil. Acutalmente ya cuenta con 20 años de antigüedad en la actividad. Su cónyuge atiende una despensa que funciona en su mismo domicilio que también genera ingresos para la familia.

Una parte del préstamo destinara para comprar repuestos relacionados a su actividad, que comprando en cantidad consigue a mejor precio y otra parte utilizara para adquirir mercaderías de despensa, de esta manera mejorara el ingreso de la unidad familiar y por consiguiente el nivel de vida de sus miembros.

.

loans.use: Purchasing electrical spare parts for cars

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Miss N. Chanthol is currently living with her elderly parents. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 2001 and began her silk production in the same year. Her sister also weaves silk at home with another loom. Her father is in the farming business, and he plants bananas and raises cows in the village. Her mother stays at home.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now, she is asking for a loan of $500. She will use this loan to purchase wood supplies to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood supplies to repair her house.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu S. is single and planning for her future.  A school drop-out, she lives with her elder sister.  She is 25 years old and sells household utensils in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.    Isatu expanded her business with the loan accessed from SMT and will complete her repayment in January, 2008. She is requesting another loan to further expand her home products sales.

loans.use: to grow her business and increase her income from it

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Sara M.. She is married with three children, ages 4, 5, and 9, and has two other dependents who are her niece and nephew. In 2004 Sara established a business selling rice, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Butangala A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fidah N.. She runs a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to change to selling farm produce. Fidah is 23 years old and is married. Her husband works in a restaurant. She has 4 children ranging in age from 1.5 to 8, and only 1 goes to school to school. Each week, Fidah makes approximately 28000 UGX (about $15) profit. With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to be able to repay the loan and cater for home needs. Fidah previously had a loan from BRAC Uganda for 100000 UGX (about $60) to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fidah is joined in her small group by Sarah A., Rose N., and Scovia B.. Sarah A. has a local brewing business and wants to expand her business. Rose N. has a butchery and wants a loan to purchase more animals for slaughtering. Scovia B. sells vegetables and wants to start selling used clothes.

loans.use: To start trading in farm produce

loans.name: Haidarov

texts.ru:
H. Haidarov is a young, 26 years old man and owns a business that sells food. He has 2 children and his wife is a homemaker. After finishing school he went into business with his father. 6 years ago his business separated from his father’s business. Today, H. sells granulated sugar, sugar cubes and candy. He will use his loan to increase his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдаров Хомид молодой человек в возросте 26 лет занимается бизнесом по продаже продуктов питания.Имеет 2 детей ,жена домохозяйка.После окончания школы занимался торговлей продуктов вместе со своим отцом. Затем уже 6 лет как его бизнес отдеился от бизнеса отца.В данное время Хомид торгует сахар песком, комковым сахаром,конфетами .В дальнейшем хочет получив займ увеличить ассортимент.

loans.use: Purchase food for resale

loans.name: Sophois

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophois C. and her husband married in 1997. They have four children; three sons and one daughter.  They are all in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sophois has been selling fish for eight years. She purchases them from a fish wholesaler at Ta Kmao market. Her husband is a policeman who operates a motor taxi in his spare time.

Mrs. Sophois is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchasing fish for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is 37 years old, married and has three children. She sells provisions and drinks. This was the business she learned from her mother. She has five years experience in business. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $450 for her to buy drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
G. Alisher is 27 years old. He is married and has two adorable kids. He is working hard to ensure them the best future. Alisher has 2 years' experience preparing and selling cookies. He began working with a friend delivering bread. With the money he saved, he decided to buy an oven and now his goal is to work as an independent with his wife.

He works daily from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. selling goods, and from 6 p.m. to 2 a.m. preparing it. The business is successful, generating a stable income, allowing Alisher to support his family. Alisher wants the Kiva loan so he can buy products and necessary equipment to prepare extra cookies, because at this time he is only supplying part of his demand.

With this loan, he wants to expand his business to supply all of his customers goods, and also to create better conditions in the business. With this purpose, he requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Alisher would like to thank everyone for supporting him, and promises to repay the loan on time. They are greatful this loan will contribute to the well-being of this family. Help them by contributing to the growth of his business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment for better conditions in the business.

loans.name: Gie Koffy Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of young women living in the ecovillage of Loudia Ouolof.  We invest in the business of fishing products, such as dried fish, oysters and other preserved mollusks (smoked, salted), as well as the resale of fruits, depending on the season.  Our work consists in buying from fishers, women who preserve the fishing products, and farmers that sell their products in bulk, in order to resell these products in the big villages.  

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer. 

Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes qui habitent dans l'écovillage de Loudia Ouolof et qui s'investissent dans le commerce de produits halieutiques comme le poissons sec, les huîtres et autres mollusques transformées( fumés; salés) et aussi dans la revente des fruits selon les saisons. Notre travail consiste à l'achat chez les pêcheurs et les femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques  et aussi chez les agriculteurs qui revendent leur production en gros, pour aller les revendre dans les grandes villes.

loans.use: Buy and Sell Fish and Fruit Products

loans.name: Maryam's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Maryam S. is 34 years old and married with three children, ages 16, 12  and 8. She owns a small restaurant and also sells clothing, which she has been doing since 1998. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $140.
Maryam  now hopes for a loan of $1000 to buy more  restaurant items and clothing for her business. She will share this loan with her group members: Mwanakombo, Zainab, Riziki, Mgeni and Sada.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Lubugumu Twekembe Women's Group

texts.en:
Jane K. is the chairperson of Lubugumu Twekembe women's group that has been in existence for 5 years. She is a married woman with 10 children of whom one is at Makerere University doing a course in banking while the rest are in lower classes. She also helps to cater for school fees for many cousins that stay in the village.

Jane has two businesses. She is a farmer growing mostly bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes as well as making local alcohol to sell to bars around her and in the city centers. With the local brew, she makes waragi and tonto whereby she prepares spear grass that is mixed and mingled with the ripe juice-producing bananas (mabidde). The juice that comes out is put into jerry cans. Sorghum is mixed and covered in a previously dug hole for a week or two and the end result is Tonto. For waragi, the tonto is again put into metal cans and placed on a fire with a tube that connects to two more metal cans from which the boiled tonto moves and is cooled to make waragi.

In a week, Jane can make and sell 10 jerry cans of tonto and 10 of waragi as she also sells to her daily customers who drink at her home. Jane needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas, a metallic can, and firewood for her local brewing business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, a metallic can, and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy second hand clothes and resell them to students and in rural areas

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama C. est âgé de 31 ans et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son épouse et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (une préfecture de  Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons économiques Adama C. devait rester à côté de son père pour l’aider à subvenir aux charges de la famille.  Afin de s’insérer dans la vie active( n’ayant jamais fréquenté l’école), il décida de méner une activité génératrice de revenus notamment le commerce de semences et des produits phyto-sanitaies. En plus de la vente des articles ci-dessus cités, il fait la pulverisation des jardins et des maisons. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un oncle et cela durant deux ans.
Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de rejoindre le programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son premier prêt.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 40 paquets (de sachets de différentes semences et 3 cartons de produits phyto-sanitaires pour la pulvarisation des maisons et des jardins.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de  la république du Mali) auprès des établissements spécialisés dans ce domaine. Avec une clientèle composée de structures étatiques et de particuliers(jardiniers et propriètaires de villas), il effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit.
La rotation de ses affaires  est  élévée et il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour agrandir son entreprise. Il ambitionne devenir un grossiste un jour.
texts.en:
Mr. Aama C. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Torakabougou district of the city of Bougouni (Sikasso prefecture, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For economic reasons, he had to remain at his father's side to help him support the family. In order to enter the working world (having never gone to school), he decided to make an income notably through commerce in seeds and pesticides. In addition to selling the items cited above, he does spraying in gardens and houses. He learned how to do this from his uncle over a two-year period. In his search for supplemental financial resources, he has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which he is on his first loan.

With this loan, he intends to buy 40 packets (bags of different seeds) and 3 boxes of pesticides to spray houses and gardens.

He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) from establishments specialized in this domain. With customers composed of public organizations and of individuals (gardeners and owners of villas), he makes his sales in cash or on credit. His sales figures are high, and he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which will essentially be used to expand his enterprise. His ambition is to become a wholesaler one day.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Wafaei

texts.en:
Wafaei is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Wafaei has been a taxi driver for seven years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to repay his debts. This is the first time that Wafaei has requested a loan.

In the beginning, Wafaei faced some difficulties like finding a good car with red plates and also to find customers. But now he knows when the right time is to find customers. He plans in the future to have another car and improve his income.

loans.use: Wafaei will use the loan to repay his debts

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 53 años de edad, habita en un  barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Memorial Sandino, estado civil casado tiene un hijo de 20 años de edad, los planes para con su familia es terminar de construir su casa ya que le falta poner puertas segura, repellar la pared y embaldosar ya que su piso es de tierra  para que su familia este en mejores condiciones. Don Francisco se desempeña como taxista desde hace diez años que brinda el servicio de trasporte a los diferentes clientes de esta capital. Inicio el negocio con un crédito para comprar su unidad de taxi así adquirió así compro su carro. Sus objetivos en el ámbito empresarial es crecer. Para poder tener recurso para seguir trabajando y poder cumplir la meta de ver a su familia en una casa con seguridad y digna es por  eso que da Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic.  A largo plazo es comprar otra unidad para obtener mejores beneficios
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is 53 years old and live in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called Memorial Sandino. He is married and has a son who is 20 years old. His plans for his family are to finish construction of his home since they lack secure doors, repair the wall, and tile the floor since it is currently exposed dirt, so that his family may live in better conditions. Francisco has been employed as a taxi driver for 10 years through which he provides transportation services to various clients of the capitol. He began the business with a loan to purchase a taxi unit and was able to do so. His goal in business terms is growth. The ability to have the resources necessary to continue working and be able to accomplish his goals to see his family in safe and dignified house is thanks to the loans of Afodenic. Over the long term he hopes to purchase another taxi and obtain higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun R., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making around $3 a day, while her husband works as a rice grower. This year the weather conditions seem good to every farmer, so he hopes to get more output than last year. This couple together has two school-aged children.

Mrs. Sun R. would like to take out a loan to add to her grocery store's inventory to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To add to her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en: Djafar was born in 1963. He lives in Baku city. He has been in the manufacturing business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary materials for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for improving his business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
With her motto in life, “try and try until you succeed”, Delia is more determined to do everything for the sake of her family. She is 40 years old and married to Gerson, a farmer.  Their three children are: Ren Ren - 19 years old, college undergraduate and now helping his father with the farm; May Ann - 16 years old, junior high school student; and Jerwin - 13 years old, freshman high school student. The family has a harmonious relationship and lives happily in Caliguian, Burgos, Isabela.

With her desire to send her children to school to finish their studies and provide them with a comfortable life, Delia decided to start a business to help them with their everyday living. Aside from the income they earn from farming, Delia has been engaged in hog raising for almost ten years and is able to generate a net income of PHP5,000 every four months. She budgets her income to support her children’s education and for some of their household expenses.  

She also plans to renovate and improve their pig pen. In order for her to achieve her plans, she is now requesting a loan of PHP5,000.00. She also plans to buy another piglet to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and renovate the pigpen.

loans.name: Olushola

texts.en: Olushola sells drinks, pepper soup, and dry gin (Ogogoro) in her shop. Olushola is 52 years old, married with 3 children. Olushola has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. Olushola lives in Oke-koto in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks, wine, and pepper soup spice to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup

loans.name: Sadeq

texts.en:
Sadeq J. is a loving father of four children and a dedicated husband.  To earn a living, he operates a grocery store, where he sells vegetables, milk, and soft drinks, among other things.  Little by little, he has expanded the range of goods he offers his customers.  

Now, his micro-enterprise generates a nice stream of income which enables him to support his family.  But he needs to further increase his stock and range of merchandise (e.g., meat, flour, pasta, rice, fruit, vegetables, oil, canned foods, dairy products, bakery products, and beverages) in order to satisfy the ever-growing demands of his customers.  Accordingly, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000.  With your help, Sadeq will be able to continue to take good care of his family.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional merchandise

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina T. and family live in Barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a mother of 4 children. Fishing is their primary activity and source of income. Fishing helps them to withstand business high and lows. In order to expand their business, Agustina and her husband request a Php 20,000.00 loan. Aside for their own capital to buy fishing boat and additional to their fish vending, Agustina also ventures new business which is snack vending. She cooks snacks variety mainly made of flour and also serves coffee for beverage. As shown in the picture, Agustina starts to cook "puto". They are trying hard to improve and expand their business for the future of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending business and start up capital for snack vending

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Z. es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Z. es soltera y tiene 48 años, Sonia tiene bajo su responsabilidad a un sobrino a quien educa, Z. se dedica al engorde de ganado en sus terrenos de Rancha. Además viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, papa, queso, animales menores, productos que vende en el  mercado nery garcía y también de casa en casa.
Z. necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero y vaca.
Los sueños de Sonia son educar a su sobrino y ampliar su establo para engorde de ganado.
texts.en:
Z. is a member of Virgen Maria comunal bank. Z. is 48 years old and single. She takes care of a nephew who she sends to school. Z. works with livestock, fattening them up on her ranch land. She also travels to area markets where she buys grain, potatoes, cheese and small animals to sell in a different market, called Nery Garcia, and from door to door. Z. needs a loan of 1600 soles (Peruvian currency) to invest in the purchase of goats and cows. Z.’s dream is to educate her nephew and expand her stable where she raises livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goats and cows.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs Chanthou S., 25, and her husband, Mr Sothea Phat, 20, live along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2004 and have one young daughter.  Chanthou and her husband have full-time employment in the same company. They don’t have their own motorcycle so they spend a lot of money on travel costs, such as motor taxis and so on. Therefore, Chanthou is requesting her first loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est est un jeune homme de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans. Yawo souhaite avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto
texts.en:
