Koffi A. is a young man, 29 years old, and unmarried, and he has no children. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been working at this trade for three years. He wishes to use this loan to buy his own motorbike.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike taxi

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva P. is from the village of Manguehan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Eva owns and operates a business selling charcoal to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. is 43 years old and has four children. She raises pigs and also has a sari-sari (general) store business. She is engaged in these businesses to help provide for the growing needs of her family. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of pig feed and two additional piglets.

CEVI helps small business to grow. Through CEVI, Erlinda and other CEVI clients are able to sustain their livelihood through credit, training and insurance cover.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of pig feed and two additional piglets

loans.name: Djumaboy

texts.en:
B. Djumaboy is 37 years old. Together with his wife they’ve raised 4 children. Djumaboy is running the drug store already for 12 years. He is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town which allows him to have many clients and customers. Djumaboy is the client of IMON for 3 years. Now he requests 8000 Somoni. Being very accurate person by his nature Djumaboy is sure and would like to ensure the lenders that he is able to pay the loan in time without any violations. Your generosity can change their lives.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing medicaments for expanding the business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Since 1994, Cesar has worked as an employee of an industrial cleaning company. In 2005 a friend told him about the opportunity to make more money as a contractor in the same industry. He accepted the challenge and started his small business. To insure his success, he had to learn how to do the proper maintenance on the equipment to avoid untimely breakdowns.
 
Cesar needs a loan to provide working capital. In his business the equipment needs maintenance often and, if it breaks, it must be fixed on the same day. Equipment maintenance may be expensive, and Cesar didn’t have the extra money in his bank account to cover these costs. His loan though ACCION USA will provide more peace of mind to do his job, as he now has cushion to cover extra expenses.
 

Cesar says that he works hard to please his clients, giving them great service and listening to their requests. In the future he wants to buy more equipment to expand his business by obtaining more contracts.

loans.use: To use as a cushion to cover extra expenses

loans.name: Honest Group Ii

texts.en:
This is Aminata K., Adama K. and Fatmata K.. They call their group Honest Group II. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improving on their standard of living. 

Aminata K. (right) is the leader of this group. Aminata was born in Makeni. She is now age twenty-four, married to a businessman and they have two children; between the ages of two and four. Aminata sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and rice. She has got eight years of experience in business. With these loan, she expects to buy eight – ten barters of palm-oil (five gallons make a barter). Currently, a barter of palm-oils is sold at Le 50,000 – 60,000.00.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a 27 year old businessman who sells cereals in Majengo Nairobi. He has been running this business for four years. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to start another business in Nairobi. A father of one, Eusebio hopes to own a transport company and raise the living standards of his family. He describes himself as jovial, hardworking and social.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a new business

loans.name: Jose Sabino

texts.es:
El microempresario José Sabino P. M. tiene 50 años de edad, es de la etnia miskita, es casado tiene dos hijos adolescentes que se encuentran estudiando en nivel secundario. El artesano P. quien es de la etnia miskita, se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a trabajar el palo de rosa con el cual realiza imágenes de personas, animales, barcos, etc.

Esta actividad por lo general es ofertada en ferias, en el aeropuerto y en lugares públicos que son visitados por la población y por turistas nacionales e internacionales, sin embargo no existe apoyo ni del gobierno ni de otras instancias para financiar esta actividad, porque no es un producto que se vende todos los días, sino que depende las actividades sociales, culturales y económicas que se realizan en la ciudad.

En artesano M. esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

200 pies de madera de palo de rosa el cual compra a US 1 dólar cada pie, 2 paquetes de lijas para la madera cada paquete cuesta US 12 dólares, 6 unidades de pasta para darle brillo al producto vales US 6 dólar cada unidad y 10 hojas de seguetas las que valen US 4 dólares cada una.
texts.en:
José Sabino P. M. is a micro-entrepreneur and a member of the Miskito ethnic group. He is 50 years old, married, and has two teenage children who are high school students. For over 15 years, José has been producing carvings that are made of rosewood and in the image of people, animals, boats, etc.

He sells his creations at fairs, at the airport, and in public places that are frequented by local residents and tourists, both domestic and international. However, José does not receive support from either the government or other organizations to help finance his artistic endeavors because his products are not the type that are sold every day. His sales depend on the social, cultural, and economic climate within the city.

José is requesting a loan to finance the following purchases: • 200 ft. of rosewood timber at $1 USD/ft. • 2 packages of sandpaper that cost $12 USD each • 6 units of paste used for polishing finished products that cost $6 USD/unit • 10 saw blades that cost $4 USD each

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for producing wood carvings

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Our client is Juan. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. He is from Cruz Pata and lives in Cusco. He is 44 years old and lives with his partners and three children.

Juan is a public employee and works for the Ministry of Transport. He also has a transportation business. With this loan, he will grow his transportation business. He has two employees and for now the business is running smoothly.

Juan appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To grow his transportation business

loans.name: Dalmirith

texts.es:
La señora Dalmirith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito de Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, con un capital de S/. 500.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Dalmirith, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dalmirith belongs to the “Manuela Ramos” communal bank, located in Zapatero district, Lamas province, and San Martín department. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children, both now independent.

Because of the need to raise her children and also her energy and entrepreneurial spirit, she decided to start her own business selling live hens. She started the business with capital of 500 soles and, little by little, built her clientele.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more poultry birds, such as hens, turkeys, and ducks. Part of the money will also be used to buy balanced food and vitamins to keep the animals healthy and free of disease.

Dalmirith is very satisfied with her work, in spite of the fact that she works hard and has to get up early. She believes that it is worth the sacrifice to achieve her dreams and goals. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos group for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry birds, food, and vitamins

loans.name: María De Los Angeles Juanita

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles Juanita se le reconoce por ser buen cliente ya va por su  tercer crédito. Es una mujer emprendedora que no le gusta depender de sus hijos. Ella ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a la venta de comida, ropa y juguetes también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. La casa donde vive se ha pasado de generación en generación ya que esta fue dada a su padre y luego a ella.
La casa esta muy deteriorada es por ello que quiere reconstruir las paredes, para recibir a sus vistas en esta navidad y darles mejor confort.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles Juanita is recognized as a good client and she is applying for her third loan. She is an enterprising woman who doesn't wish to depend on her children. For 8 years she has dedicated herself to selling food, clothes, and toys. She also depends on the help of her husband. The house where she lives has been passed down from generation to generation: it was given to her father and later to her.

The house is very deteriorated and for this reason, she wishes to reconstruct the walls, so she can receive visitors this Christmas and offer them greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO RECONSTRUCT HER HOUSE

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 38 years old, married with two children and she takes care of four dependents. The children and dependents are aged between 11 and 22 years old. Her husband works full-time as a government agent. Liliane’s family lives in Rwamagana, a region in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, which is approximately a two hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Liliane has been in business for the past four years selling scholastic materials such as books, pens, pencils, mathematical tools, etc. She employs two people and the business’s working hours are from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Liliane is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a photocopier for her business. This new tool in her business will help her provide services on demand in her hometown.  Liliane is hoping to earn more profits from her business as a result of the new service provided which will help in getting more food for her family as well as enabling her to continue paying school fees for her children and dependents.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier for her business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita R. is from the village of Liloan Bonifacio. She is 55 years old and is married. To make a living, Florita owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from providing picture lamination services in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Florita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her lamination service. This loan will be the second loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her lamination service

loans.name: Gilberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Gilberto es un hombre de iniciativa y esforzado al trabajo que desde horas tempranas sale para captar cliente el cual siempre carga una portada de fondo para tomar las fotos, también en su casa las tomas y dedica días para poder recibir  a sus clientes. Es  casado y con cuatro hijos que procreo su esposa, juntos han logrado formar su propio negocio, ella tiene un kiosco en el colegio del barrio la cual comparten los gastos para poder apoyar  a que sus hijos se formen con una buena educación. Don Gilberto es fotógrafo desde hace más de doce años. Cuando inicio lo hizo con iniciativa propia ya que le gustaba tomar foto y la necesidad de poder traer dinero a su familia, el  cual fue tomando experiencia y con poco dinero comenzó. Con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para ampliar un poco más la sala con el fin de tener mejor comodidad para su familia ya que es pequeña. Da las gracias a la institución por el financiamiento que gracias ah estos ha podido estar estable en su negocios de fotografia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilberto is a man with initiative and dedicated to work; early in the morning he goes out looking for customers, always carrying a portable background to take pictures; he also takes pictures at his house, scheduling days to service his customers. He is married with 4 children procreated with his wife; together they have been able to build their own business; she has a kiosk in the neighborhood’s school and they share the expenses so they can support their children in getting a good education. Mr. Gilberto has been a photographer for more than 12 years. When he started, it was from his initiative, since he liked taking pictures, and the need to bring money to his family; he started with little money and he began gaining experience. With this loan, he will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and wrought iron to expand their small living room and improve the comfort of his family. He thanks the institution for the loan since thanks to these loans he has been able to have a stable business in photography.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and wrought iron

loans.name: Chandima

texts.en: Chandima is a married woman living with her husband along with their only daughter in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She is 28 years old, and runs a small fabrics printing business with her husband. Both of them are working together in this business. She wants to develop the business so that they can maintain their family and manage their daily expenses smoothly.

loans.use: Fabrics, colours, brushes, and new blocks for new designs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe J. is from the village of Mahayahay, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling RTWs (Ready-To-Wear clothes - used clothes), dried fish and processed meat in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en: Mrs. Basilia T. manages a store located at her house in Trinidad, Bohol. Already a widow, she still wants to provide for her family. She also tailors for additional income. She has been a member of Kiva partner CEVI for quite a while now and she say that her previous loans have really helped her business in a big way. Now she is requesting a loan of Php 10, 000, which she will use to add inventory to her store.

loans.use: To add inventory.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel C. Gaitán, quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado seis crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, piedra y hierro para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel C. Gaitán works as a hygienist at the Mercado Mayoreo in Managua. He is married and has four school-aged children under his care. He has had six loans through CEPRODEL in one year. During that time, thanks to the funding through CEPRODEL, he has invested his loans in making home improvements. This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, and iron, in order to build an indoor bathroom. All of this is done with the the goal of providing improved security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma E. is from the village of Debuloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Wilma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Wilma raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Wilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Gregorio,  él socio tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como albañil y en algunas ocasiones va de porteador al camino inka y al nevado de Ausangate, Nuestro socio trabaja muy duro para poder construir su casa y dar a su familia mejor calidad de vida. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas y víveres para su hogar.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Pacaha Illariy" communal bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha in Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. His name is Gregorio. He is 31 years old and lives with his girlfriend and two children. He works as a mason and sometimes as a porter on the Inca Trail and to the snowy mountain of Ausangate. He works very hard to be able to build a house and give his family a better life. He is seeking this loan to buy tools and food for his home. He is grateful for the support from the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and food for his home

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Monsieur Djiby D. est un commerçant  de 54 ans qui habite dans la localité de Baye Laye plus précisément  dans le quartier de Ndiareme a Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis novembre 2009 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. C’est un soutien de famille, marie et père de2 enfants de17 et 22 ans, ayant 4 autres personnes à sa charge. Par conséquent monsieur D. évolue  dans le secteur du petit commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. C’est une activité  qu’il a choisi par passion et aussi a cause de son aspect lucratif. Il sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs pour acheter du mil, du mais, de l’arachide et d’autres  denrées  qui peuvent être écoulées sur le marche. Il n’a pas de place fixe dans le marche, mais des son retour de voyage il place automatiquement ses produits à ses clients. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices  de 35000frs par semaine et par voyage. L’augmentation de ses gains lui permettra  de résoudre  ses problèmes de loyer et de mieux assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mr. Djiby D. is a 54-year old businessman who lives in the town of Baye Laye, more precisely in the Ndiareme district of Guediawaye. He has been a member of the Baye Laye savings institution since November 2009 and has already had one loan. He supports his family, is married and father to two children of 17 and 22 years old; he also has responsibility for four other people. As a result Mr. D. has been developing a small business for over 20 years. It is an activity he chose out of love and also because of its lucrative aspect. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy millet, corn, peanut and other food products which can be sold on the market. He has no fixed place in the market but when he gets back from his travels he places his products immediately with his customers. This loan will allow him to increase his profits by 35,000 francs per week and per trip. The increase in his earnings will allow him to resolve his rent problems and manage his daily expenses better.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of working capital

loans.name: Paz En La Tormenta Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal PAZ EN LA TORMENTA, con 8 integrantes. 
Una de las integrantes y presidenta  es María F. H., de 43 años, se dedica desde hace 20 años al tejido de prendas de vestir. Compra su materia prima de la feria 16 de Julio y vende en la misma feria los productos terminados, tiene 6 hijos a los cuales saca adelante con los ingresos del negocio. Maria necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana.  
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con diversos negocios y necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
The PAZ EN LA TORMENTA (Peace within the Storm) communal bank has 8 members and meets in one of Pro Mujer Panamericana’s focal centers. One of the group members is María F. H., 43. She has woven clothing items for 20 years. She buys her raw materials at the 16 de Julio market and sells her finished items there as well. She has 6 children who she supports with income from her business. María needs the loan to buy raw materials like wool. The other group members have a variety of businesses and need funds to buy merchandise, ingredients or raw materials according to the type of business each has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S. is a 58-year old married woman who lives in Prk. Bolinao, Brgy Zone 2, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through owning a general store.

Teresa’s husband, Marcos, helps her in running the business.  They have six children who are between 24-33 years old. With some of them already working, this has helped the family defray some of their expenses.

Teresa joined Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,500 from her business activities.

Teresa is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 7th cycle loan an amount of Php 20,000 which she intends to use for her general store. Teresa is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth C., 22, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. C. is a housewife while her husband is an electrician, earning an income of USD 8 per day.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to purchase piglets to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria B. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 38 years old. Victoria is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Victoria B..

Victoria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Victoria is just starting this business.

In 2010, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Processing and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia C. is from the village of Basag, San Carlos, Valencia City. She is 55 years old. Sofia is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Sofia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Sofia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Sofia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sofia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sofia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Sofia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Parda

texts.en: A. Parda is 55 years old and is married with eight children. His wife works as a teacher in the local school. For many years, Parda has lived very happily in his small house surrounded by his plantation and the "Good Morning" of a beautiful sunrise every day. He rises before sunrise and, with love and hope, he works the field that generates his family's income. Parda is applying for a loan of 4,500 Somoni with which to buy the supplies necessary for the maintenance of his crop, including seeds and fertilizer. These supplies will guarantee the quality of the harvest to which he has dedicated many hours of work during many months. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods like beans, maize flour, rice, etc. and is requesting a loan to improve stock. Betty is 28 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in the business by buying more goods.

loans.use: Improve stock.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov S., 44, is married and resides with her husband and five children in the Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells groceries, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $3 per day. The family has to spend $61 on food, $5 on electricity and water supplies, and $30 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to buy hair-dressing equipment to start another business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy hair-dressing equipment to start another business

loans.name: Mr. Saom Sarun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 17 people who live in Kong Noy village in Kandal province. Mr. Saom S. is the village bank president who has beE. selected by the other members. The group members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes.
Mr. Saom S. is a 50-year-old farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell yearly to support his family. At present he has a problem because it is time to grow rice but he does not have enough money to do this. Therefore, Mr. Saom S. is requesting a loan to continue farming this current year. His wife, Mrs. S. Art Horm, is a teacher in a local school and earns a low salary to support her family. The couple supports five childrE. – one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the others are studying in a local public school.

loans.use: To farm rice this year

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson M. is forty eight years old and married. His wife is a nurse and they have two children aged sixteen years old and nine years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. Jackson’s business is located in a busy commercial area in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. He owns a general store in which he sells such items as sugar, rice, bread, flour, cooking oil etc. He has been selling to the local people for the last 7 years. He says that this business is profitable, but he still has financial constraints which is his major challenge. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 15,000 KES to add stocks of sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. He hopes to be a wholesaler in various shopping centers. He describes himself as ambitious, hard working and social.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil

loans.name: Raef

texts.en: Raef is a 53 year-old, married man with two children.  Raef owns a van that he uses to transports fruit and vegetables.  Since 1997, this business has been his only source of income. Raef is well-known among businessmen in the wholesale market and they recommend him to other retail clients.  Raef is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the second time.  The loan will be used to improve his business through starting wholesale vegetables and fruits trade, in addition to finishing construction on his house before the Holy and winter seasons.  Raef’s first loan had a positive impact on his business and he hopes this one will have an even better impact.

loans.use: To improve his business through wholesale trade, in addition to finishing his house construction before the Holy and the winter season

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 22 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive con su mamá, de 48 años, a la que cuida y ayuda en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Después de la muerte de su papá, Miguel tuvo que salir adelante junto a su familia. Hace 4 años que se dedica al cuidado de los terrenos agrícolas de su mamá, quien esta agradecida por el apoyo y la responsabilidad que le brinda constantemente. Sus cultivos constan de papa, los cuales cuida infatigablemente, por ello, en épocas de cosecha los comercializan en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad “Tarma”; obteniendo buenas ganancias. Pero consiente de las carencias que tiene, el desea juntar una suma considerable de dinero, para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, con el empeño que lo caracteriza, está seguro que lo conseguirá. Este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compañía de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y muy comprometidas. Con el monto que solicita podrá completar la compra de 22 sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Miguel, 22, is a single, hard working man living with his 48 year old mother whom he cares for and helps out in his own house located in the community of Ricrican.  

After his father’s death, Miguel had to get ahead with his family.  For the last four years he has been taking care of his mother’s farmland who is very grateful for his help and the responsibility he constantly shows her.

He farms potatoes which he tirelessly tends to and when they are harvested he sells them at Tarma’s wholesale market earning good profits.  

Because of the things he lacks, he’d like to save enough money to buy his own land and is certain he’ll succeed in doing so thanks to his characteristic dedication.

This is his 8th loan with MFP and he expects to get ahead together with his communal bank which is made up of responsible, very committed people.

He will use the entirety of his loan to complete the amount he needs to buy 22 sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy 22 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Mrs. Pol C. T., age 38, is a mother blessed with two children who are single and studying in public school. She currently generates an average income of $2 a day by selling Khmer cake in her village. Mrs. Pol C. T. has a life partner in her husband, who is a motor taxi driver at the Kompong Tmor Market, Kompong Tom province. Recently, Mrs. Pol C. T. says that the house which she and her family live in is too small and narrow. She wishes to buy a medium-size parcel of land for building a bigger house than present, but her money is not enough to do that. This is the reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy land to build a bigger house

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
Don José del Carmen L. A., es trabajador del Instituto Nacional Tecnológico, (inatec), desempeñando el cargo de Secretario en el Departamento de Capacitación.
Es casado, tiene 3 personas a cargo su esposa y dos hijos en edad escolar.
Este es el segundo crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL, por que le brinda la oportunidad de ir mejorando su calidad de vida, mediante los préstamos que le otorga ya que le permiten mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
José del Carmen L. A. works at the National Technological Institute (INATEC) as a secretary of the Department of Training.

He is married and has three dependents – his wife and two school-aged children.

This is his second loan with CEPRODEL, through which they are providing him with the opportunity to continue improving his quality of life as the loans allow him to make housing improvements.

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, rafters, cement, sand, gravel, blocks, and man labor

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda M. is 35 years old and his wife, Sokheng Bo, is 34 years old.  They live in a village off National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  Chenda has been driving a motor remoque for 14 years. (A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back.). The trailer is old and breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it. Facing this, he is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new remoque to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new remoque to replace the old one

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en:
In Tep Archun village in Kandal province, there are 11 people making up a village bank loan. Mrs. Soeun C., born in 1965, is the village bank president and was selected to this position by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Chheoun Sovann, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow corn, rice, and various vegetables. They grow and sell these crops to support their family. At present, they do not have sufficient funds to prepare the farm to grow their crops. This is why Mrs. Soeun C. is requesting a loan. With the loan, she will buy corn seeds and fertilizers and will be able to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm in preparation for growing rice.  

This couple has five children, four of whom are students who also help support their parents' farming business. The youngest is five years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and fertilizers as well as to pay for hired laborers to plow the farmland in preparation for growing rice

loans.name: Thuan's Group

texts.en:
Thuan T. N. is 52 year old.  She is living with her family in Ngoai Village.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising pigs for meat. Her business has lasted for many years and she gets stable income from these activaties. She used her previous loan to buy more fertilizer and food for her pigs. In this cycle she is asking for a loan of 7,194,000 VND to  buy  more pigs to raise.
 
T. T. N.  is  45 years old with 2 children.  She is running a shop that provides motor repair services. She is requesting a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy a motor washing machine.
 
Lieu T. N. is 46 years old with 2 children . She has a shop that sells shoes.  She is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in  the shop. 
 
Ha T. T. T.  is 35 years old with two children. She  has a shop that sells motor parts.   She is requesting a loan of 9,374,000 VND to expand her business.

loans.use: To  buy  more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married to a businessman. They have one child who attends school, and they rent a house they live in. Her business is a store, which she has had for 4 years, where she sells basic needs items.

She is requesting a Kshs 35,000 loan because she needs to stock the business, and she does not have the resources to do so. She will buy products like oil, rice, beans, detergent, and soap. This loan will help her a great deal in order to resolve this situation and to keep her business in better condition.

Her plan for the future is to use the income from the business to be able to stabilize her financial condition. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, beans, detergent, and soap.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel R., 55, is a resident of Carmona, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Elreytrio, a consultant, and is the mother of six young adults; two already work and four are still at home. By the grace of God, Maribel has managed to support all her children’s educational needs and she is still working hard to maintain her finances.

Maribel operates an auto-repair shop.  She hires mechanics while she handles the finances, accounts, inventory and promotions. The shop offers repair, check-up and beautification of all types of cars and jeepneys - any type of referred vehicle. There is also a little refreshment stand in the auto-repair shop, where they sell beverages to waiting customers and passing passenger vehicles.

To help her continue operating her business, Maribel is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan, which she will use to buy an additional welding machine and other supplies such as spare car parts, wiring, putty paint, etc. Maribel expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maribel dreams of being able to have a good and comfortable life through all her hard work in her business and to be able to purchase her own car someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy another welding machine and supplies

loans.name: Rosa Ofelia

texts.es:
A sus 59 años de edad, Rosa Ofelia es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por su familia, por mejorar su calidad de vida y por tener una vejez tranquila, por ello, decidió poner en su propia casa un negocio de videojuegos para lograr un mejor futuro. 

Rosa espera ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos, para ello necesita de un préstamo para comprar una consola de videojuego.
texts.en:
At 59 years of age, Rosa Ofelia is an enterprising woman who struggles for her family, to improve their quality of life and to have a quiet old age. She has set up a video game business in her house to achieve a better future. 

Rosa wants to expand her business in order to improve her income. She needs a loan to purchase a video game console.

loans.use: to purchase a video console

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, natural del distrito de Quimbiri, esta casado con Modesta de 48  años de edad y juntos viven en su propia casa con sus 05 hijos donde reina la armonía. La labor que realiza Jorge es labrar la tierra, desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra, con el tiempo se convirtió en campesino, y durante años ahorró para al fin poder comprarse su propia parcela de 18 hectáreas, actualmente cultiva cacao y plátano. Tiene 20 años de experiencia en la agricultura y sabe lo arduo que es trabajar en el campo, por ello cuando es tiempo de cosecha, contrata jornaleros para que le ayuden a trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto lugar donde serán comercializados. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son de calidad,  y de cuyas ventas obtiene buenas ganancias. Sin embargo cuando es invierno, debe procurar que la plaga de insectos no perjudique sus plantaciones. Este es su 12avo  crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. El crédito solicitado es para la de compra de plantas de cacao, del que serán injertados para obtener fruto de mayor proporción.
texts.en: Jorge is 45 years old and he is originally from Quimbiri. He is married with Modesta who is 48 years old. They live together with their 5 children in a house that they own and where harmony reigns. Jorge's business is to work the land. Since he was a young boy his parents taught him how to work the land. With time he became a farmer and during the years he managed to save enough to purchase his own parcel of land, 18 hectares in area. He currently cultivates cocoa and bananas. He has 20 years' experience in agriculture and he knows the arduous work that is involved in the land. When the harvest season arrives he hires farmhands to help him carry his harvest to the location where it will be sold. He is very committed to his work and thanks to his daily efforts he enjoys the quality of his plants and the sales earn him a good income. During the winter he must ensure that the insect plagues do not harm his plantations. This is his 12th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He know that if he pays it on time he will be able to access a loan in the future and he will not carry any difficulties to his communal bank. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase cocoa plants that will be grafted to obtain a greater yield.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita L. is from the village of Kauswagan, Aurora zamboanga del sur. She is 53, married, and has two adult children. Rosalita has had a rice farm for over eight years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Rosalita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. Rosalita is requesting 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old, married to Lucy and they have four children.  

James has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last six years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, James plans to practice large scale farming and to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: La señora Jessica Maria se dedica a  la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil mantener este negocio. El objetivo de ella es invertir el crédito directamente en el negocio, sus inicios se dan por  ya que surgió como una alternativa de trabajo para ella y su familia. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cosméticos, prendas, sabanas, faldas, vestidos, trajes y calzado. Sueña con aumentar su mercadería para obtener una gran variedad de clientes. Ella siempre ha sido muy responsable con sus cuotas de pagos pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos y está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Jessica Maria sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for over three years, and it has been very difficult to maintain this business.

Her objective is to invest the loan directly into the business.  The business started because it emerged as a work alternative for her and for her family.  The loan is to buy cosmetics, clothing, sheets, skirts, dresses, suits, and footwear.  She dreams of increasing her merchandise in order to get a great variety of customers.

She has always been very responsible with her payments.  This is not the first loan she has received, and she is waiting for her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, sheets, skirts, dresses, suits, and footwear.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 30 años, reside en la comunidad de Yapaz bajo (selva central peruana). Ahí vive en casa de sus padres a los que cuida y protege como buen hijo. Como joven emprendedor y ambicioso; Alfredo cuenta que desde los 15 años, se dedicó a la agricultura, desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario para poder sacar adelante las 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola que heredó por parte de sus padres, a los que ahora cuida, pues son ancianos y no tienen las mismas fuerzas de antes. Su principal sembrío consta de café y plátanos, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y dedicación. Según cuenta sus platanales le brindan fruto cada 15 días, comercializando a un buen precio a los mismos acopiadores que visitan la zona, aunado al café que cosecha una vez al año, son vendidos en la ciudad de La Merced. Sin embargo en época donde no hay mucha cosecha de café; comparte su tiempo con el oficio de carpintero; donde obtiene una ganancia extra. Ahora su principal objetivo es poder mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y expandir más sus terrenos de cultivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este será su segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Alfredo, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago a los peones que le están ayudando a cosechar el café maduro en está campaña agrícola.
texts.en: Alfredo is 30-years-old and lives in the community of Yapaz Bajo (in the central Peruvian jungle).  He lives in his parents’ home, and he cares for them and protects them like a good son.  Like an enterprising and ambitious young person, Alfredo tells us that he has worked in agriculture since he was 15.  Since then, he has learned everything he needs to be able to take good care of his 5 hectares of land that his parents gave him.  He takes care of them now because they are elderly and they don’t have as much strength as they used to.  His main harvests consist of coffee and plantains, which he cares for with a lot of dedication.  He tells us that he harvests from his plantain trees every two weeks and he sells the fruit at a good price to the wholesalers that visit the area.  He harvests coffee once a year, and that is sold in the city of La Merced.  During seasons when he is not harvesting coffee, he also dedicates some time to working as a carpenter, where he obtains extra income.  His main goal is to improve the quality of her crops and to expand the land that he owns.  He belongs to the communal bank, “El Palomar al exito,” and this will be his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He is very happy to know that he will have the financial support that he needs so much.  He promises to make all of his payments on time, like he has with previous loans that he has had.  Alfredo will invest the money requested in paying the laborers that help him harvest his mature coffee crop.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help him with his coffee harvest

loans.name: Los Copihues De Malleco Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se llama “Los Copihues de Malleco” y está conformado por 18 socios, quienes se dedican principalmente al rubro del comercio, vendiendo ropa. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Rodrigo, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie arriba de una silla, el primero de derecha a izquierda. Viste con una chaqueta color café. Se dedica a vender joyas bañadas en oro y plata, su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora de joyas en la ciudad de Temuco, en la cual venden al por mayor, lo que es conveniente económicamente para Rodrigo. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 5 años, sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta y tiene bastante clientela, por lo que le va muy bien.
Sus metas en su negocio es establecerse en un local y tener una joyería en la cual pueda vender sus joyas por mayor y al detalle. 
Rodrigo vive junto a su esposa e hija d 5 años de edad, quien asiste al jardín infantil. Comenta que sus sueños son salir a vacacionar con su familia para descansar.
Fondo esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo, ya que no contaba con el capital para invertir su negocio, el cual le ha servido para obtener mayores ingresos. 
Por lo tanto se encuentra muy agradecido, respecto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han servido para registrar sus gastos e ingresos. El grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy organizado y unido. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The “Los Copihues de Malleco” community bank has 18 members who mainly work in sales, selling clothes.  They are all from the city of Temuco.

Rodrigo is the man on the far right of the photo who is standing on a chair.  He is wearing a coffee-colored jacket.  His business is selling gold- and silver-plated jewelry.  He buys his merchandise from a jewelry distributor in the city of Temuco who sells wholesale.  This is financially convenient for Rodrigo.  He has been in this field for five years and makes his sales door to door.  He has quite a lot of customers and things are going very well.  His goals for his business are to set himself up in some premises and start a jewelry store where he can sell his jewelry wholesale and retail. 

Rodrigo lives with his wife and 5 year-old daughter who is in kindergarten.  He says that his dream is to go on holiday with his family so that they can relax.

Fondo Esperanza have been a great source of support as Rodrigo did not have the capital he needed to invest in his business.  The capital has helped him to make more income.  For this reason, he is very grateful.  The training sessions have been useful in helping him to record his incomings and outgoings.  The community bank to which he belongs is very organized and united.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There are a series of lakeside resorts in the surrounding area (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking native flora and fauna can be found in nearby nature reserves.  50% of the Mapuche (indigenous people) in our country live in this region.

loans.use: to buy silver- and gold-plated jewelry

loans.name: Jemmar

texts.en:
Jemmar is 23 years old and married. He has a 2-year-old child. 

Jemmar is a farmer who tills land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice crops to sell. Jemmar is also a welder. When free of farming duties, he works at a welding shop in his town.

Jemmar is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He also plans to buy piglets to start a hog-raising business. He hopes to succeed in his ventures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rihannata

texts.fr:
Mme Rihannata est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 10 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du charbon de bois depuis 8ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont ses voisins.

Mme veut s’acheter 20sacs de charbon de bois.

Avec ses économies, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Mme ambitionne vendre en gros son charbon et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Rihannata is married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 20. None are attending school. She has ten persons to support. Rihannata has been selling charcoal for eight years. She gets her supplies from surrounding villages. Her customers are her neighbors. 

Rihannata wants to buy 20 sacks of charcoal. With her savings, she helps out her husband to cover family expenses. Her ambition is to sell charcoal in bulk and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain more plastic containers to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 25 years old and married to Claudia. He supports a family of five. He has been practicing farming for a period of one year. He earns a monthly income of KES 1,800. He has been loaned KES 10,000. This is his first loan with Kadet. He will be using the loan to purchase dairy cows. 

He will use the anticipated profit to improve the dairy farm. He hopes to have a good life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene un pequeño salón para  fiestas infantiles. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de juegos infantiles, como un resbalin inflable, un trampolín, vajilla, algunas mesas y sillas y un amplificador para ofrecer mejor servicio en su negocio. Vive en casa de sus padres   la misma queda ubicada en la zona Vino Tinto en la ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que la señora tiene un crédito en nuestra institución y  en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes has a small facility that is used for children’s parties. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy children’s games, an inflatable slide, a trampoline, as well as dishes, some tables and chairs, and an amplifier so that she can provide better service in her business. Lourdes lives at the home of her parents in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. She is a single mother and has one child.

This is the first time she has received a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase games, an inflatable slide, a trampoline, dishes, tables, chairs, and an amplifier to use for children's parties.

loans.name: Jardines De La Luz Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “JARDINES DE LA LUZ”; este banco  comunal es nuevo y por eso es un pequeño grupo que esta iniciándose en créditos comunales y desean crecer; este banco se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Poroy; en el mismo cementerio llamado igual que el banco comunal en la Provincia de Cusco, en el Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maria Antonieta; es  soltera  y tiene 34 años de edad; la socia  tiene 3 hijos la mayor que es mujer de 18 años de edad, la otro es de 8 años de edad y es varón y la última de 6 años de edad y es mujer. La socia trabaja en el cementerio en un cafetín propio, ella alquila este cafetín y vende sándwich, refrescos, gaseosas, tortas, kekes, café, mates, te filtrantes entre otros; La socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el crédito para apoyar a su hija en su nuevo negocio, la hija mayor de la socia ha hecho clases de trufan en la ciudad de Lima y todo tipo de arreglo floral, la socia compartirá el espacio con su mama y comprara vitrinas, trufan es un material para hacer moños, cajas, cintas para los ramos de flores, la socia se encargara de la elaboración de diversos arreglos florales y los exhibirá en su espacio, este negocio es muy novedoso en este cementerio, ya que no cuenta con ninguna florería cercana. La socia invertirá el préstamo en el negocio de sus hija que comprara vitrinas de exhibición y trufan mas otros materiales para la elaboración de arreglos florales.
Los otros socios son trabajadores del cementerio encargados de diferentes labores, como el mantenimientos de los nichos, escavar la tierra, enterrar y todo lo referente a esta labor, ellos desea invertir sus préstamo en víveres, transporte, uso personal de vivienda.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "JARDINES DE LA LUZ" which, because it is new, is a small group just starting to obtain loans and hoping to grow.  It is located in the city of Cusco in the district of Poroy, inside a cemetery by the same name in the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members, Maria Antonieta, is 34, single and has three children: a daughter who is 18, a son who is 8 and daughter who is 6.  In the cemetery she rents a coffee shop where she sells sandwiches, softdrinks, sodas, cakes, coffee, tea and other items.  She is in need of a loan to help her daughter in a new business.  Her daughter has taken "trufan" ( ribbon-tying) and floral arrangement classes in the city of Lima.  They will both share business space and the mother will buy a display case.  Trufan is a material used to make bows, wrappers and ribbons for flower bouquets.  The member will be in charge of making the different floral arrangements and will exhibit them in her space.  This is a new type of business at this cemetery since there is no nearby floral shop.  The loan will be used to buy display cases for her daughter's business and to buy trufan and other materials for floral arrangements.

The other members are cemetery workers who have different jobs such as plot maintenance, grave and burial workers and everything related to this work.  

The member is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time as she has done with previous loans.

loans.use: To buy display cases and material for floral arrangements for her daughter's business.

loans.name: Tuzamurane/ Rbyr Group

texts.fr:
Zablon fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane. Le nom du groupe signifie « Aidons nous». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  7ans de primaire.

Zablon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des fertilisants pour avoir la grande production du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Zablon voudrait être le grand distributeur dans son région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zabulon is a member of Tuzamurane Group, whose name means "Let's help ourselves". He's 32 years old, married, and has three children, age 2 to 10. Two of them attend school.

Zabulon attended elementary school for seven years. He's now a rice cultivator who's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use fertilizers to increase rice production. In the forthcoming years, Zabulon would like to become a distributor in his region.

With his profits, he intends to provide education and healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Inacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais apenas 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus tios enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane em busca de melhores condições de vida, trabalha como guarda na empresa Aguas de Moçambique ha mais de 16 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (areia, pedra, ferro, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, 7.200.00mt, 9.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 16.000.00mt,  para habitacao.
 No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, assim conta com mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Inacio was born in the district of Manjacaze, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, only one of whom is still in school. He went to school through fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his aunt and uncle financially, sending them money to help with their food expenses

He left Manjacaze for Boane in search of a better life. He's worked as a security guard at the company Aguas de Moçambique for more than 16 years and earns a salary of 3,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his sixth loan, in the amount of 13,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His other loans were in the amounts of 5,000, 7,200, 9,000, 10,000 and 16,000 meticals, which he also invested in his house.
In the future he plans to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can complete and furnish his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.) to continue construction on his house.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Мошариф жительница района Джиликул. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мошариф 52 года.  Ее муж и старший ребенок находятся в Российской Федерации. Сама она занимается растениеводством и скотоводством. В этой области она 36 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Mosharif is a resident of Jilikul region. She is 52 years old. She is married, and has three children. Her husband and eldest child are in Russia. She works with crops and animals. She has 36 years of experience in this area. She is applying for a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lesbia Del Carmen de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y muy amable. Ella trabaja como conserje en el hospital. Lesbia tiene muchas responsabilidades dentro de las cuales está la de mantener a su familia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, clavos, pega, cemento y arena. Asimismo agradece la oportunidad que le dan de esa manera espera desarrollar su negocio. sueña con mejorar su vivienda cada dia.
texts.en: Lesbia Del Carmen is 42 years old.  She is a cheerful and very kind woman who works as a caretaker in a hospital.  Lesbia has many responsibilities, including supporting her family.  The reason she needs this loan is to buy building supplies such as sheets of metal, nails, adhesive, cement and sand.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given and hopes to make progress in her work.  She dreams of continuing to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, nails, adhesive, cement and sand

loans.name: Jitegemee A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jitegemee A Group in Western Kenya! Pauline is the facilitator of the Jitegemee A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. As with the majority of people in this part of Kenya, Pauline and her group members are farmers who rely heavily on small-scale maize production for food security and income.

Pauline takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pauline had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pauline was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pauline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Pauline will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and livestock investments.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Pauline is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been selling shoes for the last two years to make a living. He also raises livestock to earn extra income. 

Simon has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes for resale. In the next 5 years, he wants to establish a wholesale business. Simon dreams of becoming more financially stable in the future, and, thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 50, is married with four children. Two of the children attend school and the other two have graduated from school. Maria lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Maria operates a maize selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of maize in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 33 years old and is married to a businesswoman. He has three children, ranging from two to eight years old of which two of them are daughters and one son. He describes himself as an ambitious, polite and patient man. He has been involved in the business of selling spare parts for the last eight years. His business challenge is insufficient funds.
