Earlier on, he had received five loans of KES (20,000, 30,000, 50,000, 70,000 and  80,000) of which he was able to repay back. He will use the next loan of KES 80,000 to buy more spare parts. He is still hoping that he will be a supplier in the future.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Haliemeh

texts.en: Haliemeh is a 31 year old married woman from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for clothes such as children, women, boys and girls to sell for her friends and neighbors. In the future she wants to expand her project by opening a shop and she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 33 years old.  He is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 7 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 3 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and buy a land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize.

loans.name: Gheorghita

texts.en: When Moldova regained its independence one of the first things to appear were outdoor markets (piatas), springing up in nearly every village and certainly in every larger town. Gheorgita began working at the Calarasi market in 1992 and has done so ever since, working with other vendors and on her own. In an environment where finding any job can be tough, the market can provide steady work, especially important for a mother of two. She was working at the Lottery booth near the entrance when she noticed the unused space next to it and decided to try opening her own business. Now she can be found at her table every day from early in the morning until mid-afternoon, selling a range of clothing and household goods. Her most popular items are head scarves (worn by most Moldovan women) and shirts. When asked how she decides which types of products to stock, Gheorghita says she always tries to keep track of and act on customer inquiries and demands. The most recent thing she has noticed is that many women are asking why she doesn’t have aprons. She would like to take a loan to purchase a supply of aprons and begin offering them at her table.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosen

texts.en: Rosen S. and his family live in Asenovgrad. Previously he has worked as a driver but after the transport company closed he started his own farming business. Rosen bought a cowshed and started cow breeding. Now he breeds 29 cows and 7 calves. Rosen also has a milk station where he buys extra milk from other farmers in region. Because of enlargement of this, Rosen S. needs to make some repairs on this station and needs $1200.

loans.use: To make some repairs on his milk station

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia bought her home more than a year ago. She's requesting a loan so she can waterproof it and plaster the walls, since she lives with her three children and during the rainy season water leaks into the house. Last year, one of his children was sick from the dampness in the house, and he doesn't want the same thing to happen again.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La sra. Silvia P. tiene mas de un año que adquirió su casa. Esta pidiendo un préstamo para impermeabilizar y enjarrar ya que cavaba de tener a su 3 hijo y en la temporada de lluvia se tramite el agua a su vivienda. El año pasado por este motivo tubo a sus hijos enfermos por la humedad que tenia la casa y no quiere que le pase lo mismo este invierno.

loans.use: Waterproof her home and plaster the walls

loans.name: Sayfiddin

texts.en:
Sayfiddin V. is 34 years old and lives in Vakhdat district, Tajikistan. He has secondary education, is married, and has got 3 children. He is a taxi driver.

Sayfiddin has also been doing stockbreeding for 10 years. This activity is an additional source of income for him. With this loan of $1000, he is going to buy 2 bull-calves to fatten. He will use the income which he gets from his taxi service to pay off the loan, so that he will be able to keep the bull-calves for himself. This loan will help him increase the number of cattle he can raise and also give local inhabitants the chance to obtain meat near home at a low price. Sayfiddin is going to pay off the loan over a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves to raise and fatten

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang H., 57, lives with her three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a tailor, earning  $3 each day; her husband is a cook and one of her children is employed at a garment factory, while another attends school. Mrs Yang H. hopes to use this loan to purchase a sewing machine to increase her tailoring business so she can generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to increase her tailoring business and generate additional income.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Mr. K. Korn was married in 1969 and has 4 children, 3 sons and one daughter. He has been in the business of fishing since 1979. He started fishing in 1970, which he learned from his older generation. His eldest son assists him with his fishing business. One of his sons and a daughter work at the garment factory, while the youngest son is studying. His wife works growing rice.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200. He will use this loan to purchase farm machinery and an ox cart in order to expand the family rice production.

loans.use: To purchase farm machinery and an ox cart.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Otilia is 57 years old, and has six independent children. She never went to school because her father did not consider it important. Mrs. Otilia is a native of Huancabamba (Piura), which is where she met the man who is now her husband. She went with him to live in Cascas, where they had farmland that her husband irresponsibly sold. They then went to live in Trujillo with their six children; she felt the need to work now that her husband did not contribute to the home. That’s how she started her business selling snow cones, fruit, and sandwiches in the streets of the city. Sometime later, some friends told her she could do better by selling assorted frozen novelties, so she switched gears. Currently, Mrs. Otilia lives in the Huanchaco district in the department of La Libertad and devotes herself to selling popsicles and gelatin desserts; during the summer, she employs three other people in selling her products. During the winter, she sells used clothing in the La Libertad sierra and in cities in the junble. With her first $100 credit that she obtained from the interim group “Radiant Sun” of Manuela Ramos, she purchased candies to sell; she did that for a while, but had to give it up because the city police constantly moved her away from the area where she sold on foot. With this loan from Manuela Ramos for $250 to be paid in four months, she will buy sugar for next summer. Mrs. Otilia dreams of having savings enough to retire comfortably in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Otilia tiene 57 años de edad, no estudió porque su padre no lo consideró importante. Tiene 6 hijos pero ya no dependen de ella. La señora Otilia es natural de Huancabamba (Piura), ahí conoció al que actualmente es su esposo y con él se fueron a vivir a Cascas donde tenían tierras de cultivo las que el esposo vendió por irresponsable; entonces vino a vivir a Trujillo con sus seis hijos y sintió la necesidad de trabajar ya que el esposo no aportaba al hogar y así inició su negocio con la venta de raspadillas, fruta y sandwich por las calle de la ciudad, después unas amigas le comentaron que se obtiene mayor utilidad vendiendo marcianos y gelatinas y entonces cambió de giro. Actualmente la señora Otilia vive en el Asentamiento Humano Ramón Castilla del Distrito de Huanchaco en el Departamento de La Libertad y se dedica a preparar y vender marcianos (paletas de hielo) y gelatina (postre) durante el verano dando trabajo a tres personas más que venden sus productos. Durante el invierno vende ropa usada en la Sierra de la Libertad y también en ciudades de la selva. Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) que obtuvo en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Sol Radiante” del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, compró golosinas para vender, lo hizo por un tiempo pero tuvo que dejarlo porque los policías municipales la retiraban constantemente de la zona donde vendía (ambulante). Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.700.00 (aproximadamente $234) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, comprará azúcar para la preparación de los marcianos debido a que el precio está subiendo y la temporada de verano está próxima. La señora Otilia sueña con tener ahorros para afrontar su vejez y así dejar de trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar for making frozen novelties to sell next summer.

loans.name: Kazinga B(V) Group

texts.en: Teddy is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She raises multiple forms of livestock, including poultry and pigs. In addition, she cultivates her land for crops. Teddy would like to apply for a loan in order to add another poultry shop to increase business and profits.

loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
” I have some construction that is unfinished due to lack of funds. I stopped the project a few months ago, and now I would like to lay paving stone in those rooms so we can inhabit them. Recently, with some savings, I put the front gate to make my home more secure, but my family needs to expand the house a bit so we decided to finish these rooms.” I am requesting $1,000.00 to lay paving stone in two rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

““Tengo una construcción sin terminar ya que me falto dinero, hace varios meses que detuve la obra y ahora me gustaría poner la losa de concreto en esos cuartos para poder habitarlos, hace poco con algunos ahorros puse el portón de enfrente para darle más seguridad a mi vivienda, pero mi familia requiere de ampliar un poco la casa así es que decidimos terminar los cuartos ” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner la losa de concreto en dos cuartos.

loans.use: Lay paving stone in two rooms

loans.name: Bernadette Ndew

texts.fr:
Mrs Bernadette Ndew N., born in 1949, is a widow and a member of the Ngollar Village Bank. She buys wood and pays for the labor to turn it into charcoal, which she then sells. Bernadette is a good customer who has been in the program for five and a half years and has always repaid her loans. Her income enables her to pay for her children's schooling, buy cows and support her family. She is requesting a loan that she plans to repay after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Bernadette Ndew N., née 1949, veuve est membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar, Elle achète du bois et paie la main d'oeuvre pour produire du charbon qu'elle vend. Bernadette est une bonne cliente qui a fait 5 ans et demie dans le programme et a toujours remboursé ses prêts. Ses revenus lui permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants, acheter des vaches et entretenir la famille.Elle sollicite un prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To pay for wood and labor

loans.name: Saasaai 2 Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
For these 3 women of Saasaai 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Aussie F., 18, is married with 1 child. She is starting a bakery business. With her loan, she will purchase cement, metal, and iron roofing to construct an oven. Also, she will purchase oil, flour, sugar, and other ingredients to make pies, biscuits, buns, and other baked goods.

Asolelei T., 39, is married with 7 children. She grows taro, yams, bananas, and other vegetable and fruit produce. Although her family has been doing it for many years, this is her first business selling produce. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a filing, 2 bow knives, and fertilizer.

Teuila L., 46, is married with 11 children. Her sons help her farm her taro and yam plantation. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, fertilizer, cabbage seeds, and a license. She will sell her produce 5 days per week.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to start a bakery and for farming

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is a young woman who wants to progress in life and who is constantly looking to further develop herself. She wants to have a business which will allow her to support her dearest parents and her family. She is asking for a loan with which she can buy more and better products for her store in order to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Liliana, es una joven con muchos deseos de progreso y está en constante búsqueda de nuevos horizontes de desarrollo para su vida, quiere emprender un negocio que se convertirá en el principal sostén de sus amados padres y su familia. Solicita un préstamo para implementar con más y mejores productos su pequeño establecimiento a fin de concretar sus deseos.

loans.use: To obtain capital to set up her grocery store.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 37-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. She owns a grocery store. This is the fifth time she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Huyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Huyen is a 48 year old woman. As a partner of TYM since 1997, she has been using the loans efficiently. When she first participated in the program, a proportion of the loan was used to invest in a family-based live-stock farm; while her husband used the rest of the loan to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then resell it to manufactures. Thanks to their good entrepreneurship and diligence, the family’s financial situation has improved. At the moment, her 2 children have grown up. She plans to use the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate pig stalls and buy more pigs. The family’s frequent income is about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Huyền năm nay 48 tuổi. Là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997 đến nay qua nhiều vòng vốn chị đều là người sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Khi bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình, chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Nhờ biết cách làm ăn và chăm chỉ kinh tế của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được tăng lên. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 2 con đã khôn lớn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru:
Bozor S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda with his six children. He works at an aluminum plant. His wages are barely enough to support his family. Now he's planning to take out a loan and purchase a car called "Tiko". He will use the car as a taxi. This will help the family increase its income and improve living conditions. He plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Сатторов Бозор житель города Турсун-Заде. Женат , имеет шестерых детей. Работает на аллюминиевом заводе. Зарплата , получаемая им еле хватает для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит и купить автомобиль « Тико». Использовать машину будет в качестве такси. Это поможет семье увеличить доходы и создать лучшие условия. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Car purchase

loans.name: Bejzada

texts.en: Bejzada H. was born 1956  and she is from the  village of Sjenina. Her husband works in Italy and his salary is 1000 KM. Bejzada has two children; her son is unemployed and her daughter is in her second year of secondary school. Bejzada will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy a cow. Now, she has a horse and her wish is  to produce food for cattle.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Adjovi Délali

texts.fr:
Dame A. Adjovi Délali est née le 04 décembre 1972 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis plus de 8 ans, elle a pour activité commerciale, la vente du charbon de bois et du fagot de bois. Elle s’approvisionne dans un village situé à 80 Km de Lomé. Les frais de transport de marchandises étant trop élevés, elle a toujours de rupture de stock et n’arrive pas à bien satisfaire ses clients.
Pour éviter d’aller s’approvisionner de temps en temps et pour réduire les frais de transport, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 45 sacs de charbon de bois. Ainsi cet important stock lui permettra de servir les clients pour au moins 2 mois et dame A. Adjovi Délali pourra bénéficier des frais de transport qu’elle aurait dû payer au transporteur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjovi Délali A. was born on December 4, 1972 in Lomé. She's married and the mother of two children. For 8 years, she's been selling charcoal and bundles of firewood. She gets her supplies in a village located 80 km from Lomé. Due to high transportation costs, she's always out of stock and cannot meet customer demand. To avoid having to go and get her supply on a regular basis, and to lower the transportation costs, she's seeking this first loan to buy 45 sacks of charcoal. This large stock will enable her to meet customer demand during at least two months, and Mrs. Adjovi Délali A. will be able to keep the money she would have had to pay for transport.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Marta Silvia

texts.es: La Señora Martha S. D. R., tiene el negocio en su domicilio, donD. empezó vendiendo pasteles a sus amistades y a sus familiares, actualmente tiene contratos con clientes desD. hace más D. tres años, cuando su primer prestamo con EMPRENDER,  D. Bs. 1000  fue utilizado en la compra D. insumos, posteriormente, y con su segundo crédito compró un horno industrial, con el que vio mejorar en gran medida su pequeño negocio, hasta hoy que utilizará el crédito para la compra D. un segundo horno industrial. En su familia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien refiere estar muy orgulloso D. ella. Su aspiración es hacer crecer su negocio y poder tener una pasteleria.
texts.en:
Martha S. D. R. has a business in her home selling pastries to her friends and family. Currently, she has contracts with customers that have lasted more than three years. With her first loan from EMPRENDER of Bs. 1,000, she bought supplies. With her second loan, she bought an industrial oven that grew her small business. She will use this loan to purchase a second industrial oven. In her family, she has the support of her husband who is very proud of her. Her goal is to grow her business and establish her own pastry store.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos. Se dedica a la producción de cítricos desde hace 20 años, actividad que le agrada realizar, debido a que sus padres también fueron agricultores, se siente identificada con esta actividad y lo que más le  gusta es cosechar sus frutas en sus respectivas temporadas. De la misma manera, el poder vender  cítricos es rentable, si se sabe aprovechar las temporadas en que la demanda es alta, lo difícil es lidiar con el clima y con los insectos que amenazas sus cultivos. Carmen esta en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas de mora en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de abonos e insecticidas para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 49, is a single mother of 5 children. She has been growing citrus fruits for 20 years. She has enjoyed this activity since she was a child, as her parents were also farmers. Her favorite part is picking the fruits during their respective harvesting season. Selling the crops is profitable when she can take advantage of the high demand season. The hard part of growing citrus fruit is to battle with the weather and with the insects that threaten her crops. Carmen has obtained four loans through MFP. To this date, she has had no problem keeping up with the payments. The loan that Carmen is requesting this time will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and pesticides for citrus fruit crops

loans.name: La Armonia Group

texts.es:
G/S LA  ARMONIA, Este g/s  está haciendo uso de su noveno ciclo  de préstamo de ADIM. Trabajan con el apoyo de sus familiares, comenzaron ambulantes y cuando ingresaron en ADIM obtuvieron un primer crédito de $100 (cien dólares cada uno).

Doña Mayerling, con los créditos que ADIM le ha proporcionado ha tenido la oportunidad de acondicionar el local donde tiene su negocio, lo que le permite tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
Doña Estelvina nos manifiesta que con los créditos de adim ella ha logrado comprar un frezer para el almacenamiento de su producto.
El g/s además ha tenido la oportunidad de capacitarse y han aplicado en su negocio lo aprendido. Sueñan en un futuro obtener créditos con montos mayores, sabe que para lograrlo tendrían  que aplicar a un crédito individual  y ellos  prefieren seguir en g/s.
texts.en:
The La Armonia group is making use of their ninth cycle of ADIM loans, working with the support of their families. They started out as street vendors, and when they joined ADIM they obtained their first loan of $100 each. Doña Mayerling, with the loans ADIM has given her, has been able to equip the space where she has her business, permitting her go have a better condition of life for her family. Doña Estelvina shows us that with the ADIM loans she has been able to buy a freezer to store her product. The group has had opportunity as well to get training, and they have applied what they learned to their businesses. They dream in the future of being able to obtain higher credit, and they know that in order to do so, they will have to apply for individual credit, and they prefer to continue in a group.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to grow their businesses

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Kam L. is 37 years old, married with 3 children. She is a housewife taking care of her children and cooking for them. The family is totally dependent on her husband, Chhum Seak, 40 years old (He was pictures on the left hand side), who works as sculptor. He makes about $10 a day. There children are students and currently in business short term selling souvenirs in front of Angkor Temple to help alleviate the family’s cost. 

Kam L. is requesting a US $1000 loan to purchase crafts and sell as souvenirs to tourists at Angkor Temple to bring in other income for the family.

loans.use: Sell souvenirs.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Pictured here is 51 year-old Eliza K. from Mwanza. She is married with four children who are between the ages of 18 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two orphans.

Eliza has been running a beverage business since 2006. She sells beers, water and soda. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Eliza currently earns about 200USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more beers such as Kilimanjaro, tusker, safari lager, the kick, reds, Bavaria and Serengeti. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Eliza thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beers such as Kilimanjaro, tusker, safari lager, the kick, reds, Bavaria and Serengeti

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase drinks to sell and a refrigerator. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell and a refrigerator

loans.name: Moriamo

texts.en: Moriamo is 39 years old and married with 3 children. Moriamo sells clothes. She acquired the skill from her mother and she has been in the business for the past 15 years. Moriamo travels to Ogun state twice a month to buy clothes. Moriamo has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. Moriamo is requestin the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh T. is 27, married, and the father a 3-year-old son who is attending kindergarten. Altansuh's family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

Altansuh and his wife started a retail business last year that imports wooden planks from Ereen, a border city in China where many Mongolians buy goods to resell. He has many repeat clients who are mostly carpenters or people who want to build a wood yard at their home. During the last year, Altansuh's business capital increased from 2500,000 tugrugs to 3000,000 tugrugs ($1.00 =1450 MNT).

He and his wife are planning to build their own wood-working shop. With this loan, Altansuh will go to Ereen, China, to buy more wood.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Y. is a housewife. But, she was not content to just stay in the house and do all the chores. She wanted to help her husband, Hermenio Y.. She is now helping on the farm to contribute something to the family's income. Aida is 57 years old. She owns the 1 hectare of land that her husband is tilling. She started farming just recently,  although they have had a farm since 1968.

She is asking for a loan of PHP12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming products. Some of the loan will also be used to start a new business. She is just trying to figure out what business to engage in aside from rice farming.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming products.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia E. is a 49-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are currently in school. She lives with her family in the village of St Peter's at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana.

Sophia has been in business for 22 years and she works as a food vendor selling banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Sophia has many customers since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use her loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Her hope is to increase her income in order to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials – maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Mrs Agustina O. is a 70-year-old widow with one married child. She is a resident of Mapang Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. Mrs O. has operated a sari-sari ('various kinds') store at their home for almost five years. She started the business with her own capital from the monthly pension she receives as a retired teacher.

Mrs O. heard that Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), offered a pensioners' loan so she visited their office for some information. She was interested in joining because of the insurance benefit. So on November 20, 2007, she became an associate member of PMPC under the Program for Pensioners. She availed herself of the opportunity to take a loan. Through PMPC Mrs O. was able to expand her business by adding a fruit stall as an extension of her sari-sari store.

She is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP for the additional purchase of grocery stocks and fruits. Mrs O. is very happy operating her business, and her only dream is that her business will grow and continue to support her in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks and fruits

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Herminia del Carmen tiene la edad de 41 año, casada, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo es cadete de taxi, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace seis años inicio con apoyo de su esposo, procreo tres hijos dos independiente y uno estudia. Sus planes para la familia es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, como apoyar a su hija para que estudie. Con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados, lácteos para tener productos variados y ofrecer a sus clientes. Con esta inversión espera crecer y obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de brindar préstamo a plazos accesibles para crecer en su negocio lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia del Carmen is 41 years and married. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they have three children, two of whom are independent and one of whom is still studying. She has been running her own small grocery store for the past six years. Her goals for the future of her family are to improve her home and to continue to support her daughter in her studies. She will use this loan to buy basic grains, canned goods and dairy products so that she will have a wide variety of products to offer her clients. With this investment, she hopes to expand her business and earn more in profits. She thanks Afodenic for giving her the opportunity to take out loans on accessible terms in order to expand her business, which have been very beneficial for her.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, canned goods and dairy products

loans.name: Utkur

texts.en:
U. Utkur is 18 years old and lives in Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. Utkur has been engaged in commercial service and trade for the last four years. He started helping with his mother's business of selling underwear when he was studying in school. Today he trades separately from his mother and has his own business turnover. It is not enough so Utkur is applying to Kiva for the business-development loan of 1200 STJ for six months. 

Utkur wants to import underwear from a Chinese underwear-making factory together with his friend. He wants to apply as the partner. It permits him to increase the business turnover and to take the next business-development step. Day to day he may increase business turnover and to enlarge the existing business. He thanks Kiva for supporting small entrepreneurs and small-business development.   

MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. MLF MicroInvest sees the next step in its development as a transformation into a micro-loan deposit-taking organization. Therefore in October 2008, MLF MicroInvest together with Frontiers LLC founded the micro-loan deposit-taking organization Arvand LLC.

Arvand, being an assignee of MLF MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission: to improve the standard of living of the population by creating new opportunities for social and economic development. It does this by providing qualitative financial and technical services to the entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import underwear

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 40-year-old woman. She is married with seven children; four are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells 'banku' and rice balls ('omotuo'). 'Banku' is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her children's education. She has been in business for five years now and believes with her rich experience, she can improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en:
Dolor L. T. is from the town of Aloran. She is 35 years old. Dolor is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Dolor raises and sells ducks. Dolor has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dolor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolor is requesting a loan amounting to 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dolor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Es un grupo antiguo  son cumplidos en sus pagos,viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SOL NACIENTE", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 4º Ciclo y esta  como presidenta la señora Patricia Veronica S. , su actividad es la venta de comida ella vive en anticretico, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como jardinero en la alcaldia, es cumplida en sus pagos. Como tesorera esta la socia Angela J. A. quien es fundadora del grupo, ella vende peluches (muñecos de tela)  y trabaja haciendo limpieza en una casa particular, tiene 4 hijos pero 2 dependen de ella, ella es muy activa, apesar de ser de la tercera edad. Como secretaria esta la socia Hilda M. J. quien vende ropa de temporada ambulando los dias de feria, tiene 3 hijos y esta concubinada, el es albañil,viven en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
This is a long-time group in which the members have completed their payments on time. They live in the same neighborhood and know each other well. The group has named their communal bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) and they are on their 4th loan cycle.

The group president is Sra. Patricia Veronica S., who is engaged in selling food. She lives in a rental property with her 3 children. Her husband is employed by the city as a gardener. Patricia has completed her previous loan payments.

Serving as treasurer, Angela J. A. is also the founder of the group. She sells stuffed toys (dolls made of fabric) and also works as a housekeeper at a private home. She has 4 children, of whom two are still dependent. She is very active despite being one of the older members.

Hilda M. J. is the group secretary. She sells seasonal clothing as a traveling merchant at the different fairs. She has 3 children with her live-in partner, who is a bricklayer. They live in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their operating capital

loans.name: Trust And Pay Group

texts.en:
This is Wurie Bella B. and Kadiatu S. of the Trust and Pay group. They are petty-traders in Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone. For the third time, they are seeking a loan of Le 1,800,000 from SMT/Kiva to help them further improve their businesses and standard of living. With the help of previous SMT/Kiva loans, these entrepreneurs have experienced a vast improvement in their businesses and personal lives. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan from Kiva lenders through SMT.

Wurie Bella B. (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town about twenty-eight years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have five children together. Two of her children are now in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), one is class one, the other in class five and the last is not of school going age. Wurie sells market food. She has been in this business for four years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Leda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Leda del Socorro A. González, tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos , los cuales estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que la sala de su vivienda la toma para su negocio de ventas de cosméticos y utensilio ya que esto no le permite tener privacidad en su hogar , antes que doña Leda se dedicará a la venta de productos AVON , lavaba y planchaba para obtener un ingreso . Ahora ella esta contenta por la  oportunidad  de su crédito ya que le hemos dado  el financiamiento de tener un trabajo diferente el cual le permite estar al cuidado de sus hijos y a la vez atendiendo a sus clientes. Comprara productos de cosmético para ofertar a sus clientes y cumplir con la demanda.  Así como ella hay muchas mujeres que son beneficiadas con estos préstamo que le damos al sector comercio.
texts.en:
Leda del Socorro A. González is 35 years old and lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla with her husband who works as a driver to support her with the home expenses. They have three children who are in primary school. Their plans for the family are to improve their living conditions as the living room of their house is being used for Leda's business selling cosmetics and accessories, which does not give them any privacy in their home. Before Leda sold Avon products, she washed and ironed to make a living. She is now happy for the opportunity of this loan which gives her the financial backing to take up a different job that allows her to take care of her children and at the same time attend to her customers. With this loan she will buy cosmetic products to offer to her clients and meet demand. Just like Ledy, there are many women who benefit from similar loans in the commercial sector.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Amelia Elena

texts.es: Amelia Elena M. R. reside en Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Amelia tiene 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija. Para Amelia ha sido muy difícil sacr su negocio adelnate ya que empezó con poca mercadería en su tienda y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su inventario son cinco años los que Amelia lleva a cargo de su negocio, pero ahora ella solicta de un crédito el cual le ayude a solidificar las bases de su tienda surtiéndola de variedad de mercadería que le permita que sus clientes compren todo lo que necesitan en su negocio.
texts.en:
Amelia Elena M. R. resides in Colon in the La Libertad region. Amelia is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. For Amelia it has been very difficult to move her business forward since she began with very little merchandise in her store. Over the five years that Amelia has been in charge of the business, she has increased the merchandise little by little. Now she is requesting a loan that will help her to solidify the foundation of her store by supplying it with a variety of merchandise that will allow her customers to buy everything they need from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her store with merchandise

loans.name: Luis Reynaldo

texts.en: Senor Luis has sold shoes for 20 years. He began his business when he wasn’t able to find other work and has continued to maintain his business all these years because it has allowed him to support his family and improve their living conditions. This loan of C$20,000 will go towards the purchase of more shoes for his inventory. Luis has a good credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for his inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Barangay Uno. She is 45 years old. Evelyn is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling viands, fruits, and other grocery products in the local community. Evelyn is just starting this business.

In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ruth Rocio

texts.es:
La socia ROCIO es una humilde persona que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella estudio cosmetología y actualmente esta haciendo sus prácticas profesionales en el Centro Educativo Ocupacional  “C.E.O. Divino Maestro”. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene anhelos de superación y requiere el préstamo para abrir un centro de belleza exclusivo para mujeres de bajos recursos quiere comprar tijeras, espejos y sillones.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member ROCIO is a humble person who belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. She is 25 years old, single, and without children. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is located to the south of the city of Cusco. She studied cosmetology and now is doing a professional internship in the Occupational Education Center “C.E.O. Divino Maestro”. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young woman who has dreams of overcoming her current challenges. She needs this loan to open a beauty salon that will exclusively serve low-income women; she wants to buy scissors, mirrors, and chairs. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through these means and therefore she promises to make all her payments according to her time line.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs this loan to open a beauty salon that will exclusively serve low-income women; she wants to buy scissors, mirrors, and chairs.

loans.name: Ana Rubia

texts.es: Ana Rubia R. G. de 29 años de edad, reside en Ataco en el departamento de Ahuchapán. Vive junto a sus padres. Ella posee una venta de ropa desde hace diez años, negocio el cual le ha permitido brindarle ayuda a sus padres. Ana solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes tallas y colores, ella desea poder aumentar su inventario en estos días del mes para poder aprovechar la temporada navideña y de fin de años en las cuales la venta de ropa se aumenta, es con esta intención que ella solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana Rubia is 29 years old, she lives in Ataco in the department of Ahuchapán with her parents. Ana has had a clothing shop for ten years which her parents helped her to establish. Ana seeks a loan so that she can buy a large amount of clothes in different sizes and colors. She hopes to be able to increase her inventory at this time of the month so she can take advantage of the Christmas season and the end of the year when clothing sales rise, this was why she sought a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a clothing in a variety of colores and styles

loans.name: Jemty

texts.en:
Jemty T. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, beans and onions in the market, and is requesting a loan to purchase jerry cans of cooking oil to sell. Jemty is 30 years old. Her husband is a driver. She has one child, and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase jerry cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mariza Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maritza del Socorro N. D., nació en 1974, en la ciudad de Managua es casada y su marido trabaja como guarda de seguridad, apoyándole económicamente en los gastos mensuales de su casa. Ellos habitan en el barrio Waspan Norte es madre de 5 hijos, y de ellos dependen únicamente dos de todos sus hijos, trabaja en el mercado oriental vendiendo comida rápida y refrescos la comida la prepara en su casa y la lleva a su puesto de venta en el Oriental, la peor desgracia que ha pasado en su vida ha sido un préstamo que solicitó hace 4 años y saliendo del Banco con U$ 5,000.00 fue asaltada despojándola de la esperanza de trabajar para mejorar su vida y la de su familia tras esto la señora se vio obligada a vender su tramo y reiniciar de nuevo con su negocio, hoy en día desea volver a intentar mejorar la venta y con un nuevo crédito y compararía un freezer para los refrescos y se supliría de más materia prima. Esto le beneficiaria económicamente para nuevos proyectos que tengan en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza del Socorro N. D., who was born in 1974 in the city of Managua, is married; her husband works as a security guard, supporting Maritza and covering the monthly household expenses.They live in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. Maritza is the mother of 5 children, only 2 of whom still depend on their parents. Maritza works in the eastern market in Managua, selling fast food and beverages. She prepares the food in her house and carries it to her food stall in the market. The worst misfortune that has occurred in Maritza's life has been a loan that she requested 4 years ago. As she left the bank with the 5000 US dollars in cash, she was assaulted. The experience stripped her of the hope of working to improve her life and the lives of her family members. To repay the loan that was stolen from her, she had to sell her market stall and restart her business from scratch. These days she wants to try again to improve her sales. With the new loan she will buy a freezer for the beverages and will imcrease her inventory of raw materials. This investment will benefit her economically; the increased earnings will be used for new projects in the family's lives.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Kanda Sellers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Kanda Sellers Group. They are small scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to SMT/Kiva Lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Marie S.. The 29-year-old Marie S. was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a teacher and they have three children. Marie has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells cow skins (Kanda). With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more cow skins (kanda) to sell.

loans.use: Buy dozens of cow skins to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of Gimangpang, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Elvira is married and has 4 adult-aged children.

To make a living Elvira operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She manages a general store, which is situated at her house in Trinidad, Bohol. She does her best to earn enough income to provide for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education. She says that one of the challenges she and her husband face is the increasing school fees they have to pay.
Marivic would like to request a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to add inventory to her store. Her dream is for her business to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 48 años, tiene una hija llamada Rocio de 11 años. Ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a su hija.

Delfina se dedica a la venta de bebidas alcohólicas como por ejemplo cerveza y chicha (La chicha de jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América, y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.), ella prepara chicha solo los días miércoles, viernes y domingos para vender en su picantería. Ella también se dedica a la agricultura y siembra maíz y zapallo. Ella nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que por causa de las fuertes precipitaciones que cayeron en la ciudad de Urubamba, el maíz se malogro y dejó perdidas irrecuperables, pero a pesar de las adversidades la socia seguirá trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia. Las socia requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semilla y jora.   El anhelo de la socia es abrir una tienda donde pueda vender frazadas y colchones.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Delfina belongs to the Reyna de los Ángeles Communal Bank. She is a native of Urubamba. She is 48 years old, and she has an 11 year old daughter named Rocio. She is a responsible mother who is every minute looking for opportunities to get ahead. Through her daily effort she looks to give her daughter a better future. Delfina sells alcoholic beverages such as beer and “chicha” (“chicha de jora” is an ancestral drink in Perú and América. The main ingredient is yellow or fermented corn). She only makes chicha on Thursdays, Fridays, and Sundays to sell in her restaurant. She also farms and grows corn and zucchini. She tells us very sadly that due to the strong rains that fell in the city of Urubamba the corn was lost, and she was left with unrecoverable losses. But, in spite of the adversities, she continues working to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and yellow corn. She wishes to open a store where she could sell blankets and mattresses. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seeds, and yellow corn

loans.name: Romalda

texts.es: Romalda tiene 32 años, tiene 2 hijos y juntos viven en una casa al cual ella cuida. Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de comida, siendo los días miércoles y sábados que ofrece sus potajes en las ferias comerciales en su localidad. Paralelamente a ello, y durante los demás días que tiene, realiza labores agrícolas, cuidando sus cultivos que tiene sobre terrenos arrendados. Estas actividades, la ayudan económicamente para sostener a sus 2 hijos, que aún están en etapa escolar. Ella sabe que todo trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio y es por esta razón que continuará trabajando y mejorando su puesto de venta de comida, por lo que requerira de nuevos implementos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y manifiesta que le será  muy útil éste aporte para el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una carpa para que ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes y vender con mayor seguridad sus comidas, que lo realiza de manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Romalda, 32, has 2 children with whom she lives in a house that she takes care of. For three years, she has earned extra income from selling prepared meals, going on Wednesdays and Saturdays to sell her product in nearby markets. In addition to that, she works as a share-cropper, tending crops on rented land. The two sources of income allow her to support her 2 children, both of whom are still in school. She knows that all work requires sacrifice and, consequently, she keeps on working and improving her food business for which she now needs new supplies. This is Romalda's third MFP loan. She has been very responsible about repaying past loans and she tells us that this loan will help her efforts to improve the business. She will use the loan to buy a tent so that she can make her customers more comfortable and so that she can more easily sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tent for food business.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por tres mujeres trabajo una de ellas es Darling H. quien distribuye productos Avon, perfumes y cremas entre sus conocidas y los pobladores de su barrio.
Sus compañeras de grupo Alma Nidia C. Marena comerciante de perfumes y Damaris de los Ángeles H. vende ropa zapatos y ropa.
texts.en:
The group Esther is comprised of three hard-working women. One of the members is Darling H.. She sells Avon products, such as perfumes and creams, to her friends and neighbors. Her associates are Alma Nidia C. Marena, who sells perfumes, and Damaris de los Ángeles H., who sells shoes and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Avon products.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Irene,  ella socia tiene 32 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades del hogar con la ganadería, ella cría animales vacunos y animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral y vende sus animales cuando alcanzan su madurez. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un nuevo animal vacuno.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Communal Bank “Pacaha Illariy”. She lives in the community of Llullucha in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Irene is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She divides her time between her household activities and raising livestock. The animals she raises include cattle and smaller animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and poultry. She sells her animals once they reach maturity. Irene is requesting a loan in order to buy another cow.

She is grateful and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her loan payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39 year old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and one sibling. Two other members of her household also work to support the family. She has been renting a shop where she sells clothes since 2004. She has more than 15 years of experience in the sales field. 

She is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  She plans to use the loan to increase her store’s inventory. She will bring new merchandise from Turkey. Many entrepreneurs sell clothes and blankets from Turkey because it is close in proximity and known for its high quality of goods. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, but they are gaining a greater presence in the country’s labor market. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering microloans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Santiago II, se reúne cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal  Bolivianitas. Su presidenta es Albertina Julia P. de 39 años, casada y madre de dos niños, ella tiene su taller de chaperia, el cual administra conjuntamente  con su esposo, en esta oportunidad necesitan el préstamo para adquirir capital fijo como la moledora, el mismo le permitirá agilizar el trabajo. Albertina valora mucho el ahorro que tiene en Pro Mujer, ya que en su casa no puede ahorrar.
Sus demás compañeras también cuentan con negocios propios de comercio, servicio y producción. Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Bolivianitas Group meets every two weeks in one of the Pro Mujer centers, Santiago II. Its president is Albertina, 39, who is married with two small children. She has an auto repair shop which she runs together with her husband. They need a loan to buy fixed assets, such as a grinder, which will allow them to streamline work. Albertina greatly appreciates the savings that she keeps with Pro Mujer, since she cannot keep savings in her house. The rest of her friends also count on their own businesses in commerce, service and production. All of them need this loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fixed assets (grinder)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun N. is a 46-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Sun N. has another financial earner in her husband who is a vehicle repairman. This couple has three school-aged kids, while another one is married and lives independently. 

To help alleviate her hard physical labor on the farm, Sun N. is taking out a loan to purchase a pair of cattle that she will use to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of cattle to plow the farmland

loans.name: Zaweria

texts.en:
Zaweria is 50 years old and is married with seven children who are all adults. Three of her children are currently in college.

Zaweria is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in Central Province, Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for thirty-three years, producing maize and milk which she sells to the local market. She also depends on the income of her husband who is employed.

Zaweria has requested this loan of KES 53,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to purchase a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk to sell, which will earn her income that will help improve her family’s living standard.

In the future, Zaweria would like to acquire four more dairy cows, each producing twenty liters daily. She says that farmers cannot afford to raise such an amount of money on their own but, through Juhudi, farmers can afford to realize their dreams.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie A. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 37 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Lenie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dry goods in the local community. Lenie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2001, Lenie joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Lenie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Katharine's Group

texts.en:
Katharine supports her family by doing sewing work. She is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighboring clients. The reason she started this business is because her husband’s income was not regular and it was very difficult for her family to survive financially. Her husband works as a laborer. 
She is the mother of two daughters and a son. Both of her daughters are nurses and make contributions to improving the financial condition of their family.  

Katharine lives with her family in a three room brick house made of mud in the area of Clarkabad.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan she will buy an electric sewing machine and hire a worker who will assist her in completing orders on time. She hopes that by hiring an assistant her business will expand and her income will increase as well. 

Her elder daughter is now of marriage age and Katharine is confident that she will be able to marry her soon with the help of an increased income. 
She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has proved a responsible client of Asasah. In the previous years of loans she has maintained a good credit history and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: buying an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza M. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her young sister and brother). She lives in a home that she owns, having access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expenses.

Specioza has a poultry-farming business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products from her home, both wholesale and retail. Her main business challenges include transportation and poultry diseases. She also generates additional income through selling cement and iron bars.

Specioza has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed and more chicks. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own 2,000 laying birds.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and more chicks

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a small venture selling men’s upper clothing in one of the local markets. All her merchandise is characterized by high quality and reasonable price. Two of the best attractions of her business are affordable rent and favorable location. 

Yelena is a workaholic. She works in the worst weather conditions and is ready to sacrifice time and rest to achieve even higher results. She has been in this trade for 13 years. Currently, her gross income is about 30,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly net profit amounts to 9,000 Grivnyas.  

Yelena has benefited from previous lending assistance. Now she is hoping to receive a loan of 16,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. Yelena is very customer-friendly. She is also very prompt with payments. This timely financial support will be crucial for her as her small venture is main source of income for her and her family.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of Lullutan. She is 48 years old. Cristina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cristina A..

Cristina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita K. is from the village of Paglaum Village, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 30 years old. Conchita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling chicken and pork barbecues in the local community. Her husband has a motorela or habal-habal motorcycle transportation service as additional income for her family. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S., 45, is a resident of Kompong Tom Province. He is a local farmer. Besides working as a farmer, he also works as a horse driver for tourists who want to visit the countryside, and picks up some products from his neighbors to transport to and from other provinces for additional income. 

Mr. Sok S. is married to Mrs. Bork Ya, age 45, also a local farmer. They are blessed with six children, and all of them are single. However, the family recently is facing difficulty with their living conditions due to their house needing repair. To solve the problem, Mr. Sok S. would like a loan to buy some pieces of wood to repair a part of his broken house. (His wife is pictured, because Mr. Sok S. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to repair a broken part of his house

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.en:
Mariluz J. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bulobito-on, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a clothing sales (RTW) business. Her husband, Donato J., is 49 years old and works as a vendor and also helps in his wife's business. The couple has five children between 15 and 26 years old. Mariluz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mariluz has been lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. One of her previous loans of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, greatly improving the family’s standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, Mariluz is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP to use as additional capital to buy more clothing to sell so that she can continue to save for future home repairs. Mariluz  J. is a Project Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward achieving her dreams.	 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have embarked on a path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Francisca Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Francisca, ella tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo de 15 años que  estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica a la venta de gafas y sombreros de paja toquilla que son muy apreciados sobre todo por los turistas que visitan el lugar, su forma de venta es recorriendo las calles, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos, sus productos se los envían desde Guayaquil y también compra a artesanos del lugar. Dice que lleva varios años en este negocio y que hay días buenos y malos pero que esto por lo menos le ayuda para los gastos de su familia.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gafas y sombreros. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  8 años y le gusta por los beneficios que la institución ofrece como por ejemplo los créditos emergentes, de estudio y otros. Sus sueños son ver que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the 'María Monserrate' community bank meets in Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we find Francisca who is 43 years old.  She is married and has a 15 year-old son from her marriage who is in school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Francisca sells sunglasses and Panama hats which are very popular, especially with the tourists who visit her town.  She sells in the streets, working Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  Her products are sent from Guayaquil and she also buys from local craftsmen.  She says that she has been in this business for several years and that there are both good days and bad days.  However, it is helping her to cover her family's expenses.

This loan will be used to buy glasses and hats.  Francisca has been a member of her community bank for 8 years and she likes the benefits that the institution offers such as, for example, the emergency loans, the student loans, and others.  Her dream is to see her son finish his studies and become a professional.

loans.use: To buy glasses and hats

loans.name: José Augusto

texts.en:
Jose is forty-six years old.  He shares his home with his partner and their three children.  They live in the small village of Collique Bajo, which is located in the district of Zaña and is approximately forty minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.  It occupies a river valley, and through complicated irrigation systems and a relatively high water table, the population is able to plant a wide variety of crops including rice, corn and sugar cane.

Jose raises cattle in corrals near his home.  He raises both dairy cows and cattle for their meat.  He has been involved in the business for over ten years.  In addition to cattle, Jose has a small plot of land on which he plants and raises crops.  Depending on the season and the crop rotation, he can be found planting any number of common crops in the area, including corn, rice, beans and vegetables.

The planned use of the loan is to purchase additional feed for the cattle and fertilizer for his crops.  He wants to invest additional funds in his current products in order to increase his income over the coming months and improve his family’s lifestyle.  He dreams of making improvements to his home and providing his children with education.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the cattle and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
