Victoria D. L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old. Victoria is married and has two children, age 14 and 11. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

Victoria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.7

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María Dolores, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  una hija de 6 años la misma que estudia en primer año de escuela. Su esposo es tecnólogo medico. Ella por su parte es Lic. En idiomas y trabaja en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Se dedica a la venta productos por Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja en sociedad con una hermana todos los días unas dos horas al dia, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito  y cobra semanalmente,  ella vende a sus compañeras de trabajo las mismas que son sus clientes hace varios años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, ropa,  entre otros productos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los intereses son más bajos que otras instituciones. Sus sueños son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Parque Ecológico' community bank meet in San Eduardo neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is well-known for its beautiful park which is very popular with tourists and locals who want to spend a day in touch with nature.

Here we meet María Dolores.  She is 28 years old, married, and has a 6 year-old daughter who is in her first year of elementary school.  María Dolores' husband is a medical technologist.  She has a degree in languages and works at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí (Manabí Technical University).  She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories) and sells clothes through a catalog.  In this last business, she works in partnership with one of her sisters.  She works for two hours every day, making her sales door to door.  She takes orders for her products, leaves them on credit and collects payment every week.  She sells to her work colleagues who have been her customers for several years.

María Dolores will use this loan to buy perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, clothes and other products.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes the bank because its interest rates are lower than those of other institutions.  Her dream is to own her own store.

loans.use: To buy perfume, jewelry, creams, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Rasim

texts.ru:
Rasim A. 49 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey odin iz kotorix jenat i 2 iz kotorix  ne jenati. Rasim jivet v qorode Baku smeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Rasim uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey fruktov i ovoshey, ranshe on imel produktoviy magazin no potom on reshil pomenyat. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit vrukti i ovoshi dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Rasim A. is 49 years old. He is married and has three children one of whom is married and two are not. Rasim lives in the city of Baku together with his beloved wife and children. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for ten years and before that he had owned a grocery store. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables for resale and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rosebel

texts.en:
Rosebel A. is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Rosebel is married and has 6 small children. To make a living, Rosebel owns & operates a business manufacturing and selling slippers and sandals to local community members. Rosebel has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rosebel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosebel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI.  That loan was used to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings. 

Rosebel is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be Rosebel's  8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture sandals

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu B. is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  In 2006, Isatu established her caustic soda, maggi, and water plastic business. She started her business after gaining experience from her mother who is engaged in  the same business. This business is very special to Isatu as it is the only business she knows. Working seven days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL a month. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to purchase caustic soda and oil. She has a very good loan repayment history.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 240,000 SLL. In the future, Isatu plans to get another bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase caustic soda and oil

loans.name: Sonk Sounou Serigne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SONK SOUNOU SERIGNE est créé en 2006. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Elles sont très solidaire et ont pratiquement la même vocation qui est de développer de leur localié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR MBAR.

Madame YACINE D. (à droite de la photo vêtue de vêtements rouges bordeaux) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle achète les bœufs dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les engraisse pendant au moins cinq mois avant de les revendre. Elle est soutenue par son mari dans son activité

Son crédit de 250.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter une paire de bœufs pour réaliser son projet d'embouce. 

Son objectif est d'aider son mari a supporter les charges familiales comme la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SONK SOUNOU SERIGNE was founded in 2006.  It is made up of 15 women from the same village.  The group has come together as neighbors and friends.  They support each other very much and share the same calling to develop their village. The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of KEUR MBAR.

Mrs. YACINE D. (on the right, in dark red) is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. 

She grazes cattle. She buys cattle at the weekly markets and grazes them for at least five months before selling them.  Her husband supports her in the business.

The loan of 250,000 CFA francs will allow her to purchase two cattle and carry out her grazing project. 

Her goal is to help her husband with the family expenses such as food, health care and their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a yoke of oxen

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with six children, all of whom are grown ups. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Mwanatumu has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business.  Her potential customers are neighboring community members.  Mwanatumu dreams of expanding and purchasing a car for a taxi business in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 80,000 that she is requesting, Mwanatumu wants to purchase a new motorcycle for her business. She decided to work with Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase a new motorcycle for her transport business

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
María Josefa es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Taymi del distrito de Tucume. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

María Josefa se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven ayudando a sus padres. María Josefa se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral y cerdos, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Josefa is a 43-year old mother who lives with her family in the town of Taymi, located in the Tucume district.  This is an agricultural area located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María Josefa dedicates herself to work related to agriculture and, from a young age, helped her parents in this type of activity.  For the past 5 years, she has dedicated herself to raising and selling small animals, especially poultry and pigs, in a pen located near her house.  She feeds them natural grains and grasses and, when they have reached an ideal level of development, she offers them to sale to the merchants who frequently visit the zone where she lives.

She would like to buy more animals, as well as balanced feed, in order to expand her business and augment her income.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy more animals and well-balanced feed.

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es:
el grupo Manantial de Vida esta integrado por tres mujeres, las cuales se conocen desde hace varios años y se han formado en grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios, cabe mencionar que son mujeres luchadoras y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
dos de ellas se dedican a la misma actividad comercial que es la venta de frutas y verduras, tienen sus puestos en el mercado municipal de Nacaome en el cual venden limones, platanos, tomates, patastes, repollos, zanahorias, papas, aguacates, mangos, bananos, tamarindos, papayas, naranjas, y Glenda G. se dedica a la venta de pescado y camaron.
todas ellas dicen sentirse muy felices ya que sus negocios estan progresando y cada dia van creciendo un poco mas.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de mariscos, frutas y verduras. las ganancias las necesitan para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Manantial de Vida Communal Bank is comprised of three women.  They have known each other for several years, and they have formed a group in order to get ahead in their businesses.  It is worth mentioning that these women are tenacious, and they have a great desire to get ahead.

Two of them devote themselves to the same business activity, selling fruits and vegetables.  They have their stands at the Nacaome municipal market.  They sell lemons, plantains, tomatoes, chayote, cabbage, carrots, potatoes, avocadoes, mangos, bananas, tamarinds, papayas, and oranges.

Glenda G. sells fish and shrimp.

They are all very happy because their businesses are progressing.  Each day they are growing a little more.

They will use the loan to buy seafood, fruits, and vegetables.  They need the income to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy  fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en:
Hanzel H. is 35 years old and married but has no children yet. Hanzel is a hog raiser working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Hanzel is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase livestock feed and vitamins. Hanzel has been raising hogs for almost six years.

In the future, Hanzel hopes to improve the kind of business he manages and start another kind of business in order to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Abraham Plus Group

texts.en:
Abraham Plus is a group of 15 owners of small businesses chaired by Delly. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Delly is 44 years old. She operates a drugstore and sells soft drinks. She buys crates of soft drinks and resells them at a profit. She sells her products daily and nightly in her area.

Delly started her business in 2003. She is a trustworthy client of HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to increase the inventory of her business by buying more antibiotics and crates of soft drinks to increase her sales in order to make a better profit. Delly makes a profit of about US$25 per day. She is married and the mother of six children, aged six months to 17 years. Four of them attend school. She is also taking care of her cousin and niece. Her ambition is to become a medicine wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell at her drugstore and some crates of soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Damarys Eugenia

texts.es:
Damarys Eugenia tiene 35 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Damarys se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es salir adelante y progresar en la produccion.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Damarys Eugenia is 35 years old, married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in El Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

This village bank is called UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, and is located at the La América Area in Cantón  Ventanas.   This village bank works in agriculture growing short-cycle corn, rice and large beans.

Damarys works in agriculture and has specifically been growing corn and rice for a long time.  She makes her purchases each month in Ventanas and also sells at the fair there.

She has applied for the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and manure.  With the economic help of the loan she will be able to fulfill her needs, confront challenges like plagues and disease in the crops and the climate change.  Her dream is to get ahead and see progress in the production.

She likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad,  es divorciada y tiene dos hijos en su haber;  Miguel de 14 y Patricia  de 08 años de edad, viven en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Quimbiri. María trata de luchar contra las  adversidades del destino y  olvidar la inestabilidad familiar que aqueja su hogar,  se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva en el negocio, a pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino. Desde hace 5 años trabaja de forma independiente, ella posee un puesto en donde vende ropa para todo de público en general, en efecto reconoce el beneficio que esta teniendo, ya que sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito radica en la calidad y el precio de su producto. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo y su punto de venta lo realiza en la plaza “La Gamarrita” de su misma localidad. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar y por ello que recurre a los préstamos para seguir surgiendo y abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa alquilar un espacio en la galería comercial para poder vender y así exhibir toda variedad de ropas hacia el publico, según lo gustos y preferencias. Este será su 16avo crédito, espera una vez más ser apoyada con su apoyo para seguir surgiendo. Con el monto solicitado comprará  mayor cantidad de ropa por lo cual tiene que viajar a la ciudad de lima para adquirir  las mercadería a precio módico.
texts.en:
María, age 36, is divorced and has two children under her care.  Miguel is 14, and Patricia is 8.  They live in a rented house in the city of Quimbiri.  María tries to fight against the adversities of destiny.   She also tries to forget the family instability that distresses her household. 

She is known for being a woman of character and for being very competitive in her business.  She does this in spite of having had setbacks along the way.  She has been working in an independent manner for five years.  She has a stall where she sells clothing for all ages.  As a matter of fact, she recognizes the gains she has made because her sales are increasing over time.

The key to her success stems from the quality and the price of her product.  She usually works on her own, but sometimes her son helps her.  She sells in the La Gamarrita plaza in her town.  She is aware the she needs a lot to move up.  That is why she turns to the loans in order to keep developing and to keep stocking her merchandise.

In time, she plans to rent a space in the commercial gallery.  She will do this in order to be able to sell and display all types of clothing according to the taste and preferences of the public.

This will be her 16th loan.  She hopes, one more time, to receive your support in order to continue developing.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of clothes.  To do so, she needs to travel to the city of Lima in order to get the merchandise at a reasonable price.

loans.use: to travel to the capital to stock up on more clothes.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
36 year old Sam is a garment factory worker with an income of $3 per day. She is a single mother with 4 children, three of whom are students. The fourth – a daughter – is a potter. She makes pottery to sell at home and she can make $1 per day. 

Every month Sam has to spend $60 on food and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy materials for her daughter to make more pottery to sell, so that she can make more income from it and help Sam support her other children through to the end of their high school studies. In the future, Sam wants to start a tailoring shop at home because she wants to stay there to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy materials for her daughter's pottery business

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en: Two years ago Burul started to grow clover; she earns money by selling clover on the market. Burul is 26 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two children, both of whom are studying at school. At the moment she needs some money to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest. For this purpose, she applied for this loan. With the profits gained from selling the harvest, Burul wants to purchase livestock for breeding and reselling. Burul is the leader of this group. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Lusidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no  distrito de Matutuine provincia de Maputo.  Tem um filho ainda menor de idade.
Actualmente vive na zona turistica da Ponta de Ouro no distrito de Matutuine.  Faz comercio de pequena escala no seu estabelecimento e consegue um lucro alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no banco comercial(BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seus pais e irmaos, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Vem a tornar-se cliente  no ano de 2010. O seu primeiro emprestimo foi no valor de 8.000,00Mts para compra de cimento para fazer blocos, no segundo emprestimo foi para compra de produtos para seu estabelecimento comercial na compra de refregerantes e bebidas alcoolicas. No presente emprestimo de 15.000,00Mts  pretende comprar material de construcao ( cimento, pagamento de mao-de-obra ) para concluir a sua casa.
Tenciona ver sua casa concluida e seu estabelecimento comercial,  e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Lusidia was born in the district of Matutuine in the province of Maputo. She has one child who is still underage.
She currently lives in the tourist region of Ponta de Ouro in the district of Matutuine. She carries out small scale commerce in her establishment and manages to obtain a profit which she uses to feed her family and to save some money in the bank (BCI).
Lusidia came to know of Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with her parents and siblings. She decided to get closer in order to request clarification on the process for becoming a Hluvuku client and to benefit from financing to carry out her projects.
She became a client in 2010. Her first loan was for the amount of 8,000 metical (MZN) to purchase cement to make cement blocks, her second was to purchase products to sell in her commercial establishment, buying sodas and alcoholic beverages. With the current loan of 15,000 MZN she intends to purchase construction materials (cement and payment of labour) to finish building her home.
She intends to see the build of her house and commercial establishment completed and for this she will count on Hluvuku-Adsema for further loans.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement and payment of labour) to finish building her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To procure more millet and other ingredients to make porridge for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old and married to Rama. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a phone shop and distributing goods for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 5,500, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  He will use the loan to rent a permanent shop and stock up.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will use it as working capital to expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To rent a permanent shop and stock up.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria, es profesora de nivel primario. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que la señora esta estudiando en la noche y por su trabajo no está mucho tiempo en casa, de tal manera que usará la computadora para llevar registros de sus alumnos, tareas, trabajos asignados, etc., y también para sus estudios. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani  en la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita que su préstamo vaya a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Hilaria is an elementary school teacher.  She needs the loan to buy a laptop computer.  With going to school at night and her work, she does not have much time at home.  Therefore she will use the computer to keep her students’ records, their homework, and their assignments, etc.  She would also use it for her own studies.

She lives in her parents’ house, which is in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single, but she has two children.

This is the second time she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to keep her elementary students’ records, their homework, and their assignments, etc.  She would also use it for her own studies.

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana Angelica, la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo y a la venta de los mismos, la socia también compra productos de salud, de omnilife, estos productos los vende a los diferentes clientes que le solicitan productos naturales. La socia trabaja como promotora de productos de omnilife que son productos de salud, como batidos para bajar de peso de plantas medicinales naturales y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de salud para la venta.
 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MUJERES UNIDAS". The bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Senora Juana Angelica. She is 35 years old and has a partner. She has 2 children. The member buys and sells beauty products from catalogues. She also buys health products from Omnilife. She sells these products to different clients who ask for natural products. The member also works as a promoter for Omnilife products which are health products such as weight loss shakes made from natural medicinal plants and the like. The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of health products for later sale.

The member is grateful for the support given her and as such she agrees to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy health products to sell.

loans.name: Juliet M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city.  Their school was established in 1995 by the Methodist Mission to promote education in the city and it's surrounding area.  The school is staffed with five teachers and has enrollment of 72 pupils. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school's staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans.  With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their salaries alone.  But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children.  Others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business.  At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries.  The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments to SMT on their behalf.

47 year old Juliet is the leader of this group of teachers.  Juliet was born in a place call Siama, in eastern Sierra Leone.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is in college.  Juliet has been in the teaching profession for 26 years now.  She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child.

loans.name: Jephris Nyakowa

texts.en:
Jephris is a widowed woman.  She has eight children with ages ranging from seven years to twenty-two years. She describes herself as humble. 

She operates a fish selling business where she sells fish to the local people.  She has been involved in this business for six years.  Her business is located in a busy shopping centre in Kisumu.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase her stock of fish.  Her business goal is to grow her business to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish.

loans.name: Siyarkul

texts.ru: Суяркул женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он сам является членом дехканского хозяйства и владеет  небольшим участком земли. На земле выращивает сельхозкультуры, занимается виноградоводством и садоводством. Селхоз работы приносят хорошие доходы. Отходов производства не бывает. Так как отходы от селхозкультур идут на корм скота. С появлением кормовой базы крупного рогатого скота он стал заниматься выращиванием крупного рогатого скота на мясо, после откорма он сдает скот как мясо. Доходы хорошие. Он хочет получить займ для продолжения своего бизнеса, если не закупить сейчас корм и скот, он подорожает к зиме. Суяркул хочет получить займ и закупить оптом корм для скота и несколько голов скота. И откормить их к праздникам. Он надеется на благородство  добрых людей. Спасибо!
texts.en: Siyarkul is married and has two children. His wife takes care of the home. He is a farmer and owns a small plot of land. On this land, he grows crops, grapes and fruit trees. His farm brings him a good income. There is no waste produced by the farm, as any by-products are used to feed the animals. Since a new cattle feed supplier has opened, he has started raising meat cattle. He fattens animals and sells them for meat, which provides him with a good income. He would like a loan to support his business. It is important to purchase feed and more cattle now, as prices will increase closer to winter. Siyarkul would like a loan to purchase cattle feed wholesale, and a few heads of cattle that he can fatten up in time for the holidays. He is hoping for the generosity of kind people. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  48  años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, solo uno es independiente.

Trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra  y venta de animales caseros, también se dedica  a la venta de bayetas (telares).

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar  una bolsa de lana de oveja para la fábrica de bayetas.  Sus hijos y esposo le ayudan en el negocio, realizan la venta en la localidad de Yunguyo.  
Su esposo también se dedica a la agricultura.

Su sueño es progresar en le negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the 'Santa Barbara' community bank which is located in Yunguyo district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is independent.

Aurelia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business buying and selling animals.  She also works selling woven products.

Aurelia is requesting a new loan for 500 soles to buy a bag of sheep's wool for making her woven products.  Her children and husband help her in the business.  They sell their products in the town of Yunguyo.  Her husband also farms.

Aurelia's dream is to make progress in her business and improve her profits.  What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the training talks.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sheep's wool

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel, está casado,  tiene 55 años, tiene hijos, pero ya son todos mayores, viven en la ciudad de Caacupé.
El tiene una  despensa, la cual es su medio de subsistencia, y la forma en que ayuda en la casa. El comenta que cada 8 de diciembre, la ciudad de Caacupé reúne a miles de paraguayos, pues es el día de la Virgen Paraguaya, es decir la Virgen de Caacupé. Es en esos días que tiene muchas ventas, y lo cual le trae buenos ingresos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de alfarería, como ser figuras de la virgen y demás tipo, con lo cual podrá abastecerse, pues en esa época es lo que más se vende y lo que más ganancias traen. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Angel is 55 years old, he is married with grown-up children, and they live in the town of Caacupé.
He runs a small store that is his source of income and his way to help his family. He says that every year on December 8 thousands of Paraguayans gather together in the town of Caacupé to celebrate the day of the Paraguayan Virgin, that is the Virgin of Caacupé. It is during these days that he sells the most, therefore earning a good income.
He is requesting a loan to buy pottery products, such as statues of the Virgin and of other kinds in order to stock up his shop, as in those days this is what he sells the most and what makes him earn more money. He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity he has been given.

loans.use: To buy pottery souveniers to sell.

loans.name: Noeline

texts.en:
Noeline is 36 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 3 and 15. Her business is well organized. Noeline operates a shop where she sells items such as soap, water, juice, body lotion, etc. She has four years of experience and employs one person to help her.

Noeline has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more soap, water, juice, body lotion, rice, sugar, and Irish potatoes to sell. With her profit, Noeline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, water, juice, body lotion, etc.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 46 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future Elvie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is a 42-year-old, married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has 4 children aged between 10 and 17.

Bobby has been a farmer for 6 years. He tills his own land to grow rice crops to sell. He earns 31,000 php per harvest and is able to feed his family and send his children to school through his business. He works hard to improve his earnings and to save for his children's college education.

Bobby has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes that this loan will help increase his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is from the Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is sixty-five years old. Lydia is married and has three children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the labor cost of product manufacture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of product manufacture

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupement formé de vingt quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Martine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Martine est âgée de 59 ans et est mariée à un certain André. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Aucun des enfants n’est à leur charge. Pour faire face à ses charges, Martine vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc et des produits laitiers à son domicile et par la technique de distribution. Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroître le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Martine désire obtenir un financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DIEU EST GRAND.
texts.en:
The group DIEU EST GRAND consists of 24 people who live in the same neighborhood. Their representative is Martine, the member whose hand is raised in the photo. The group members are seeking financial support from ALIDé for the first time to help bolster their activities. 

Martine, age 59, is married to a man named André, and they have three independent children who are educated. Martine sells maize, cassava flour and dairy products out of her home and also through the distribution system. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To bolster her activity and better meet customer demand, Martine is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND.

loans.use: to buy maize, cassava flour and dairy products.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 55 years old.  He is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 18 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for the past 9 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two small children. Her husband works as a chemist in a food production company. Nevertheless, his income is not enough to cover household expenses and the needs of their children.

Therefore, Maria must contribute additional income for the family. She says she has always like sales, so 10 years ago she began selling shoes through a catalogue among her friends. Later she expanded her product line to include merchandise from Jafra and Tupperware.

She needs a loan of $1,375 USD to be repaid within 6–12 months to invest in additional merchandise in order to increase sales and cover current customer orders.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La Sra. Maria del socorro quien vive en la colonia cerro de la silla en Gudalupe, N.L. Esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, su esposo tiene un empleo de Químico en una empresa de alimentos, pero aun así, el ingreso no les alcanza para solventar los gastos de la casa y de sus dos pequeños.

Es por eso que la Sra. Maria del socorro tiene la necesidad de ayudar con un ingreso extra a su hogar, ella comenta que siempre le han gustado las ventas, es por eso que inicio desde hace 10 años, la venta de zapatos por catalogo, ofreciéndolos entre sus amistades, después complemento sus ventas y empezó a ofrecer productos Jafra y Topper Weare.

Ahora esta solicitando una oportunidad de crédito por $1,375 USD, en un plazo de 6-12 meses. esto es para invertir en zapatos y productos Jafra y Topper Ware, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que surtir y esta empezando a realizar tandas de productos con el fin de incrementar sus ventas

loans.use: She will invest this loan in her merchandise

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
My business is the buying and selling of gold to be used to make jewelry such as rings, chains and earrings. My best clients are young professionals who enjoy dressing sharp and wearing jewelry. As Mother's Day approaches, I need to increase my inventory so I can offer my clients more selection for gifts. The extra income from sales will be used to help my children's education and cover expenses at home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es la compra y venta de enchape de oro, actualmente en nuestro medio se usa mas las joyas de enchape ya sean anillos, cadenas, aritos. Mis mejores clientas son jovenes que trabajan en oficinas y les gusta andar presentables en su vestimenta y joyas. Por acercarse el dia de la madre necesito surtir el inventario para poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad para que ellos puedan regalar. Los ingresos que me genera este negocio son para ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y colaborar con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Buy gold to make earrings, chains, rings and other jewelry.

loans.name: Santos Eugenio

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Santos Eugenio, I sell clusters of bananas. I've been doing this for several years and it provides enough income to support my family and pay service providers. Sales have gone up and I don't have enough capital to meet my clients' demand. Thanks to my business I built my home and am continually making improvements on it.

Hola mi nombre es Santos Eugenio, mi actividad principal es la venta de bananos en racimos, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, actuamente el volumen de venta es mayor y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la clientela existente, gracias a este negocio he contruido mi casa la que poco a poco boy mejorando.

loans.use: Purchase banana clusters

loans.name: David

texts.en: David K. is fifty-two years of age and married with three children.  David is one of only a few bakers in Magburaka Town in Sierra Leone who supplies bread to the community. At certain periods, David can not meet the demand for bread due to lack of capital.  His previous loan from SMT helped him purchase bags of wheat flour and he would now like to increase his production even more.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to purchase raw materials for his bakery, including flour and yeast.

loans.use: Purchase stock of flour and yeast for his bakery

loans.name: Rail

texts.en:
Mr. Rail is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 22 and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Rail owns a herd of cows.  Each year between July and August he buys two or three calves, breeds them and sells the breeded cows in the local market.  The business is profitable but is time-consuming and takes a lot of effort.  

Rail provides for his people and can't afford to save money to develop his business.  He needs additional investment, so this summer he applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan.  This amount will allow him to buy four calves.  The price of a calf is about $120, but in half a year Rail could sell each breeded cow for $500.  He intends to constantly reinvest his profit margins to constantly increase the number of calves he can buy.

loans.use: To buy calves for breeding

loans.name: Keath

texts.en:
Mr. Keat H. was married in 1989 and has four children, one son and three daughters. He runs a business making beds which he sells to local people. Meanwhile, he and his wife also grow cucumber, corn and vegetables on his farm land.

He is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. He has asked for this $600 to purchase wood so that he can increase the amount of beds he can sell.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making beds to sell to local people

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Although her husband has passed away, P. is not giving up. She is determined to run the Food chips business for their 3 children. Two has finished highschool, one is still in middle school. Daily living expense is about Rp 30,000.00 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp 9,000-9,500.00), and child schooling expense is about Rp100,000.00; not a small amount. Profit of Rp35,000 is certainly not sufficient. Not included in those large expenses are rental expenses of Rp180,000.00/month. The two children who finished highschool are helping her in the business. Loan of Rp1,000,000.00 she hoped could help her increase the sales volume of her food chips. Her rental room is also her business site. As a Food chips maker, S. has to provide kitchen utensils that would support her.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun suaminya sudah meninggal P. tidak putus asa. Dia bertekad menekuni usaha peyek demi 3 orang anaknya. Dua orang sudah tamat SLTA, seorang lagi masih duduk di bangku kelas 1 SLTP. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak per bulan Rp 100.000,00 bukan jumlah yang kecil. Keuntungan usaha Rp 35.000,00 tentu tidak mencukupi. Pengeluaran sebesar itu masih belum termasuk biaya kos Rp 180.000,00/bulan. Kedua anaknya yang sudah tamat SLTA bekerja untuk membantunya. Pinjaman sebesar Rp 1.000.000,00 dia harapkan dapat membantu menambah volume penjualan peyeknya. Rumah kosnya adalah tempat usahanya. Sebagai pengusaha peyek, S. perlu menyediakan peralatan dapur yang mendukungnya.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials to make Food chips

Membeli bahan - bahan untuk membuat peyek

loans.name: Ndigwako

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is Ndigwako K., who is married with two children, aged 2 and 7. In 2006 Ndigwako established a seamstress business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase material and accessories to sew new items for sale. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Ndigwako would like to purchase material and accessories to sew new items to sell.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf H. is 35 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is driving a taxi and supporting his family with this business alone. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan. He needs a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase necessary spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Cruz Ch°En 1 Group

texts.es:
PascuaL. is 35 years of age. Despite her young age, she has 8 children. It is for this reason that she sees the need to look for various ways to obtain money and support her family. She sells fruits and vegetables in the San Cristobal market. While waiting to make a sale, she embroiders blouses, which she sells to handicraft shop owners in the city. With her loan, she would like to expand her business and purchase materials to keep making blouses. The other members of the group, Rosa Elisea H. H., PascuaL. J. D. L. C. and PascuaL. J. H. are all artisans who make traditional blouses and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUAL. TIENE 35 AÑOS, A PESAR D. SER MUY JOVEN TIENE 8 HIJOS, POR TAL MOTIVO SE VE EN L. NECESIDAD D. BUSCAR VARIAS OPCIONES PARA TENER DINERO Y MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, VEND. FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO D. SAN CRISTÓBAL, MIENTRAS ESPERA VENDER ALGO BORDA BLUSAS, LAS CUALES VEND. A PERSONAS QUE TIENEN TIENDA D. ARTESANIAS EN L. CIUDAD, CON SU CREDITO QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y COMPRAR MATERIAL PARA SEGUIR ELABORANDO BLUSAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, ROSA ELISEA H. H., PASCUAL. J. D. L. C. Y PASCUAL. J. H. SON ARTESANAS, ELABORAN BLUSAS Y FALDAS TIPICAS.

loans.use: Expansion of business and purchase of materials to make more blouses

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Mrs. Siti A. is a food vendor. She sells mixed rice (fast food). Her food stall is located at Kupaon street, which is one of the main street in Bali as it is the main intersection for tourist hot spots such as Sanur, Kuta and Nusa Dua. She lives with her husband in a rented room.

She wakes up at 04.00 am everyday to start her food business. Her customers mainly are travelers at Kupaon street and also her neighbors. The money she earns is used to pay for the rent and also to help her to make end's meet.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Jl.Kupaon merupakan jalur yang sangat ramai karena merupakan jalur penghubung antara Denpasar dan daerah pariwisata seperti Sanur, Kuta dan Nusa Dua. Usaha warung yang digeluti Ibu Siti A. cukup lancar meskipun setiap hari dia harus bangun jam 04.00 pagi untuk belanja kebutuhan warung, Ibu Siti A. tetap semangat karena dibantu oleh suaminya, Adapun pembelinya adalah mereka yang lewat sekitar Jl.Kupaon dan juga tetangga sekitar. keuntungan yang didapat dari hasil usaha warung cukup untuk dipergunakan untuk membayar sewa kamar kost dan juga memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Sim San Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim S., the group leader, lives in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells fruit in the local marK. and would like to expand her business. She has applied for this loan so that she can buy more fruit to re-sell.

Mrs. Sim S., 42, has four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory while the other two study at a state school. Her husband, Mr. Yean Dok, sells fruit in the marK. with her.

Mrs. Sim S. previously obtained a loan to start the fruit business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to re-sell

loans.name: Freedom Croop 2018-D Group

texts.en:
Anite P., the group leader, has a business selling tea and has applied for this loan in order to buy more sugar. Anite is 30 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 18. Her husband is a builder and her children go to school. Each week, Anite makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Anite is joined in her small group by Emelda L., Emelda K., Savina Y., and Jaslino K.. Emelda L. has a business selling clothing and would use her loan to buy more clothes. Emelda K. currently sells beans and flour at the market and would like to expand her business. Savina Y. operates a business selling beans and hopes to open up a shop. Jaslino K. has a business selling clothes but has applied for this loan in order to buy a motor-bike for special hire.

loans.use: To buy more sugar

loans.name: Rossy

texts.es:
Rossy is a valiant woman of 32 years and utilizes her young age to the maximum; on caring for her children, in her home, and on her work. A few years ago she started a business selling food, but the timing of high prices and low demand brought failure. A little later, by chance, she was offered two used Billiard tables, which she bought with what little money she had saved. Two years have passed since Rossy made that decision and she rents her tables to pool enthusiasts, who rent them for hours, providing her with the money to sustain her family.

The little corner where Rossy puts the tables has become too small, her customers have to wait until the other players finish their games, or they simply find somewhere else to go. Now she wants to expand, spruce up the environment and purchase two more tables. To accomplish her goals, she is requesting a this loan. Though she failed one, Rossy got back up and keeps pushing forward--help her.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Rossy es una mujer valiente, tiene 32 años y la juventud que posee la utiliza al máximo; en la atención de sus hijos, en su casa y en su trabajo. Hace años atrás inició un negocio de venta de comida, pero el momento de las alzas de alimentos y la poca demanda la llevaron al fracaso. Tiempo después, ocasionalmente, le ofrecieron dos mesas de billar usadas, las que compró con lo poco que le había quedado de dinero, han transcurrido dos años de esa acertada decisión y Rossy viene alquilando sus mesas para que aficionados a este juego se las alquilen por horas y así obtener el dinero para el sustento familiar.El rinconcito donde Rossy puso sus mesas ha quedado chico, los asistentes tienen que esperar a que otros acaben su juego, o simplemente se van a otro lugar. Ahora ella desea ampliar, arreglar el ambiente y comprar dos mesas adicionales, para ello es que está solicitando este préstamo. Si una vez fracasó, Rossy se levantó y ahora sigue adelante, ayúdala.

loans.use: Improve her business environment and purchase two additional Billiard tables.

loans.name: Angèle Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Angele D. was born in 1964 and is originally from the city of Aneho. She is married and the mother of three (3) children. Her husband, Marc Hafia is a mason. Her principle business is the sale of plastic bins and ice coolers in the Adidogome district of Lomé. She started this business in 2004 and at that time did not have a store. Her business has evolved to where she now sells from her store and has acquired many clients during this time. She is requesting this first loan to increase her stock with 40 plastic bins and 15 ice coolers.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Originaire de la ville d’Aného, dame D. Angèle Afi s’est marié à monsieur HAFIA Marc qui est un maçon. Elle est née en 1964 et est mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de plastique et de glacière dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a commence cette activité depuis 2004 et n’avait pas de magasin en ce moment. Actuellement son activité évolue et elle vend dans son magasin et accueille beaucoup de client à longueur d’une journée. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de plastique de 40 bassines et de 15 glacières.

loans.use: Purchase of Plastic Bins and Ice Coolers

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 57 años, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos. Desde niño se dedico a ser agricultor, desde que se casó, tuvo la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia, para ello tuvo que ocuparse en sus producciones de plátanos, tiempo completo,  pasando hasta días enteros en sus lejanas chacras.Para él, esto no es trabajoso ya que  tiene la experiencia de toda una vida en ello y disfruta realizando esta actividad, sobre todo en el momento de cosechar, porque toda su familia lo apoya en ello y no se siente solo, ya que es triste estar solo en sus terrenos sin tener con quien compartir su trabajo. 
Andrés tiene el deseo de ser un gran agricultor, ser reconocido como tal, y este es el motivo de su trabajo.
Desea invertir en la compra de plantaciones de plátanos y adquirir un terreno adicional para su nueva producción, y así con el tiempo lograr una estabilidad como agricultor.
texts.en:
Andres is 57 years old and lives with his wife and five children. Since he was a kid he worked in agriculture, and since he got married he had to support his family, so he decided to work producing plantains full time, spending full days on far away lands. For him this is not work because he has a life long experience on it and enjoys very much this activity, mainly the moment when he harvests, because his family helps him and he doesn’t feel alone, because sometimes is sad working alone without anyone to share his work with.
Andres wants to be a great farmer, and be recognized like one so he keeps on working.
He wants to invest the loan on buying land for the plantains to increase production and with time gain stability as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional land for plantain farming

loans.name: Anevili

texts.en:
Anevili S., 45 years old, is married with one child.  She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the village people about three days per week. She already has had one previous loan with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 166 USD).  SPBD loans are Anevili's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She hopes to buy additional equipment required to be used in her business. Her husband and child also helps out.

loans.use: To buy equipment necessary for banana / taro sales

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.es:
Es un banco comunal compuesto D. 10 personas, el cual pertenece a la Localidad D. la Guardia, Bolivia, la mayoría D. los clientes se dedican al comercio D. ropa, cosméticos y frutas.
Carmen C..- es la líder del banco ella vive en la localidad D. la Guardia Barrio 3 D. Mayo hace 2 años,  vive en casa alquilada. Cuenta con tres hijos y su esposo el mismo que trabaja en la Alcaldía D. la Guardia, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa ambulando,  hace 2 años atrás que empezó con el negocio ahora quiere seguir trabajando con emprender para seguir ahorrando y D. esa manera llagar a reunir dinero para comprarse un puesto fijo.
Juana S..- es la secretaria del banco comunal, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosmético y también a la venta D. masitas, es ambulante y vive en casa  propia tiene cuatro hijos es una mujer talentosa y en la casa D. ella se hacen las reuniones ella sueña con tener un local propio.  
Lidia C..-  La Sra. es la Tesorera del banco comunal, vive en la localidad D. la Guardia, Km. 6. En casa alquilada, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos.
Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos, dice que el crédito es muy importante ya que D. esa manera ella realiza su negocio y es la manera con la que logra mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
It is a community bank of 10 individuals that belongs to the locality of "la Guardia," Bolivia. The majority of the clients sell clothes, cosmetics and fruit for a living. Carmen C. is the leader of the bank, she has been living in the locality of "la Guardia Barrio 3 D. Mayo" for the past 2 years, she lives in a rented house. She has three children and her husband works at the Mayor's Office of "la Guardia; she is a street vendor selling clothes. She started her business 2 years ago and she wishes to continue working with enthusiasm in order to save enough money to buy a stand. Juana S. is the secretary of the community bank, she sells cosmetics as well as pastries as a street vendor, she lives in her own house, has four children, is a very talented lady and business meetings are held at her place and she dreams of having her own premises. Lidia C. is the treasurer of the community bank, she lives in the locality of "la Guardia, Km. 6". She sells cosmetics from a rented house. She is a single mother of two children, and the loan is very important to her as it makes it possible for her to make business and proviD. for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Huilwer

texts.es: Huilwer tiene 24 años, vive con su esposa y sus  dos hijos. Este joven está dedicado a la agricultura por más de 5 años, ahora está sembrando diversos productos como palta, papaya, café, plátanos y variedad de  frutas que  podrán ayudarle a mantener a su joven familia. Lo que le agrada realizar  es  la siembre de las plantas de los diversos productos, ya que es más rentable invertir en variedades de frutas y vender mensualmente sus cosechas, ya que el mercado es exigente. Pero lo más tedioso es  tener que  limpiar sus  terrenos de cultivos y cuidarlos día a día. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Huilwer invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de abono para su terreno.
texts.en:
Huilwer is 24 years old and lives with his wife and two children. This young man has been a farmer for more than 5 years. Now he is growing diverse products such as avocado, papaya, coffee, bananas, and a variety of fruits than he can help support his young family. What pleases him is sewing his diverse crops as it is profitable to invest in a variety of fruits and sell his harvest monthly, as the market is demanding. But the most tedious is having to clear his land and take care of his crops day after day. This is his first loan with MFP. Huilwer will invest the money in purchasing fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Eulália José

texts.pt:
Eulália Jose U. é natural de Maputo e tem 45 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 6 filhos com idade entre 28, 18, 11, 9, 7 e 5 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os filhos.

Eulália estudou até 6ªclasse e parou quando faleceu o seu pai e não teve alguém para ajudar financeiramente a mãe era desempregada. Eulália cresceu num ambiente familiar aos 15 anos faleceu o seu pai, em 1980 juntou se com o seu primeiro marido que veio a separar dele em 1985 e em 1995 casou se pela segunda vez com qual vive até hoje.

Eulália é gestora de uma mercearia e proprietária do mesmo, qual abre as 8:00he fecha as 18:00h não tem empregada. Tem um rendimento liquido mensal de 20.500,00mt , este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende reforçar a mercadoria existente a fim de responder bem a procura nesta quadra festiva do fim do ano. Futuramente  pretende comprar um carro.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Eulália Jose U. is a 45-year-old mother of 6 children (of 28, 18, 11, 9, 7 and 5 years of age). Eulália studied up until the 6th year and stopped her studies when her father passed away and she lacked financial support. Eulália's father passed away when she was 15 years old. In 1980 she married for the first time only to later separate in 1985, and in 1995 she married for the second time. Eulália is the manager and owner of a grocery store that opens at 8am and closes at 6pm. She does not employ any help. This is her first loan, with which she intends to bolster her existing stock in order to meet the holiday demand. In the future she hopes to purchase a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Moul

texts.en: Moul N., age 36, raises pigs in a stall next to her home in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.  She also grows vegetables (e.g., cabbage, morning glory, and cucumbers) and sells them to a market vendor three months after they mature. She is married to Khy Savuth who is 46 years old. He grows vegetables with Mrs. N., as well as drives a taxi motorcycle to earn a daily income. The couple are responsible for four children who are all currently attending school. Mrs. N. recently sold all her pigs, and now she hopes to acquire more pigs to raise. She would like to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Chafik

texts.en:
Chafik is a 30 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Chafik owns a mini market store which was started by his grandfather and has been in the family for 55 years. Chafik has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Chafik has requested a loan.
His clients are people from his region. Chafik decided on doing this business because it is a family business. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Chafik will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah C. is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently all her children have completed junior high school. She has multiple businesses. She lives with her husband,a professional tailor, who sews all kinds of dresses.

Hannah owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. In addition she also sells linen for sewing, charcoal, tomatoes etc in the community market.

She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her ten years trading experience she wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children's education. Hannah belongs to the village bank called ‘Adom Akyede’ meaning the Gift of Grace. She would be grateful for the assistance. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin sells kerosene and she has been in this business since 1993. She is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Oluwatoyin is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is very happy with the loan that was given to her by Kiva and prayed that God will continue to bless and provide for the (Kiva lenders). She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Bulgamaa

texts.en:
Bulgamaa J. is 41, married and the mother of two. Her husband Batdorj stays at home and drinks.

In 1991, Bulgamaa started her dairy sales business at the local market. She buys dairy products such as aaruul (dried milk) and airag (fermented horse milk) from wholesalers. When she began her business, her working capital was 100,000 tugrugs a month. Her family used to live in a "ger" (nomadic Mongolian tent) district on rented land. With her profit, she was able to buy the land they live on.

Now she is working hard to expand her dairy business by renting another stall. Her working capital has increased to 1,000,000 ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT). She requests a loan to buy more dairy products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama M. is a 55-year-old married mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. While few of her children are in senior high school, others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a security guard in a local company.

Mariama is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings. She prepares the porridge from ingredients such as millet, maize, beans, etc and sells on the street. Mariama has been in the business for ten years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy maize, millet and other goods to expand business

loans.name: Hermenegilda Noa

texts.pt:
Hermenegilda Noa U. natural de Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 25, 24, 19 e 15 anos respectivamente, alem dos filhos sustenta dois enteados que mora com eles.

Hermenegilda estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai e sendo  a mais velha viu se obrigada a procurar emprego afim de sustentar os seus irmãos. 1984 inicia actividade comercial que consistiu em venda de vários produtos, actualmente o negocio consiste na venda de roupas, mariscos e verduras.

Hermenegilda solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela primeira vez com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 16000,00mt e faz poupança.  Futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para melhoramento das condições habitacionais.

Hermenegilda aparece na foto com o seu marido
texts.en:
Hermenegilda Noa U. was born in Maputo. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 25, 24, 19, and 15. Besides supporting her children, Hermenegilda supports two step-children who live with them. Hermenegilda had to stop going to school in the 8th grade when she lost her father. As the oldest child she had to look for work to support her siblings. In 1984 she began selling a variety of products, and today she sells clothing, seafood, and vegetables. This is Hermenegilda’s first loan with Hluvuku, and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. She currently has a monthly income of 16,000 MT and has a savings account. She hopes to get another loan in the future to improve her housing situation. This photo is of Hermenegilda and her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfredy M. is a farmer in Tanzanian. He keeps beef and dairy cattle and goats. He sells forty litters of milk daily to customers for domestic uses. He also gets income from selling goats to meet customer needs.

His plans are to increase the number of livestock. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: Expand his livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: two sons and five daughters who are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in meat, which she sells on a table top at the market square. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Elizabeth buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for thirty years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. Elizabeth wants to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell

loans.name: Mour

texts.en: Mour S. is 40 years old and lives in Battambong Province. S. and her husband are working hard to ensure a comfortable life for their two school-aged children. Most recently, she has been involved in planting bean sprouts and sells them at a local market for a gross income of US $10 per day to cover her family's expenses. Her husband is an ice cream vendor who always has to travel long distances to provide his goods to his repeat customers, earning US $18 per day. Since the primary income of the family is generated from selling ice cream, they both want to take out a loan of US $700 to purchase a good ice box that can keep ice cream cold. If she succeeds with her business plan, she will send her children to study at a good school for their higher education. (In the picture, S. is shown with baskets of bean sprouts.)

loans.use: To buy an ice box.

loans.name: Adom Nyame Group

texts.en:
Akua is 32 years old. She is a married woman with one daughter who is currently in school. She prepares and sells pastries like cake, doughnuts, flour chips etc. through hawking and she also supplies them to shops around her. She manages to meet her customers' demand by depending on the meager resources she has saved. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers.

Akua's only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demands of her customers. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide support for the business. She has been in business for four years now.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom Nyame’ which literary means 'God’s grace'. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ronnah Mbithe

texts.en:
Ronnah M. is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kangemi where she operates her cafe. She has been in this business for six months now and Ronnah has seen her business grow within this time. She is  optimistic that, with enough capital, she will be able to expand it even more.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a KADET member, and she had never borrowed funds from other sources. This is her third loan with KADET, and besides the hospitality business, she also sells clothes for extra income.

Ronnah hopes and desires to establish her own cafe and expand it to a hotel, and even open another outlet elsewhere.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of supplies for her cafe.

loans.name: Mr. Ya Ngao Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of 12 people and they all live in Khnach Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. Mr. Ya N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Now he is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase income and improve his family living with this loan after he sales it. He is 46 years old widower with six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. 

All the people in this group loans are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old and married with a child. She is a tailor and she has been in business for the past 20 years. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. Rose hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She say thanks you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of general store food products

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana Lucia P. C. reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Ana de 49 años de edad vive solo con cuatro hijos que aun son menores de edad y su esposo se encuentra en estado unidos. Ana lleva el gran peso de estar sola a cargo de sus cuatro hijos quienes dos de ellos se encuentran en etapa adolecente y los otros dos infantes, para Ana es difícil sustituir la figura paterna que sus hijos necesitan pero que lastimosamente se ha ido por darle un futuro mejor a la familia, ella hace lo mejor de sí ayudando a sus hijos y apodándolos en todo, son una familia muy unida  juntos trabajan en el negocio, una panadería que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, el crédito que solicita Ana es para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos con cuales logre aumentar su producción de pan y así poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia P. C. lives in the municipality of Soyango in the department of San Salvador. Forty-nine year old Ana lives alone with her four underage children since her husband is in the United States. Ana alone cares for her four children, two teenagers and two infants. It is difficult for Ana to provide the father figure role her children need but she knows her husband has left to pursue a better future for the family. She does her best raising and helping her children. They are a very close family and work together in Ana's business, a bakery that is run out of her home.

Ana is asking for a loan to purchase more ingredients that she can use to increase bread production and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Israel De Jesus

texts.en:
For six years Senor Israel has maintained a business of selling seafood as well as providing taxi services using his bicycle-taxi. The two businesses are complimentary as Israel uses the bicycle to transport his products. He reports that the two parts of his business have greatly helped him to support his family.
