Israel is married and has two children, ages 7 and 5. He dreams of having his own cart in the market from which he can sell his products. Israel will use this loan of 9,300 gold cordobas (NIO) to buy seafood for resale.

loans.use: To buy seafood for resale

loans.name: Senyi Women's Group Of Lugazi

texts.en:
Bilego M. is 58 years old and the leader of his group in Lugazi.  He is married with three children who are all currently enrolled in school, and he cares for two of his deceased brother’s children.  

Bilego has been a carpenter for 15 years and has served a lot of clients.  He attributes his success as a carpenter to his high level of customer service and his hard work and determination. He hopes to use the loan amount of 1,500,000 USH to inject capital into his business and purchase more supplies. In the future he would like to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry supplies

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia del Socorro Velásquez V. , es una mujer que se dedica a los trabajos de campos desde hace mas de 17 años , gracias a apoyo que brindo la reforma agraria obtuvo un terreno el cual con sus propios esfuerzos logro establecer una manzana de piña , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para darle los mantenimientos correspondiente al cultivos ya que estos se ven afectados por las plagas , si ella logra aplicar todos los fertilizantes necesarios podrá tener una buena producción pagar el desembolso y con las ganancias mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , doña Celia , habita en el barrio Buenos Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar ; ellos tiene tres hijos actualmente estudiante de secundaria el cual espera poder ayudar con sus estudios para que no dependan solo de la agricultura por que muchas veces no se logra lo esperado por la sequía oh cuando no se tienen los recursos necesarios.
texts.en:
Señora Celia del Socorro Velásquez V. is a woman that has been dedicated to field work for more than 17 years. Thanks to the support that the agrarian reform offered, she obtained land and with her own efforts she managed to establish a pineapple farm. The most difficult problem for her is that she does not have sufficient capital to maintain her crops, since they are affected by plagues. If she manages to apply all the necessary fertilizers she will be able to have a good crop to repay the loan and provide profits to improve the conditions of her dwelling. Señora Celia lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with her husband who works as a security guard. She supports him in providing for the expenses of the home. They have three children, presently in secondary school, who she hopes to be able to help with their studies so that they will not depend solely on agriculture, since many times it does not produce as expected due to drought or when they do not have the necessary resources.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the production of her pineapple farm

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria O. tiene 34 años y es soltera. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de coco y maíz en forma ambulante en unos de los mercados mas grandes de la zona central(Mercado de Abasto de Asunción). 
En el año 1995 con los ahorros que pudo obtener de la venta de sus mercaderías pudo abrir un pequeño almacén en su propiedad. 
Así fue que recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya para poder ir ampliando su pequeña microempresa . 
En la actualidad Gloria cuenta con una despensa bien surtida de artículos de primera necesidad. 
Mas adelante quiere seguir trabajando con la Fundación para poder así seguir ampliando el citado negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is 34 years old and single. She used to sell coconuts and hominy in the larger downtown markets (Mercado de Abasto de Asunción). In 1995, she used her savings and was able to open a small store in her home. With the help of “la Fundación Paraguaya,” (The Paraguay Foundation) she was able to expand her small business. She now has a good assortment of items. She would like to continue working with the foundation in the future in order to be able to continue expanding her aforementioned business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy houshold items and food for resale

loans.name: Katojo Abamwe Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
M. Teddy is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a hardworking businesswoman who has been selling matooke (a green plantain dish) from Katojo Cell for seven years. Teddy is married with seven children, all of whom are at university or secondary school. Her business profits of 170,000 UGX a month enable her to pay their school fees.
Teddy ensures that she has good produce for sale, and this allows her to maximize her products depending on her stock and capital. She would like to make more profit as well as have a happy and healthy family. Teddy is requesting a loan to improve her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizers for better output. She is grateful for her previous loans because they have helped her business and her family's welfare very much.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for her banana plantation

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: La  Sra. Rufina  tiene 57 años de edad ella es casada tinen 3 hijos ya  mayores de edad. Su conyugue tiene un pequeño taller de carpinteria. La Sra. Rufina tiene un negocio de una bodega bien surtida de productos de primera necesidad,  frutas, verduras y otros productos  bazar, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio en la Tinguiña una casa de material noble de un piso en una buena ubicacion. Ella inicio su negocio hace 12 años es una de las tiendas mas antiguas. La Sra. Rufina cuenta con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder incrementar su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Señora Rufina is 57, is married, and has 3 adult children. Her husband has a small carpenter's shop. Rufina has a small grocery store that is well-supplied with basic goods like fruits, vegetables, and other various products. It is located in her own home in La Tinguiña. Her home is made out of good material and is in a good location. She started her business 12 years ago and is one of the oldest stores in the area. Rufina's goal is to grow her business. She will use the money she is requesting as working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She also sells clothes to make a living. Edith loves her tailoring skills and she is happy that they are making a living for her. She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials. 

Edith is 32 years old and married with 8 children. Her youngest child is 4 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Ith S., age 38, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in the business of grinding rice and producing rice wine at home. She earns an income of approximately US$ 3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been with this business since 1987. Her husband sells palm juice and palm fruits, earning an income of US$ 4 per day. The standard of living has been improved since S. has been in her business and she wants to have a loan to expand this business. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a machine to grind rice to produce rice wine. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a machine to grind more rices.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 19 year old single woman living with her parents and 6 brothers and sisters. In 2007, she started a tailoring business from her home. She makes all types of tailored dresses, robes, pants, etc., upon request by her customers, in addition to also offering repair services. With her business income she helps her father with the family's expenses. 

Today, Khadija is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy an additional sewing machine and thread to be able to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her business productivity. And, with the new sewing machine, she will be able to deliver her services faster.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Ermito

texts.en:
Ermito F. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 24 years old. Ermito is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ermito owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Ermito has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ermito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ermito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena M. S. es soltera comerciante ambulante, tiene cinco hijos dos de  ellos dependen de ella , habita en el barrio Narciso Zepeda de el Viejo
La señora Martha M. es primera vez que trabajo con crédito en esta institución. El crédito solicitado lo utilizara para realizar unas mejoras a su casa de habitación para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Ya que se aproxima el invierno
texts.en:
La señora Martha Lorena M. S. es soltera comerciante ambulante, tiene cinco hijos dos de ellos dependen de ella , habita en el barrio Narciso Zepeda de el Viejo La señora Martha M. es primera vez que trabajo con crédito en esta institución. El crédito solicitado lo utilizara para realizar unas mejoras a su casa de habitación para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Ya que se aproxima el invierno

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar materiales de construcción ) Hierro, Bloques, Cemento y 15 laminas de zincpara comprar productos para su venta

loans.name: Ramos

texts.en:
Ramos Q. Jr. is from the village of Kahulugan, Gingoog City. He is 42 years old, separated from his spouse, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ramos sells electronic cellphone load in his local community. Ramos has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,400 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Ramos joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. He used this loan as working capital. Ramos is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor R. A. es de Bº Navidad, con casa propia, tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero.
Se dedica a la venta de artículos farmacéuticos (analgésicos y remedios naturales) y otros artículos de uso familiar, tiene una motocicleta en el cual realiza su trabajo, es un señor muy responsable, tiene varias operaciones canceladas en forma excelente.
El señor Victor realiza las ventas de sus mercaderías en moto ofreciendo sus productos casa por casa en varias localidades.
Los artículos que el vende lo deja a sus clientes a créditos por lo que solicita un crédito para completar el capital que debe invertir para contar con las mercaderías suficiente para sus clientes.
El desea comprar sabanas, cacerolas, toallas, planchas para lo que solicita el préstamos.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor R. A. is from the Navidad neighborhood. He is 43-years-old and single, and lives in his own home. He sells healthcare products (analgesics and natural remedies) and other household goods. He has a motorcycle which he uses for work. He is a very responsible man, and has an impeccable payment record on previous loans. Mr. Victor sells his merchandise door-to-door in various neighborhoods, using his motorcycle as transportation. He sells his goods to his customers on credit, so he is requesting a loan to provide him the capital that he must invest in order to keep a sufficient supply of merchandise on hand for his customers. He is asking for this loan because he would like to buy sheets, pots and pans, towels, and irons.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheets, towels, pots and pans, and irons.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda B. is from the village of Tierra, Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has four adult children. Luzminda owns and operates a specialized retail business selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 11,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén, de 33 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Luisa (32) y sus 3 pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente Rubén ha logrado convertir sus cultivos en uno de los mejores de su poblado, gracias a esto, sus  productos son de muy buena calidad y siempre tiene compradores que pagan muy bien por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, y ya lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que puedan atacarlas. Para mas adelante desea comprar un auto  con el cual pueda transportar sus productos, y así calcula que tendría mayores ganancias, pues ahorraría en el transporte de su mercadería.Es  el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, y en su banco comunal es un integrante muy cumplido y activo.Rubén tiene planeado invertir los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados en la compra de cantidad de abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Rubén, 33, lives in his own home with his wife Luisa (32) and their 3 little children, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. Working hard, Ruben has made his crops some of the best in the village. Thanks to this, his products are of very good quality and he always has buyers who pay very well for them. What he likes most about his work is harvesting his products. He has been doing this for 20 years and he considers the most difficult part to be keeping his crops safe from the pests that can attack them. Later on, he wants to buy a car with which he will be able to transport his products; this way, he calculates that he will have better earnings, since he will save on transportation of his merchandise. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to pay the quotas punctually if he wants to access another loan. In his community bank he is a very responsible and active member. Ruben plans to invest the requested 800 soles in the purchase of fertilizer for his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, beans and peppers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicine to expand the husband's business.

loans.name: Keal

texts.en: Mrs. Keal H. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also sells fritters to her neighbors for extra profit. Her husband has the skill of making wooden furniture by hand and uses his knowledge to earn a living. The couple has two children who are enrolled in school. Keal H. has raised a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Keal H. has requested a loan to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use the rest of the loan towards purchasing piglets for her stall.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en:
Mann N., 44, is married and lives with her two children in Kampong Chhnang province. She works as a farmer, making approximately US$ 1.50 each day, and her husband works in construction building houses. Her family is also supported by her husband’s US$ 2 income each day. 

Mann N. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to  purchase both fertilizer and construction materials. She believes that these purchases will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: To  purchase both fertilizer and construction materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin's sisters).

Joyce has a business of selling eggs. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Joyce sells her products at the shop, by means of wholesale. Joyce has requested a loan of 700,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more trays of eggs. She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire. The main business challenge(s) for Joyce include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing chickens herself and to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT because of low interest rates.  Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent  and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Bennah

texts.en:
A very determined and hardworking lady is not afraid of diversity when speaking in economic and lucrative business terms and anything that can earn her profit. T. Bennah, aged 29, is a happily married lady of two children and has been in the agro produce business for over 2 years. She grows food crops like beans, bananas and more in  Rukungiri, which has always earned her 80,000 Ugandan Shillings on a monthly basis.

This loan is to help her purchase manure for her plantation as she looks at diversifying her business.  This is because she did not have enough working capital at the beginning. This will give her a free ticket to earn more revenue and cater for her family's basic needs and also acquire a self sustaining life as she hopes to increase her family income through business expansion.

loans.use: purchase of manure for the banana plantation

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, de 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha luchado por forjarse un buen futuro, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre Romina de 69 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Aida aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo. Ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, papa y habas, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos que afectan sus plantaciones. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, para que pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuata de humor en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Aida, 45, is a woman who has fought to create a better future for herself throughout her life.  She lives in her own home with her mother, Romina, 69, and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Since she was little, Aida learned to work the fields with her parents who taught her everything she needed to know to have good crops.  Now she owns her own fields that she cultivates with much love and patience.

She farms peas, potatoes and lima beans that she then sells in Tarma’s wholesale market.  What she likes best about her work is harvesting since that’s when her hard work pays off.  She has been in farming for 25 years and considers the most difficult part of it ensuring that her plants are safe from insect infestations that might affect yields.  She wants to buy new lands so that she can increase production.

This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that she must repay on time and is willing to do so.  She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank who always provides her group with a dose of good humor.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure for her fields because she hopes her new plantings will yield good fruits.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia R. is from the village of Luna. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nemia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to the local community. Nemia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Nemia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Nemia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmer, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sam-Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-onn C. (in the picture) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Samorn Sam, 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sam-onn is a weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. 

Sam-onn is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina M. is thirty-six years old. She is married and they have four children between two and fourteen years old. Her business is located in Karunga in a very busy business market of Thika, the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She sells clothes, including sweaters, blouses, skirts, shirts and even shoes.She has been in this business for four years and her target market is mainly women. She says that this business is profitable and her only major challenge is that the business is seasonal, so business is very slow in some months. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 10,000 to buy shoes to expand her business. In future, she hopes to give her children a high-quality education to the university level. She also hopes to open a big boutique. She describes herself as innovative, patient, social, creative and independent.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell in her clothing store

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta, de 53 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos, mayores, de los cinco que tiene, y  juntos habitan un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Esta emprendedora dama se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza, de una reconocida marca, y también vende  productos energizantes, los cuales ofrece a través de un catálogo, donde sus clientes realizan sus pedidos y ella les trae, luego de unos días regresa para que le paguen. Esta muy satisfecha con el negocio que tiene, porque le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos, además cuando vende en cantidad la empresa para la que trabaja, le obsequia buenos incentivos como electrodomésticos. La mayor parte del día se encuentra caminando en las calles en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes, y el negocio le genera ganancias, por lo que esta ahorrando para en el futuro lograr  instalar un negocio en el mercado de su zona. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Antonieta tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de productos de belleza y energizantes, pues quiere tenerlos en stock y ofrecerles variedad a sus clientes, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 53 years old.  She lives in her own home with her two grown-up sons.  She has five children altogether.  They live in a densely-populated neighborhood in the north of the city.  This enterprising lady sells beauty products from a well-known company.  She also sells energy products which she offers through a catalog.  Her customers make their orders and she delivers them.  She then returns a few days later to collect payment.  Antonieta is very satisfied with her business because it has enabled her to get her children ahead in life.  Also, when she sells a lot of products, the company she works for presents her with good incentives such as household appliances.  Most of the day she walks the streets looking for new customers.  Her business is profitable and it is enabling her to save up so that in the future she can set up a business in a local market.

This is Antonieta's third loan with MFP and she pledges to pay her loan installments on time because she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who are making this loan possible as it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Antonieta plans to invest her loan in buying a large quantity of beauty products and energy products as she would like to have them in stock so that she has a variety of products to offer to her customers.  In this way she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products and energy products

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita G. is a married woman who lives in 111, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sugarcane plantation and rice field. Her husband, John Glenn, who is 42 years old, works as a heavy equipment operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.They have three children who are between 7 and 19 years old. 

Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 16600, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 24500, which she intends to use for additional capital for the sugarcane plantation so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Nenita G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To use as capital for  the sugarcane plantation

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is 27 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Yem S. is a singer, and she always goes in and around her community to sing some songs with her orchestra for earning profit. She could get an income with this job at about $2 a day. She is married to Mr. Teng Sokhun, age 27, and he makes a living selling ice cream in his village. This couple has given birth to a kid who is studying in local school. Currently, her husband’s business is not running smoothly because his old barrel, which he used to put ice cream for selling, is broken down due to use and process. Yem S.’s husband wishes to change a new one but he lacks fund to make it possible. To encourage him, Yem S. will use her loan for her husband to purchase a new barrel in order to replace the broken one so he can go back to ice-cream selling business.

loans.use: To purchase a new barrel for replacing the broken one so he can go back to ice-cream selling business.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Alfonso M. le esta haciendo falta reparación en el exterior y interior de su casa.
Don Alfonso solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita para mejorar su vivienda ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una empresa de construcción como albañil. 
Desea que su familia tenga  su casa una casa mucho mejor donde puedan vivir. 
La persona que nos atendió es la señora Cristina Gabriela Vielma  esposa del señor Alfonso M. hay que el se encontraba en su trabajo y portal motivo no nos pudo atender.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfonso M.'s house needs repairs to the interior and exterior parts. 

Alfonso requests a loan to purchase the material he needs to improve their home. He currently doesn’t have the funds that he needs. Improvements to their home need to be done by him after work. 

He plans on repaying the loan with the income he earns from his job at a construction company.  He works as a construction worker. 

He wants his family to have a better home where to live. The person who spoke to us is Cristina Gabriela Vielma, the wife of Alfonso M.. He was at work and could not speak to us in person.

loans.use: To carry out improvements to the exterior and interior of their home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He has owned a photocopy and printing shop since 2002. He became involved in this field at a very young age to help his family with the income. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric generator for his shop in order to meet his customer’s demands to visit him anytime so that he can increase his sales and then his profits.

loans.use: To purchase an electric generator

loans.name: Evangelyn

texts.en:
Evangelyn L. is from the village of Mambatangan, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Evangelyn is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Evangelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste, in the local community. Evangelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Evangelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Evangelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell, such as snack foods & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evangelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Daniel Parkipoi

texts.en:
Daniel Parkipoi S. is a farmer and works on his own piece of land. He has been in this business for the last ten years and earns a good income.  He is 32 years old, married, and supports eight people. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he learned about KADET Ltd. from a member of a group registered with KADET. He is applying for his second loan from KADET, with which he plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer.        

Daniel intends to use the anticipated profit to save and re-invest in the farm. In the future, he plans to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur Nouhoum Koné est un homme marié de 39 ans et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après mûre réflexion, il décida d’apprendre auprès de son ami la commercialisation des bœufs.
Après avoir eu un petit fonds de roulement il décide de mener seul ses activités. Avec 9 années d’expériences, il maîtrise son activité.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des bœufs à Bougouni et dans ses villages environnants. Sa clientèle est composé surtout de bouchers. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Nouhoum Koné is a 39-year-old married man and a father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in Bougouni, in the Hérémakono Nord district. After Koran school, he remained without a job for a long time. And so, after careful consideration, he decided to learn from his friend how to market cattle. With a bit of working capital, he decided to go into business by himself. With nine years of experience, he has a command of his business.

With regard to bolstering his business, he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, he plans on buying cattle in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages. His customer base is composed of butchers in particular. With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mugoma Feed The Family Group C In Kyenjojo

texts.en: Mary I. is the leader of Mugoma Feed the Family, group C, in Kyenjojo. She is 45 years old and married, with 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Mary has a produce business where she deals in maize, beans and ground nuts.  She works with her 30 year-old son. She has a grocery store in Mugoma and she has been in business for 20 years. She is able to make 140,000/= as monthly profits, in addition to the fresh foods that she also sells. She started her business by growing maize on her father’s farm and she is happy that now she has her own land.  Her dream is to be able to educate all her remaining children to University, as well as open up another retail shop for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and ground nuts for increased stock.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El señor Fausto es chofer, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de un sistema de frenos y el cambio de llantas, pues esta actividad de transporte de pasajeros que realiza cubre los gastos que tiene. Vive en casa de su madre ubicada en la zona Las Delicias  de la ciudad De La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Fausto is a driver.  He requires a loan to buy a brake system and new tires for his vehicle as it is through his passenger transport business that he covers his expenses.  Fausto lives in his mother's home which is located in the Las Delicias neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy brakes and new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Justo Desiderio

texts.es:
Justo de 42 años, es un hombre inspirador en su trabajo que desde muy joven aprendió en una panadería como asistente amasar panes, roscas y poco a poco empezó a trabaja en su casa con su primer horno hace ya 20 años atrás.

El labora desde muy temprano pone al horno las rosquita que la noche anterior ha preparado. Le dificulta en su trabajo es que no cuenta con maquinas moledora ya que tiene que hacerla manualmente y se esfuerza demasiado en la preparación. Esta caso ella trabajo como empleada domestica de 9am a 4pm, y los fines de semana lo ayuda, tiene 2 hijos que todavía estudian. Con el préstamo quiere comprar otro horno más grande y materiales para la producción de las rosquitas y así aumenta sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere tener su negocio con mayo ubicación y comprar maquinas moledoras para amasar para mayor facilidad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Justo, 42, is an inspiring man in his work.  He started out very young working as a baker’s assistant learning to knead dough for bread, roscas (typical cookies) and gradually started to work from home with his first oven over 20 years ago.

He works from very early baking the rosquitas that he prepared the night before.  A difficulty he faces at work is that he doesn’t own any mixers and he has to do the mixing by hand and this is very hard work.  

He is married and his wife works as a domestic employee from 9am to 4pm.  She helps him on weekends.  He has two children who still go to school.

He wants to use the loan to buy another, larger oven and baking supplies for the rosquitas in order to increase income.  In the future he’d like to have a business with a better location and he’d like to buy mixers in order to knead the dough more easily.

loans.use: to buy a larger oven and baking supplies.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 49-year-old widow. She has four children under the age of 18. After her husband passed away, she searched for something to do to be able to support her children, so she decided to start selling cleaning products at her house. 

Her business basically is buying a large quantity of cleaning products and refilling it in small packing bottles for resale. Now Sabah has applied for this loan to buy other kinds of cleaning products and sell them to increase her income so she will be able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy other kinds of cleaning products for resale.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en: Mher is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is happily married and has a ten-year-old son.  He considers himself a hardworking, honest person.  He was previously employed in a business selling produce, but now he has been running his own vegetable selling business for over a year.  He wants to save money for his son’s future and continue to grow his business.  Mher is looking for a loan to purchase additional inventory.  As sales have been good, he is planning to expand the business.  With the investment, Mher expects the family income to increase by fifteen percent.  He is satisfied with microfinance services and the terms.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for his vegetable selling business

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad, Beatriz R. es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, el cual comenzó hace 1 año cuando montó una tienda donde vende productos de la canasta familiar, en un sector muy reconocido y comercial del municipio de Bello en el departamento de Antioquia.

Beatriz es una luchadora incansable que espera tener más clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtido y con gran variedad en los productos. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo es una bendición ya que ella dispone de su tiempo, se ha vuelto una mujer responsable y dedicada, vive el día a día con la ilusión de sacar adelante su negocio y brindarles a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida, trabaja de lunes a domingo de 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m.  Actualmente Beatriz necesita de un préstamo para comprar un surtido generoso para su tienda y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, así mismo incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente las utilidades.
texts.en:
Forty-year-old Beatriz Roldan is a dedicated entrepreneur. She went into business a year ago, when she started selling everyday grocery items in a well-known commercial district of Bello, Antioquia. 

Beatriz is always working hard for more customers and new opportunities to keep her general store well-stocked and improve the variety of her merchandise. She believes her work is a blessing that has given her the chance become a responsible, dedicated businesswoman. Day-to-day, she dreams of growing her business and offering her two children a better quality of life. 

Beatriz works Monday to Sunday, 6:00 AM - 10:00 PM. This loan will help her buy a variety of products for her store and offer better selection to her customers, all while increasing her store's popularity and profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of staples for her general store.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is married, with 3 children. Pedrito is 51 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

Pedrito sells flowers and candles to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years.  Each month, he earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more candles and flowers for his retail business.  Pedrito has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more candles and flowers for his retail business

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Esterlita has a shop that sells furniture of different designs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw materials needed for furniture making.
Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for furniture making

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo is a 36-year-old married man who now lives in the Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mr. Keo is a father of six children. Two of the children are married and live independently. One of the children assists his wife selling firewood. He is married to Ry, 33, who sells firewood in her community. They earn an income for their firewood business of about US $8 per day to use for their financial expenses. Mr. Keo will be using his loan to purchase planks and zinc to cover the roof of his house that has cracked down.

loans.use: to purchase planks and zinc to repair his roof

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann was born in 1980 and she is an ambitious business lady. She is married and blessed with a two-year-old child. Since the year 2005, she has been selling African Design fabric to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have moved into her own shop and her dream is to penetrate the outside market through exports. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy African design fabric. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now a good saver.

loans.use: To buy African Design fabric

loans.name: Rwabigangura Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Business ownership from 34-year-old Juliet's estimation is a proposition that is well worthwhile from many angles. First, owning a business means one is their own boss, so they can make their own decisions. Secondly, one has many opportunities to learn and open new horizons for their business. Third, the diligence and long hours one employs in that business directly benefit the entrepreneur.

Before this happy mother of 6 set forth in her food sales business 20 years ago, she took the time upfront to explore and evaluate her prospective business and goals. Then she drew up a well thought out and comprehensive business plan to ensure she reaches her goals. Her pro-activeness, perseverance and resolve have come in handy in helping her notch up many successes.

Juliet sells high flavor foods and crops such as coffee, beans, ground nuts, maize, etc. at one of the biggest food markets in Rukungiri. Before she took root in this business, she worked in housekeeping. On the side, she has a modest retail outlet. She says the gross sales income from this business totals 250,000 Uganda shillings a month.

This is the third loan cycle for Juliet's borrowing group. Juliet says she intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more foods such as bananas, beans, and groundnuts to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as bananas, beans, and groundnuts to resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school. Florence has a poultry farm, which she has had for four years. She does brick laying as her second business. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. 

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business. Florence is a member of BRAC's small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es casada, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar y demás. Dice que lleva 15 años en este trabajo por lo que experiencia en el campo le sobra. Su marido siempre la ayuda en el negocio, ya que el atiende con ella. Posee casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familiar, realiza sus ventas por toda la ciudad y el departamento.
Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por ayudar a su marido en los gastos de la casa, ya que la carga es compartida. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una despensa donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar y demás para abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Julia is married and lives in Pilar.  She is a merchant and sells staples such as rice, pasta, sugar, and more.  She has been doing this work for 15 years and she has more than enough experience in it.  Her husband always helps her in the business by working along with her.  She has her own house with whatever is necessary for the good of her family.  She sells throughout the city and the department.

Julia is a hardworking and spirited woman.  She says that all her effort is to help her husband with household expenses since the work is shared.  One of her dreams to is have a storeroom from where she can offer her customers greater variety.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, pasta, sugar, and more for supplies and thus be able to fulfill her customers requests.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that they give.  The financing will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta and more to supply her business

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es: A sus 28 años de edad y como madre de 2 hijos Liseth es una mujer emprendedora que se despierta día a día con la ilusión de sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella trabaja desde su casa arreglando unas de manos y pies a sus vecinos y allegados. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 8 años y se siente afortunada por tener un negocio donde pueda estar al pendiente de sus hijos, sueña con tener una sala de belleza que le genere mas estabilidad económica y como ella trabaja poco a poco en su sueño quiere comprar mas herramientas de trabajo para mejorar el servicio, como esmalte para maquillar las uñas, e implementos para organizarlas, adicional a esto quiere comprar una maquina de masajes para pies, pero ella no cuenta con el capital para hacer esas compras por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita seguir progresando, mejorando el servicio y dejando clientes satisfechos, así sus ingresos se irán incrementando y su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente.
texts.en: At 28 years old and a mother of two, Liseth is an enterprising woman who wakes up every morning with the desire to move her children ahead in life.  She works from home providing manicures and pedicures to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She has been doing this work for the last eight years, and feels lucky to have a business where she can also take care of her children.  She dreams of having a beauty salon to provide her with more financial stability, and as she is working little by little towards her dream, she would like to buy more work-tools to improve her service; for example, nail varnishes, and means of organizing them.  She would also like to buy a foot-massage machine but she doesn't have the capital to make these purchases.  This is why she is requesting a loan which will allow her to continue to make progress, improve her service, and keep her customers satisfied.  Her income will also grow, and her quality of life will improve noticeably.

loans.use: to buy work-tools and a foot-massage machine.

loans.name: Hawadost

texts.en:
Hawadost is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend college while one is attending school. Her husband is an engineer who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a beauty shop for the past eleven years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of competition from other beauty shop operators. She dreams of opening a beauty collage.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics, chemicals and braids for her beauty shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, chemicals and braids for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Vive no Distrito de Boane desde a sua infancia com seus pais e constitui sua familia no mesmo Distrito. É comerciante ha mais de 14 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo no banco (GGLS) a 6 anos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( sumos, feijão, amendoim, peixe, cervejas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  
No futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para fazer crescer a sua actividade comercial e melhorar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Cacilda was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is single and has three school-age children. She went to school through the sixth grade, but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 

She and her parents have lived in the district of Boane since she was a child, and she started her own family there. She's had a shop for more than 14 years and earns about 15,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM).
She had a loans from another bank (GGLS) six years ago, which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
In the future she hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. She is 30 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

In the future, Teresia hopes to expand her farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto  de 50 años, vive en Estelí, tiene 6 hijos. El es comerciante se dedica a la venta de herramientas, su negocio es una ferretería. El les da las gracias  cada inversionista de  Kiva  que  confiaron en el y lo apoyaron para que su negocio saliera adelante, el utilizo el primer préstamo para comprar llaves, clavos, cerraduras, válvulas ,cintas métricas, martillos , machetes, brochas, es decir abasteció su ferretería de herramientas útiles, necesarias para sus clientes , fue un cambio muy bueno para su negocio y los ingresos han sido  mejores que antes y sobre todo que pago en tiempo y forma,  está muy contento de poder acceder a los créditos que se dan de manera oportuna cuando mas lo necesita, ya que siempre se presentan las oportunidades de desarrollo. El requiere el segundo préstamo para comprar candados de todo tamaño, clavos, mangueras, botas de hule, abrigos impermeables, guantes para soldar, focos,   quiere ofrecer productos nuevos para a su clientela, el quiere en lo futuro vender materiales de construcción para que sus clientes encuentre en su ferretería de todo tipo de artículos para mejorar sus hogares.
texts.en: Don Rigoberto is 50 years old, lives in Esteli and has 6 children. He has a hardware store and sells tools. He thanks each and every Kiva investor who trusted and supported him so that his business could succeed. He used the 1st loan to buy keys, nails, locks, valves, measuring tapes, hammers, machetes, brushes. That is to say, he stocked his hardware store with useful tools, necessary for his clients. It was a good change for his business and the income has been better than before and more importantly payments have been on time. He is very happy to be able to access credit on a timely basis when needed, as there are always opportunities for growth. He wants the 2nd loan to buy locks of all sizes, nails, hoses, rubber boots, waterproof coats, welding gloves, light bulbs. He wants to offer new products to his customers. In the future he wants to sell building materials so that his customers can find all kinds of home improvement items in his hardware store.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his hardware store.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with six children. Five are enrolled in school, while the other one is still too young. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mlongo has operated a butcher shop for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of leftover stock . She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more goats and cattle for the sale of meat in her butcher shop. She decided to join Yehu because of their low loan interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle for the sale of meat in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is married and blessed with an eight-year-old child who is in school. For the last seven years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. Even though he runs his business in a very competitive environment, he has retained the business because of his good reputation. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Nicholas is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has run a clinic in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achol is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase drugs and gloves. She will use her extra income to build a very big house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and gloves to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Stella is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush lives with her husband and daughter. The main source of the family's income is farming. Haykush keeps an orchard where she grows different kinds of trees. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer, which will allow her to grow the trees successfully and to get a good harvest, meeting the demand for fruit in the community and in neighbouring cities.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself as honest and disciplined. He operates a retail store where he sells papers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of a permanent place to operate from. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more papers to sell. Antony's business goal is to run and own a retail store, in a permanent place, within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more paper to sell

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 21 year old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy clothes which she will be selling. She wuold like to do this to increase her profits. She plans on opening her own shop to these clothes. She hopes that in the future she and her family can purchase their own home and that her children will be able to complete their education. Since Iman is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan. She prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Alpha S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school located in Mabai village, near the township of Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. This group of school teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to collectively apply for a loan of 10,900,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With the help of this loan, each will be able to meet their most immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can easily make payments on the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing deductions and making payments on their behalf.
Alpha is the featured leader of this team. Born in Mabai village, Alpha is married and has 8 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Apha has been a professional school teacher for 37 years. He has requested this loan to buy house building materials like cement, corrugated iron sheets, etc. for the construction of a dwelling for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cements, corrugated iron sheets, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima works hard to support her family. Fatima is single with two children and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

Fatima requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fresh fish to sell.

Fatima has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from general store.

In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Mr. José is a strong family person. He began his business more than 15 years ago. It consists of used household-electric appliances and his sales are in travelling markets. He has a beautiful family to take care of and the responsibility to cover all the home expenses, so Mr. José had the need of finding employment and having an income. He wants to offer to his family an education and a better quality of life, so day by day he works to cover all the basic needs for his home.

Don José requires a loan of $475 USD to rent a space where he can establish his business and fix the appliances. He says that in this Christmas season, the demand for his products increases, and for that reason he wants to get ready to generate good income. He and his family require your help and generosity.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don José es una persona muy entregada a su familia inicio su negocio hace más de 15 años, este consiste en la venta de aparatos electrodomésticos usados y sus ventas son en mercados rodantes. Al tener una familia por cuidar y la responsabilidad de cubrir con los gastos del hogar, don José tuvo la necesidad de encontrar un empleo y tener un ingreso. EL quiere ofrecer a su familia una educación y una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que día con día trabaja para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar.

Don José requiere de $475 USD para comprar un espacio donde poder establecer su negocio y arreglar los aparatos, dice que en estas fechas navideñas la demanda por sus productos aumenta, por lo que quiere prepararse para generar buenos ingresos. El y su familia requieren de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Rent a space to establish his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Iris Emilce

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Iris Emilce. I'm a traveling salespeson, I have a small clothing business. I have been in this business for various years, and it provides me the income I need to take care of my family. I am a single mother, and my son depends on me, thankfully, with this business I can keep on supporting myself. My greatest wish is to open my own locale, where the clients can come to shop.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hola mi nombre es Iris Emilce, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, el que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y de mi depende mi hijo, gracias a Dios con este negocio puedo salir adelante. Mi mayor deseo es tener mi propio local donde los clientes puedan llegar a comprar.

loans.use: Purchasing jeans for men and women, men's shirts, youth shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia F. sells chilled beverages out of a cooler to her neighbors in the Haitian community of Magdalena in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Her offerings include purified water in bottles and single-serving bags, soft drinks, and fruit juices. With this loan, Alicia will buy a another cooler to expand the amount of her stock she can keep chilled to sell. Alicia's entrepreneurship supports her three children: Angela (17), Alfredo (13), and Alana Iris (11). Alicia hopes that as her business grows she will be able to buy a refrigerator and maybe even build a permanent store-front near her home.

Note: Alicia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Equipment for business expansion

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Mr. Ramiz is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 58, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ramiz and his whife (she is pictured) run a family business together.  Ramiz sells milk in the town of Saatli while his wife takes care of their three cows.  The income from their herd is too low to support the family, and that is why Ramiz applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher.  This amount of loan is not enough to purchase a pedigree milk cow because in the Caucasus region the price of a good cow is about $800-1000, but Ramiz has some money of his own to add.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree cow

loans.name: Dastagul

texts.en: Dastagul (her husband is pictured) is the mother of three children. This 51 year-old woman lives with her family in Khachmaz region, in the Gobu-Girag village. This family has been in this business for 8 years. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy a cow to improve their business.

loans.use: Dastagul would like to buy a cow.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira lives with her big family (7 children and husband) in Istaravshan,Tadjikistan, and works in a local food market. She sells qurut, a hand-made milk product. The production of this kind of food includes several steps. First, milk is boiled to make yogurt, then the yogurt is squeezed until it becomes thick cream. After adding salt, the next part of the process it to form little balls of different sizes by hand, and then dry the balls under the sun. The finished product is a milk product in high demand among the populations of Central Asia.

Zamira said that it was her granny's business and when she was a child she helped to make it. As part of the USSR, Zamira worked at a factory. She did not imagine that her granny's business could help her support her family during an economic crisis in Tadjikisatan.

Today she has many customers because she has engaged in this business for over 10 years. All her children learned this business as they help her to prepare qurut every day. She requests a loan from Kiva so she can purchase more milk to increase her current business.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of qurut (a milk product) to sell

loans.name: Frosia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Frosia L.. She is married with four children, aged 4, 7, 10, and 13. In 2005 Frosia established a shop selling general items, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Frosia would like to purchase additional stock in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Mrs. Bin L. H., 31, works with her husband on her rice paddy growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables, each one making about two dollars per day from selling their rice crops and rice husks to an open-air market. Meanwhile, this couple has three children who all are enrolled in primary school. Mrs. Bin Lia H. has requested a loan amount of $400 to purchase her husband a motorcycle so he can operate a motor-taxi whenever he is available from his farming work. This will give her family another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase her husband a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has been in the sales business for many years without a whole lot of success. Nevertheless, thanks to her perseverance she is proud and satisfied with the income she has generated selling decorative plants. With her newfound redemption and upward mobility she has been able to forget her days of despair. Her main wish is to increase her investment capital, which is why she is asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Hilda, durante muchos años había incursionado en el campo de las ventas sin mayor éxito, sin embargo gracias a su perseverancia ahora puede comentarnos que se siente muy bien y satisfecha por las ganancias que le genera la venta de plantas ornamentales, con su desempeño y apogeo ha podido dejar atrás los innumerables días de tristeza. Su deseo de incrementar su capital de trabajo la conduce a solicitar vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: To obtain more decorative plants

loans.name: Rodiyah

texts.id:
Rodiyah has been in the business of selling mixed rice for around 3.5 years by now. She buys her mixed rice's ingredients from Sanglah market which is located near by her house. She goes to the market at 04.00 am everyday and she starts to cook at 05.00 am. Her customers are travelers who pass by her food stall at Satelit Street and also her surrounding neighbors.

She wants to use the loan money to expand her food stall business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha jualan nasi campur sudah dimulai olehIbu Rodiyah sekitar 3,5 tahun yang lalu. Ibu Rodiyah biasanya belanja bahan-bahan kebutuhan warungnya di Pasar Sanglah yang jaraknya tidak jauh dari rumahnya. Ia berangkat pukul 04.00 ke pasar dan pukul 05.00 ia sudah mulai memasak. Para konsumennya adalah mereka yang lewat sekitar Jl. Satelit dan orang-orang yang kost disekitar wilayah itu. Pinjaman kali ini rencananya akan dipergunakan sebagai penunjang modal usahanya mengembangkan warung nasi campur..

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Lotosoa Saleimoa Center - Group 1

texts.en:
This is the first group of women from Lotosoa Village located on the Northwest corner of Upolu Island in Samoa to receive the maximum initial loan of $750 Tala each from SPBD.  According to policies and guidelines of SPBD, the first loan must be used to start or improve their businesses.  The second cycle of loans will not only be for the business but they also will have the chance to improve their homes and pay their children’s education fees.  Before they receive their first loan, they were all trained by loan officers from SPBD in how to start a business and budgeting cash especially income and expenses.  

Their businesses (and purchases) include: taro plantations (weed killers, pesticides, chemicals, wheel barrow, shovel), retail shops (hygiene products), pancake sales (sugar, flour, oven), BBQ (soy sauce, mutton flaps), and ice cakes (sugar, plastic bags).

loans.use: Purchase materials, equipment and food for their businesses

loans.name: Mir Ahammd

texts.en: Mir Ahammd lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and he has a small business, a bakery. He is new in this busniess and he has 5 employees. He wants to enlarge his bakery, so he has requested an individual loan from AFSG. The loan will allow him to complete his lease payments and grow his shop. A larger shop will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help his family. Mir Ahammd also hopes that a larger shop will provide a good foundation for his business in the future.

loans.use: To complete his lease payments

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Communal Bank, situated in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito Juli and the region of Puno. She decided to join this bank with the goal of improving her handicraft and embroidery business.

With her previous loans of S/. 300.00 and S/ 500.00, she was able to increase her production and her income.

With this loan of S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 20 meters of a puffy type of fabric, 2 kg of wool in a variety of colors, and a cow as a means of savings capital.

She is currently happy being that she is able to sell two to three embroidered panoramas per week thanks to her husband’s support, producing about 8 panoramas per month to people that pass through Juli.

Juana is 32 years old and completed her studies up to middle school. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her vision for the future is to improve her embroidery, spend time fattening cattle and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta ubicado en el Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito Juli y la Región Puno, decidió pertenecer a dicho Banco con el fin de mejorar negocio de Bordado y Artesanía.

Con los créditos anteriores de S/. 300.00 y S/ 500.00 soles logró incrementar su producción e ingresos económicos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 20 metros de bayeta de lanilla, 2 kilos de lana de colores y una vaca como capital de ahorro.

Ella se encuentra contenta ya que logra vender dos a tres panoramas semanales, esto gracias al apoyo de esposo, entregando así 8 panoramas mensuales a los intermediarios de Juli.

Juana tiene 32 años de edad, su nivel de instrucción es secundaria completa, es madre de dos hijos (un hijo y una hija). Su visión a futuro es mejorar sus bordados, dedicarse al engorde de ganado vacuno y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
