loans.use: Purchase wool and fabric wholesale, and purchase a cow.

loans.name: Arafa's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Arafa is 40 years,She is a married woman with 2 children ages 14 and 12. She is a clothes seller since in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Arafa has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Evelyne now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (bedsheet) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanampate and Fatma, who also have businesses dealing with clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These are Sallay K., Marie L., Yeabu K., and Mohamed J.. They are business people in Magburaka town, selling different items. Sally is the group's leader and sells cottons and shoes. She travels as far as neighboring Guinea to buy the goods she sells. Sally is 38 and a widow with four children. She has been in her business for the past ten years. Previous loans have helped Sally a lot. Her business has grown both in size and quality. She is expecting this loan to further enlarge her business.

Marie sells palm-oil and Yeabu sells market food in a small stall on her veranda. Mohammed J. sells firewood and local produces. This will be their third loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans made great impacts in their lives. Their business capital increases to a new height each time they get a loan from SMT. They are seeking another loan to keep strengthening their businesses and livelihoods. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more goods to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila T., 68, is married with 9 children.  She has 4 years of experience in farming. She sells her produce at the public market 3 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, bush knives, sharpeners, more taro tubers, cement, iron roofing, timber,a wheelbarrow and a shovel. Part of her loan will be used to repair her house.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Otila's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, bush knives, sharpeners, more taro tubers, cement, iron roofing, timber,a wheelbarrow and a shovel.

loans.name: Elizabeth Karina

texts.es:
La señora  Elizabeth  Karina Portocarreo  González  con la edad de 25 años,  y siendo su estado civil  soltera, Doña Elizabeth tiene una hija con la edad de dos años quien recientemente no estudia  su compañero de vida es albañil, uno de los propósitos que Doña Elizabeth tiene es de salir adelante en esta vida por la situación   que tenemos en  nuestro país que encuentra inestable es  por eso que decide  conseguir mas ingresos para su familia y proporcionar mejoras tanto para su negocio como para su vida misma, otros de los factores por lo cual ella decidió tomar este tipo de negocio fue por ser una actividad digna de trabajo lo cual para ella representa ciertas responsabilidades como lo es el mantener a su hijo y brindarle una forma segura un futuro para sus estudios.

Doña Elizabeth tiene la actividad económica de  mercadería en general como: ropa interior, cosméticos y calzado que esta ubicado en león ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante en el mercado de la estación, ella tiene de poseer el negocio alrededor de 5 años, sus inicios fueron por la necesidad de obtener otros ingresos a su hogar, en su debido momento tuvo el apoyo de su tía y de su madre pero ella logro independizarse para tener un buen control de su negocio y fue así como  llego a instituirse por su propia cuenta logrando ser capaz de sacar adelante a su familia, el financiamiento lo desea para capital de trabajo como es la compra de sus productos ya que esta compra será realizada  en Guatemala  debido a que  ella obtiene mayor ventaja en lo que puede comprar diferentes productos encargados por sus clientes, otros de sus propósitos es pagar las deudas contraídas con la fundación león 2000 para  mantener abierta  su  línea de crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth Karina Portocarreo González a 25-year-old unmarried mother of a 2-year-old daughter. Her domestic partner is a bricklayer. One of Ms. Elizabeth’s goals is to get ahead in life because of the situation we are experiencing in our country, which is unstable. For this reason, she decided to obtain additional income for her family and improve both her business and her life. Another factor for which she decided to start her own business was that it is a respectable occupation, which presents to her certain responsibilities, such as supporting her child and assuring her future studies.

Ms. Elizabeth sells merchandise such as: undergarments, cosmetics and footwear. She sells her products as a street vendor in the station market in León. She has owned her business for around 5 years. She started out of the necessity to earn extra household income. At the right moment, she received support from her aunt and mother, but she later became independent so that she could have better control of her business. Thus, she was able to start her own business and help her family move forward. She needs funds for work capital so that she can purchase products in Guatemala because it is more beneficial for to purchase the different goods that her customers order. Another one of her goals is to pay off any debts she has with Fundación León 2000 so that she can keep her credit line open.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Kemelio E. Adzo

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1975 à Kpele Agave, une ville située 145 km au nord de Lomé, Madame A. Kemelio E. Adzo est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de charbon de bois dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencée cette activité depuis l’année 1998 et elle maitrise bien ce commerce.  
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 70 sacs de charbon de bois afin de pouvoir mieux servir ses clients et tirer un revenu.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1975 in Kpele Agave, a city located 145 km north of Lomé, Ms. Kemelio E. Adzo A. is married and the mother of three. Her work involves selling charcoal at the Agoè marketplace. She started this business in 1998 and has a good command of it. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 70 sacks of charcoal to be able to do better serving her customers and to derive an income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Artur Saeta

texts.pt:
Artur Saeta M. é natural da província de Inhambane, tem 44 anos de idade, casado maritalmente com duas esposas e pai de 7 filhos com idades entre 21,19, 17, 16,16,10 e 8 anos de respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um sobrinho enviando géneros alimentícios.

Artur estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras da família     
Em 1980 mudou se para província do Maputo sozinho a procura de emprego onde primeiramente trabalhou como empregado domestico, mais tarde veio trabalhar no instituto nacional de ciências sociais, em 1984 incorporou se nas forças armadas de defesa de Moçambique e em 1994 inicia actividades comercial ( negócios) onde até ao momento já praticou vários tipos de negócios.

Para alem de pertencer as forças armadas é gestor de um estabelecimento comercial de venda de diversos produtos com destaque a cerveja que compra a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 280,00mt. Desta maneira consegue um rendimento liquido mensal de 15000,00mt.

Para Artur este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde os primeiros dois usou para compra de peças para a sua viatura e assim pretende pagar ante do tempo este para solicitar outro afim de melhorar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Artur Saeta M. comes from the Inhambane province. He is 44 years old, married to two wives and father of 7 children -- their ages are 8, 10, 16, 16, 17, 19 and 21 respectively. Besides his own children he also supports a nephew by sending him food. Financial difficulties lead Artur to quit school after completing the 7th grade. In 1980, he moved to the Maputo province by himself to look for work; there he worked as a housekeeper, and later he worked for the national institute of social sciences. In 1984, he joined the Mozambique´s defense armed forces and, in 1994, he began his business activities -- he has been involved with many types of businesses since then. Aside from his armed forces career, he also runs a commercial establishment that sells many different kinds of products; beer stands out because a case of it can be bought for 230,00mt and sold for 280,00mt, generating a monthly net income of 1500,00mt. This will be Artur's third loan through Hluvuku and first through Kiva; the previous two loans were used to purchase parts for his vehicle. He wishes to pay back the loan before its term date so he can request another loan that will be used for home restoration purposes.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products purchase and retail

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat P. was born in 1975. She is married with four children, all of whom are still single and living in the family home.  For over three years, Mrs. P. has worked in her own grocery business. She works hard everyday so her business is thriving. Her husband, Choeun Chat, age 34, lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is a farmer who grows different kinds of plants to sell. He currently earns an income of $2 per day to manage his family's food expenses. 

Recently, Mrs. P. sold all her grocery up until there was very little stock left. Mrs. P. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase more valuable stock to store and sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 26-year-old man, living in Btibyat in Mount Lebanon. He opened a telephone and mobile shop in 2008, after working in a similar shop for three years. Rabih found out that there is a lot of potentiA. growth in his village; therefore he is requesting $1,200 in order to buy more inventory to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

loans.name: Milagros De Cumayasa 2 Group

texts.en:
Milagros de Cumayasa 2 is a group of five woman all hoping to receive a loan. Each member of this group has already received a previous loan and all the women already have started their own small business. Each member has already experienced some success and now want to continue growing their business. 

Julia P. is the representative of this group and she has been a very good, outspoken leader for the women. Julia is the mother of four young children and knows she has to work hard if she wants her children to have a better life. Julia always had a dream to send all her children to school, but before receiving her first loan, she had no way of generating income. She came to Esperanza International in hopes of receiving a loan to start her own business. 

With her first loan she started a small business selling jewelry in her area and specializing in silver. With this next loan, she hopes to be able to buy more products for her business. She is excited that she is succeeding at something and that she has something that is all hers. She has never been so happy now that her children are going to school and she knows that she is going to be able to provide them a better life than she has had. 

Thanks for your support!!

loans.use: Buying products for jewelry business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 54-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Bouj Al Barajneh in the Beirut suburbs. He has owned a taxi since 1996, servicing Beirut and the surrounding area. Today Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Shire Banow Group

texts.en:
Shire Banow is the group leader of the Shire Banow group. There are four members in this group. The group members want to take out  a loan of 58,800 Af; each of the group members wants the loan for her business' progress.

Pary Jan wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of leather sewing; they want to buy necessary materials for his business. Habiba wants to take out a loan for her husband’s business of  leather box sewing. And Shire Banow wants to take out a loan for her son’s business selling car parts. And Nadya wants to take a loan for her business of quilting. They all want to expand their businesses and have them progress.  They all would like to expand their businesses through the loan.   

They want to support their families and make a better future for them.

loans.use: buying necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Faoussa

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est lancée en 2007 dans la vente des matériaux de construction, elle exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « EST BON MARCHE ». Ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs et réalise ainsi de bons chiffres d’affaire. Son stock est épuisé et voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 02 WC, 01 groupe de sécurité, 02 bacs, 03 paquets de tôles et divers matériaux de construction.  Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started selling construction supplies in 2007. She runs her business in her own store, that she called "EST BON MARCHE". This business works well for her, she gets orders from builders and, therefore, her revenue is good. Her stock has run out and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to resupply. She wants to buy 2 toilets, one TPR valve, 2 tubs, 3 packs of sheet metal, and various other construction supplies. She's married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (2 toilets, one TPR valve, 2 tubs, ...)

loans.name: Neli Jose António

texts.pt:
Neli Jose António N. é natural da província de Inhambane uma das província do sul de Moçambique mais ao norte, tem 46 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 27, 23, 22 e 18 anos respectivamente.

Neli estudou até 5ºclasse e parou quando foi ao lar,  aos 5 anos mudou se da província de inhambane para cidade de Maputo na companhia dos pais, a mais de 10 anos que é gestora do negocio próprio que consiste na compra e venda de ovos, frangos e óleo alimentar, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 10000,00mt. E faz poupanças
 
Neli solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, futuramente Neli pretende solicitar um financiamento para construção de muro de vedação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Neli Jose António N. was born in Nhambane, a province in the south of Mozambique. She is 46 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children aged 27, 23, 22, and 18. When Neli was 5 years old, she and her family moved to Maputo. She had to stop going to school when she was in the 5th grade to become a homemaker. She has run her own business buying and selling eggs, chickens, and cooking oil for the last 10 years. Her monthly income is 10,000 MT, and she has a savings account. This is Neli’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. In the future Neli would like a loan to build a protective wall around her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell eggs, cooking oil, and chickens

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Heri P. is a jovial and enterprising 28-year-old man. He is married with 2 children. He lives in the Kuta area of Bali with his extended family, about 8 of whom work for him making wristbands out of leather scraps. He sells these to local and international wholesalers. Heri’s wristbands are sold in Bali at big supermarkets like Matahari and Centro.

Heri wants to borrow 1m IDR (about USD 100) to buy raw materials. This is his 3rd loan with Kiva. He has always made repayments on time or even ahead of schedule. Heri’s clients pay him only when he delivers his finished goods. For that reason, loans are very important to him because they allow him to buy leather scraps to make wristbands for which he has already received orders.

Eventually, Heri would like to build his credit history to the point where he can borrow 20m IDR (about USD 2000), which is enough to buy 1 ton (1000 kg) of leather scraps. When he can afford to raise that amount of capital, he will also bring in more family members from Java to help him produce more wristbands faster. He is confident that he has the client base to support a higher rate of production, especially during the busy tourist season.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Florentina es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Florentina se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos como el queso, tiene ganado vacuno del cual obtiene la leche y también compra de otros productores, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Florentina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche.
Los sueños de Florentina es tener una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the communal bank “Llapanchik” which means “All Together” in Quechua. Florentina is married, 38 years old, and has four children. She makes milk products like cheese for a living. She gets the milk both from her cattle and also from other producers and sells her products in the markets of Ayacucho. Florentina needs a loan of 1,000 soles to by milk. She dreams of having a grocery store and of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de leche.

loans.name: Durmo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Дурмо Ходжиева воспитывает своих четырех детей самостоятельно. Несколько лет назад муж Дурмо оставил семью, но благодаря ее 10 летнему опыту работы в сфере торговли, она смогла поднять своих 4 детей на ноги. Но дети подрастают, им надо учиться, поэтому Дурмо решила увеличить свой товарооборот, для получения хорошей прибыли. 
Дурмо торгует на рынке продуктами питания и хозяйственными товарами. Она подала заявку на Кива, для того чтобы ее поддержали в поставленной цели.
texts.en:
Durmo H. is raising her four children by herself. Several years ago, Durmo’s husband left the family, but thanks to her 10-year experience in sales, Durmo was able to get her 4 children on their feet. However, the children are getting older and have to go to school. This is why Durmo decided to increase her goods turnover in order to obtain good profit. Durmo sells food products and household products at the market. She put in a request to Kiva to get support in achieving her set goal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice N. est une dame de 47ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants avec 4 autres enfants dont elle a la charge.  Elle s’active dans le commerce de céréales, et tient en même temps une gargote où elle vend le petit déjeuner. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de faire une embauche porcine à domicile. Ceci pour mieux participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice N., age 47, is married and the mother of 6 children, and has 4 other children to support. She sells cereals, and also runs a luncheonette where she sells breakfasts. This loan will also enable her to raise a pig at home, in order to better help with the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise a pig, sell cereals and sell breakfasts

loans.name: Maryvic

texts.en: Maryvic P. is from the village of Looc Proper. She is 36 years old and is married. Maryvic owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Maryvic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Maryvic is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet M. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. Juliet owns and operates a tailoring business, providing tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene U. is 45 years old and is married with four children aged between 14 and 5. She lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has sold spare parts since 2003.
 
Helene operates her business everyday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Before this loan, her business could not earn her enough profits and she was not able to afford health care for her children, to get more food, or to pay their school fees. With this new loan she hopes to get extra profits which will help her to change the life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
S. is a 31-year-old widowed woman and mother. She has two school-aged kids who are still dependent on her income. She lives in her own small home in Phnom Penh, the capital.

S. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of flowers on her land, which she will harvest when they are ready and sell them at the market. In addition, she owns a barbering shop where she cuts her neighbor's hair for a fee.

S. will be using her loan to buy more barbering tools.

loans.use: To buy more barbering tools

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: La señora Aura L. Martínez tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, entre lo que sobresale la venta de vestuario, calzado, juguetes, trastes plásticos. La señora ya tiene 5 años de haber empezado con su negocio, ella inicio en coordinación con una hermana, la cual en ese tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada y poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento y vende en noviembre o diciembre, sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea diversificar sus mercancías e introducirse a vender otros tipos de artículos, como electrodomésticos, artículos escolares. el sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, con ello pretende invertirle más a su negocio para que sea más rentable y de allí obtener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura L. M. is 30 years old. She is a single parent to her son of three years of age. She sells general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, toys and plastic containers. Ms. M. began her business over 5 years ago. She started it along with her sister. Back then, her sister sold used clothing. Slowly, she began to increase her inventory, until building up the business she has today. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. If she is able to purchase merchandise now and sell it in November or December, her margins will increase, since prices are currently low. It is also her intention to diversify her line of products and introduce appliances and school supplies, as well. Her dream has always been to do some improvements to her home and, therefore, improve the quality of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Masumba

texts.en:
Masumba K. is married and is an entrepreneur: a Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a business keeping poultry, both broilers and layers, at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam.

Masumba has one thousand layers in her poultry cages from which fifteen tray of eggs are collected daily and are sold wholesale and retail. The business income is used to meet her daily family needs and for capitalizing the business.

Masumba needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chhum C. is the group leader of six members who all live in Choes village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Phum Thoeurn, raises pig and ducks. Her poultry business is going well, so she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Chhum C. is requesting a loan to buy more ducklings for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family living conditions. This couple does not have any children.

Mr. Chhum C., Mr. Mon Y., and Mr. Sopheak E. are not requesting a loan but their wives are, so they appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: Buy more ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
la señora Reyna E. G. vive en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, esta casada con el señor Jose 
Rosali Rodriguez el es taxista y tiene su propio taxi, los dos juntos colaboran con los gastos de 
la casa, doña Reyna se dedica a la comercializacion de cosmeticos y los fines de semana elabora comida y golosinas. Tienen casa propia.
sus ventas las realiza en empresas privadas y estatales en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de San Lorenzo
su deseo es que su hijo se gradue de sus estudios, Reyna esta solicitando el credito ya que necesita 
capital de trabajo para invertirlos en sus cosmeticos, navidad es una buena epoca para las ventas, muchas clientas de empresas compran para tener producto para varios meses.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna E. G. lives in the district Buena Vista Centro and is married to Señor Jose Rosali Rodriguez who is a taxi driver. Together they share the household expenses. Mrs. Reyna works in cosmetics sales and on the weekends she makes food and sweets. They own their own home. She makes her sales to private and public businesses in the different neighborhoods and districts in San Lorenzo. Her dream is that her children will graduate school. Reyna is requesting a loan due to her need for working capital to invest in her cosmetics. Christmas is a big season for sales and customers buy product to stockpile for a few months.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Norma Ruth

texts.es: Norma Ruth tiene 58 años de edad, es divorciada de su esposo hace varios años,  tiene dos hijas mayores de edad quienes tienen actividades independientes, gracias al trabajo que tiene la cliente tiene casa propia con documentos en orden en donde vive con sus dos hijas. Norma Ruth viaja hasta la frontera con Chile de donde trae mercadería y artículos para el hogar que salen de novedad, es así que Norma Ruth logro tener bastante de ropa y otras novedades, entrega a diferentes mercados de la ciudad y de acuerdo a pedido, cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el rubro del comercio, anteriormente tenía su puesto en un mercado de la ciudad el cual lo dio en alquiler porque gana más viajando. Si bien existe competencia en el rubro del comercio de ropa, también existe demanda, en especial para ropa de mujer puesto que siempre se quiere estar a la moda y de acuerdo a temporada, comprando mercadería de la frontera gana más que en el mercado. Norma Ruth solicito el crédito para capital de operaciones, quiere traer más mercadería por estas fiestas de fin de año. Norma Ruth accedió a cuatro créditos anteriores en la institución todos con excelente comportamiento en el pago de sus cuotas, Norma Ruth es cliente fiel con la institución y solo trabaja con Agrocapital  en agradecimiento al crecimiento que ha tenido.
texts.en:
Norma Ruth is 58, and she has been divorced from her husband for several years. She has two adult daughters who have their independent activities. Thanks to her work she has her own house with documents in order. She lives there with her two daughters. Norma Ruth travels to the border with Chile to get merchandise and novelty items for the home. That is how Norma Ruth was able to have plenty of clothes and novelty items. She delivers them to different markets in the city, and she takes orders. She has several years of experience in this field. Previously she had a stand in the city market, but she rents it out because she makes more traveling. Competition does exits in the field of selling clothes, but demand also exists. It especially exists for women’s clothing because they always want to be in style according to the season. Buying merchandise on the border gives her more income than in the market. Norma Ruth asked for a loan for working capital. She wants to bring more merchandise for the festivities at the end of the year. Norma Ruth has had four previous loans with the Institution. In all of them she had excellent behavior making her payments. Norma Ruth is a loyal client of the Institution. She will only work with Agrocapital out of gratitude for the growth that she has had.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: S. Alice is a business person. She is thirty-seven years old, the mother of one child. She is operating in a rental shop, selling retail items such as sugar, salt, drinks, soap, bread, etc. She has been operating her business for over five years now. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, bread, etc. to sell. Her future hope is to purchase a plot of land and to finance the education of her child.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, drinks, soap, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es:
Amilcar es un joven muy humilde y trabajador de 25 años, es soltero y vive al cuidado de su padre de 77 años. Ambos viven en su casa (propia) ubicada en una zona fría de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y maíz, aunque él no pensaba dedicarse a la agricultura, pues deseaba estudiar una carrera profesional, la muerte de su madre lo hizo volcar sus esfuerzos a la siembra de los terrenos de sus padres.
Amilcar trabaja en su chacras acompañado de pequeño radio donde escucha sus queridos huaynos (música típica de la sierra); lo que más le gusta de su labor es que los productos que siembra gozan de una buena demanda en el mercado, aunque para adquirir tal calidad debe quedarse trabajando hasta altas horas de la noche.
A pesar de lo dura de su labor, considera que es rentable porque le brinda una adecuada calidad de vida a su padre y está ahorrando para comprar más terrenos, sembrar en mayor cantidad y construir una casa donde pueda formar su propia familia.                   

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas como durante su primer crédito. A su vez, está feliz de trabajar con las personas de su banco comunal porque está integrando por sus amigos que son personas bastante responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes y tres botellas de insecticidas para abonar y curar, respectivamente, sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Amilcar is a humble and hardworking young man of 25. He is single and devotes himself to the care of his 77 year old father. They both live in their own house located in a cool zone in the mountains of Peru.

For five years Amilcar has worked at planting potatoes, peas, and corn, though he hadn’t planned on dedicating himself to agriculture since he wanted to study for a professional career. The death of his mother made him turn his efforts to the cultivation of his father’s fields.

Amilcar works on his farm accompanied by a small radio on which he listens to his beloved “huaynos” (traditional music of the mountains). What he likes most about his work is that the products he plants are in demand in the market, though in order to achieve good quality he has to keep working until late at night.

In spite of the difficulty of his work, he believes it is worthwhile because he can offer an adequate quality of life to his father and is saving in order to buy more land, plant a greater quantity of crops, and build his own house where he can start his own family.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he is sure that he will pay his installments on time, just as he did with his first loan. At the same time, he is happy working with the people in his communal bank because he is working with friends who are very responsible. With the money that he is now applying for he will buy several sacks of fertilizer and three bottles of insecticide in order to fertilize and treat his potato field.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El señor Apolinar vive casa de sus suegros en la zona Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; Apolinar es zapatero y su esposa es lavandera de ropa. Su familia es una de las familias mas pobres que forma parte de Impro y el crédito que solicita es para comprar útiles escolares a sus 5 hijos y también para apoyarse económicamente en su pequeño negocio, por medio de Kiva y a través de Impro apoyamos a esta familia con un micro crédito que generará mejores ingresos y una mejor oportunidad y calidad de vida.

Es el primer crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Apolinar lives in his parents-in-law's home in the Alto Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. Apolinar is a cobbler and his wife is a launderer. His family is one of the poorest member families of Impro. The loan he is asking for is to buy school supplies for his 5 children and also to support himself financially with his small business. Through Kiva and Impro we support this family with a microloan which will generate more income and a better opportunity and quality of life. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for his 5 children now that classes are starting in high school.

loans.name: Luciana's Group

texts.en:
Luciana M. is from the village of Tubod. She is the leader of a two-member group at PMPC. While each of them will receive an individual loan, they will be collectively responsible for paying back the loan if the other member is delinquent or defaults.

Luciana is 50 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a business making and selling baked goods in the local community. She's been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2001, Luciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC and is now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP (her portion of this group loan) to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products. This will be her tenth loan from PMPC and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

(her

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30 year old married man and father of 3 school-aged children. He has owned a car repair shop for the past 14 years. He is a specialist in repairing the bodies of cars. He repairs all types of cars. His purpose in life is to provide a better life for his children and to educate them through university. That’s the reason why he works hard to earn income and realize this purpose. 

Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools to replaced the old ones in order to expand his business and pursue more work as a freelance mechanic.

loans.use: To buy new tools.

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is from the village of Bucot, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $157 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Felipa Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Felipa Mercedes T. es soltera, tiene tres hijos pertenece a la iglesia de los testigos de Jehova vive con su familia en barrio el Rosario cine nela 3c. Arriba ½ c. al norte.
La señora Felipa T. vende flores artificiales de diferentes colores, jarrones, almohadas y chinelas  tienes más de treinta y cinco años de vender en el mercado el bisne y cuando mas surte su negocio es para diciembre para celebración de la purísima concepción de María.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felipa Mercedes T. is single and has three children; she is a Jehovah’s Witness and lives with her family in Rosario neighborhood, 3 blocks up and ½ block north of Cine Nela. Mrs. Felipa T. sells assorted artificial flowers, pots, pillows and bedspreads; he has been in business in the El Bisne market for over 35 years. December is when she stocks the most merchandise for the feast of the Immaculate Conception.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: artificial flowers, pillows, etc.

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons. They are 10 and 2 years old. Her husband works as a tailor. 

Ganga manages a business selling clothes, which she started a while ago and has been doing for quite some time.  She co-operates well with others, and is a very hard working woman.  

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business and purchase additional clothes. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
La Actividad Principal a que se dedica el Sr. Victor D. es  transporte Urbano, operando bajo el nombre de “TRANSPORTE SAUCEDA” el cual circula  como taxi dentro de la ciudad de Danlí con el Nº 247 de su legítima propiedad.
El tiene (8) ocho años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar,  actualmente trabaja en un vehiculo año 2001 de su propiedad en muy buenas condiciones y buena presentación

Don Víctor, es casado y su compañera de hogar labora como maestra de educación pública y de su matrimonio tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos.
Con los ingresos que recibe del taxi, el cubre los gastos de educación de sus hijos mismos que actualmente están cursando estudios universitarios y su esposa lo apoya con ciertos gastos del hogar. 

En la vida personal don Víctor es una persona bien conocida en la ciudad de Danlí y casi en todo el territorio nacional, ya que el fue jugador profesional de fútbol en los años 1980 al 1992 jugando en diferentes equipos de la liga nacional Hondureña.
texts.en:
Victor D.’s main job is providing urban public transportation services; he does business under the name of “TRANSPORTE SAUCEDA” providing taxi services in the city of Danlí with his own vehicle identified with the number 247. He has been in this line of work for 8 years and it’s of note that during this time he has known how to administer it well; he drives a 2001 model vehicle that is still in very good condition and appearance. Victor is married and his wife is a public school teacher; they have three children who are still 100% dependent on them. His earnings as a taxi driver make it possible for him to cover education costs for his children who are currently studying at the university; his wife contributes and helps him with certain household expenses. Victor is very well-known in the city of Danlí and practically nation-wide because he was a professional football player from 1980-1992 playing for several different teams in the Honduras national football league.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Alabanza De Dios Grupo 1, Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Charles plans to use this loan to invest in his small variety products store by moving it to a location better for his sales – the central market. His group is located in Santiago, the center of the country. It is an area known for tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure, typical of the area.

Charles is excited to be taking his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He will use the profits to improve living conditions for himself and his family. He thanks you all for your support. 

Charles is the coordinator of his group" Alabanza de Dios" (Blessing of God, Groups 1, 2) and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, undergarments, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es separada y tiene 4 hijos, el mayor estudia en Lima la carrera de derecho. Luz Maria con el apoyo de sus otros 3 hijos trabaja en su tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa, ella saca a delante a sus hijos, pues también se apoya económicamente alquilando habitaciones a estudiantes en su casa.
Desde que empezó con FINCA Peru ha aprendido a manejar su dinero e invertir, ha superado la separación con su esposo, y las capacitaciones le han ayudado a madurar, resalta mucho la capacitación que ha recibido sobre autoestima.
Con el préstamo que ha solicitado Luz Maria va a comprar abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite al por mayor.
Su sueño es ver su casa construida, pues aun le faltan los acabados.
texts.en:
Luz María is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is separated and has 4 children. The oldest studies law in Lima. With the help of her other 3 children Luz María works in the grocery shop she has in her house. She supports her children with the store and also by renting rooms in her house to students.

Since she began with FINCA Peru, she has learned how to manage and invest her money. She has gotten over the separation from her husband, and the training she has received has helped her develop and enhanced her self-esteem.

With the loan she has applied for Luz María is going to purchase inventory such as rice, noodles, milk, and cooking oil at wholesale. Her dream is to see her house completed, for it lacks some finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih, age 41, is a borrower from Lebanon. He is the father of three children. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2000. He is skilled at many kinds of metalwork including the making of furniture. Nazih is proud of his experience and strong reputation, but he notes that it has been a challenge to secure financing for his business. 

Today, for the first time, Nazih is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase an iron-cutting machine. In the future, he hopes to continue improving and expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase an iron-cutting machine

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old. Erlinda is married and has seven school-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm by keeping it free of weeds and pests. She also sells their harvest in their town's market. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. 

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase livestock feed & also farm supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buying livestock feed & farm supplies

loans.name: Tièssiri 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygamiques, les sept  membres du groupe Tièssiri 2 ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans le village de Siradjankoro dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d'augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le mil, l’arachide, le sésame et le fonio.
Madame Minata Traoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25kg de semences d’arachide, recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour, de désherbage et de récolte  dans ses différentes parcelles de culture. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences agricoles à la foire Cinzana Gare et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes et des femmes du village. 
Avec une superficie de 1,50hectare, Madame Minata Traoré compte produire 20 sacs d’arachide et 7 sacs de fonio. 
Une partie de la production du fonio et d’arachide est auto consommée dans la famille ordinairement ou utilisée lors des cérémonies de mariage, baptême ou funérailles alors que le reste sera vendu pour satisfaire les besoins du foyer en condiments, soins de santé des enfants et autres. 
Madame Minata Traoré à l’image des autres femmes  a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in large polygamous families, the seven members of the group Tièssiri 2 are on average 29 years old, have 2 children and all live in the village of Siradjankoro in the rural commune of Pelengana in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through marital, neighborhood and parental ties. With the goal of increasing their cultivable land, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 1st farm loan. The members of the group are going to cultivate millet, peanuts, sesame and fonio (a type of millet produced in Mali). Mrs. Minata Traoré expects to use her loan to buy 25 kg of peanut seeds and to recruit the manual labor for the labor, weeding, and harvesting in the different cultivated plots of land. She refreshes her supply of agricultural seeds at the fair in Cinzana Gare and gets her manual labor from an association of young people and women from the village. With 1.5 hectares of land, Mrs. Minata Traoré expects to produce 20 bags of peanuts and 7 bags of fonio. A part of the fonio and peanuts produced is ordinarily consumed by the family itself or used during marriage ceremonies, baptism and funerals, while the rest will be sold to meet the needs of the household in condiments, the cares of their children's house, and other things. Mrs. Minata Traoré like the other women of the group, has the objective of dietary self-sufficiency in the village.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and to use manual labor for laboring, hoeing and harvesting.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R., 32, is married with three young children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making $8 (USD) each day, and her husband is a rice farmer. Her husband, Suong Try, typically makes about $2 each day. Seang R. would like a loan of $1000 to purchase a hand tractor to help him in farm work.

loans.use: To purchase hand tractor.

loans.name: Arlan

texts.en:
Arlan F. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 38 years old. Arlan is separated from his spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlan owns & operates a business providing motorela services to local community members. Arlan has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Arlan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to maintain services provided. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to maintain services provided.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos varios. Actualmente ofrece medicamentos de manera ambulante, este negocio lo aprendió de su abuela pues le enseño a ganarse la vida de la forma más honrada, ella tiene 2 hijos que son mayores que le ayudan en lo que puede. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de medicinas pues actualmente tiene muchos pedidos, por lo que es muy importante. Ella sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and she works selling various products. She currently sells medicines by traveling. She learned this business from her grandmother who taught her to earn a living in the most respectable way. Alicia has 2 older children that help her with what they can.

She is requesting this loan to purchase medicines because she currently has many requests, which is why it is important. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Noma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Desde pequeña ella ayudo a sus padres en la tienda que tenían pero cuando se caso decidió que uno de sus ingresos para sus hijo iba a ser por medio de una tienda, en su casa de caña readecuo la parte delantera y ubico unos víveres para vender a sus vecinos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm vendiendo aceites, arroz por libra, bebidas etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceites para su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su casa sea de cemento para que pueda aguantar las lluvias y que sus hijos terminen la universidad con éxito.
texts.en:
Norma, 37, lives in a metropolitan region known as Fortín which is characterized by its dirt roads and deteriorating ecology. She has a small store in the front part of her home. 

Since she was a girl she helped her parents in their store but when she got married she decided that one of the sources of income for her children would be a store. In her house made of cane she adapted the front area and stocked it with some supplies to sell to her neighbors. Currently she works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. selling oils, rice by the pound, drinks, etc. 

With the loan she wants to buy rice, sugar and oils for her business. In the future she wants her house to be made of cement in order to withstand the rains and for her children to successfully finish at a university.

loans.use: Rice, oil, sugar

loans.name: Pek

texts.en: Pek B., 52, a widowed farmer who lives with her four children in Prey Veng Province, typically makes about US$2 each day, and her four children are employed. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have resulted in a difficult  year economically for many Cambodians, Pek B. included.  Since this family spends a great deal on transportation, Pek would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika C.  is currently in the business of selling maize, sorghum and bread  and is requesting a loan to top up more current goods to sell.  

Monika is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is on the Ministry of Health staff. She has eight children and only out of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees.

loans.use: Top up more current goods to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn S. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy Dora

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente, reside en el sector Los Angeles, un barrio urbano marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Nancy se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los ofrece en venta al público en general una vez que estas ya se hayan desarrollado completamente. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su menor hijo.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más aves y alimento balanceado ya que durante estas temporadas del año la demanda aumenta, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nancy, 31, is single and has a dependent son.  She lives in the Los Ángeles sector, a marginal urban neighborhood in Lambayeque district, a commercial area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Nancy has raised barnyard fowl for 10 years.  She raises them in her back yard and sells them to the general public once they have developed completely.  Income from the sales is used to support her minor son.

She wants to expand the business acquiring more birds and nutritionally balanced feed for them because during this time of year demand increases. To reach her goal she needs to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy barnyard fown and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the village of Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 38 سنة يعمل في بيع الباطون ومواد البناء متزوج وله 2 ولدان يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى تحسين الوضع المادي والعائلي والاجتماعي يريد تعليم اولاده خير تعليم له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة فهو تلقى دعم كامل من العائلة في دورته السابقة
له طموح كبير في تحسين وضع عمله وخاصة انه يلقى منافسة شديدة في محيطه العملي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى
شراء مواد للبناء وزيادة تجارة الباطون بسبب اقتراب موسم تدشين المنازل في الشتاء حسن متطور مجتهد ونشيط له زبائن كثر من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه
texts.en: Hassan, 32, is married with 2 sons. He works in selling concrete and other construction materials. Hassan likes his work and always seeks to improve his financial, social, and familial conditions. He wishes to provide his children with a quality education. Hassan has a good credit history with Al Majmoua.  He enjoyed his family's full support during his previous loan cycle. He is highly ambitious about boosting his business, especially amid the intense competition he faces. Hassan wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy construction materials and expand his concrete business, especially because the high season for building houses is approaching. Hassan works hard and vigorously. He always likes to keep himself up-to-date.  He has many clients including his neighbors, relatives and other people who know him.

loans.use: To purchase concrete and other construction materials

loans.name: Oak

texts.en: Oak S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband sells cows, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 30 on other necessary expenses. Oak is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more cows for her husband to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: Buy cows for her husband to sell

loans.name: Kareen

texts.es:
Kareen forma parte del banco comunal “Alondra” perteneciente a la comuna de Tomé.  Ella durante la semana vende huevos y también realiza composturas (arreglos de ropa). Los sábados vende ropa usada en una feria cercana a su casa. Además  en esta época de verano cocina humitas y pastel de choclo para vender. También durante las épocas navideñas vende productos con diseños navideños como por ejemplo manteles. Estos negocios los realiza desde hace 6 años.
Su hermana, quien también forma parte de Fondo Esperanza, le ayuda a vender la ropa usada en la feria y su mamá le ayuda a cocinar las humitas y los pasteles de choclo.
Con este préstamo comprará un horno de barro, para cocinar pan amasado, empanadas y otros productos, y también comprará los ingredientes que le faltan para seguir cocinado.
Kareen vive con sus padres, quienes trabajan de manera dependiente, con sus 2 hermanos y su pequeña hija de 2 años y medio.
Su sueño es tener una verdulería en su misma casa y comenzar sus estudios de enfermería, en marzo de este año.
Kareen está muy agradecida no solo de los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, sino también de los talleres sobre cómo administrar su negocio.
Tomé es una comuna del sur de Chile, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Biobío. Su economía local se sustentaba de manera importante en la actividad textil que se origina a fines del siglo XIX, con fábricas que producen paños de lana de oveja, Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé, cerrada en 2007, trayendo consigo altas tasas de desempleo que han sido cubiertas por nuevas actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Kareen is part of the village bank "Alondra" in the community of Tomé.  During the week she sells eggs and also makes repairs to clothing.  On Saturdays she sells used clothing in a market close to her house.  In the summer season she also cooks humitas and corn cakes to sell.  During Christmas season, she sells products with Christmas designs, such as tablecloths.  She has been doing all of these activities for the past 6 years.

Her sister, who is also part of the Fondo Esperanza, helps her to sell the used clothing in the market, and her mom helps her to cook the humitas and corn cakes.  

With this loan she will be a mud-brick oven to make pan amasado (kneaded bread), empanadas and other products; she will also buy the ingredients that she needs to continue cooking.

Kareen lives with her parents, who have stable jobs, and with her 2 brothers and her young daughter, 2 1/2 years old.  Her dream is to have a fruit and vegetable store in her own home, and to begin studying nursing in March of this year.  

Kareen is very thankful not only for the loans from Fondo Ezperanza, but also for the workshops on how to manage her business.  

Tomé is a community in the south of Chile, located close to the city of Concepcion in the region of Biobio.  The local economy is based largely on the textile activity that begin at the end of the 19th century, with factories that produce cloth made of sheep's wool.  Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé closed in 2007, causing the rates of unemployment to go up, which have now been replaced by new economic activity.

loans.use: A mud-brick oven and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City.  She is 55 years old.  Myrna is married and has 1 adult-aged child.  To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community.  Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Myrna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods.

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is Mohamed.  He is married and has 8 children. He has four additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives. In 1996, Mohamed established his provisions, rice, flour and sugar business. He began his business because he wanted to use the income to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 768,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. He requires a loan in order to buy more of his business stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to get another outlet and to build a house.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  provisions, rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Jack Kamau

texts.en:
Jack has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 3 years.  He is 28 years old and married to Margaret Waitherero. They have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Jack hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Zhirair

texts.en: Zhirair O. keeps a cattle farm and cultivates land. Unable to save money from the income that quickly goes to cover his daily costs, Zhirair has applied for the loan from SEF to increase the number of cattle. The increased profit will eventually help Zhirair to have his own place and start his own family. Currently Zhirair is sharing a roof with his brother and sister-in-law.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 26  años de edad, es casada y reside junto familia en el sector Las Dunas que se encuentra a 3 minutos del distrito de  Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su familia  en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Rosa  desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26, is married living with her family in the Las Dunas sector which is located three minutes from Lambayeque District and over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells catalogue beauty products among her neighbors and friends.  Every day she strives to acquire more customers because the more orders she places the more income she earns from the firm supplying the products.  The business helps her cover her personal expenses and to support her family and meet household expenses.

Rosa wants to expand her business setting up a stand to sell her cosmetics at home.  This way her customers will have products at hand and won’t have to wait until the end of the month which is when the orders arrive.  To do so, she needs to acquire more products so she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to do so and as a result improve her quality of life too.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mabis

texts.es:
Mabis C. P. vive en Cimarron de Cartago, es conocidad por ser una mujer muy trabajadora de 44 años .
Ella se dedica  a la agricultura, específicamente a la cria de pollos para la venta. Ella necesita en este momento un préstamo de ₡400 000 (Cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de  mas pollos de granja. Con este préstamo ella espera aumentar su producción y con eso su calidad de vida.
Ella es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Mabis C. P. is 44, lives in Cimarron de Cartago, and is known to be a very hardworking woman.  She makes her living from agriculture, specializing in raising chickens for resale. She seeks a loan of ₡400 000 (four hundred thousand colones) to buy more chickens for her business. With this credit, she hopes to increase her production, profits and her quality of life.  Mabis is a member of the communal lender Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, and is one of 110 businesses affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Jelida

texts.en:
Jelida K. is 74 years old from the Gamalenga area in Vihiga. She is a widow and supports three grandchildren who are still in school.

Jelida has a tailoring business that she has been doing for the past 41 years. She has established a number of clients through the years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy more tailoring materials.

She hopes to be able to cater to the needs of her grandchildren and see them through school.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children -- 2 of them go to school.  Jane sells soft drinks to earn income.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits generated.

loans.use: stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Solidario El Campo Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO EL CAMPO.
EL GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR  MARTA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD ,REBECA Y URSULO, SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS, MARTA LIDIA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO Y ELABORACION DE FAJAS, PERO TAMBIEN TIENE VENTA DE TORTILLAS, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES TEJIDOS A MANO , REBECA, ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO PERO TAMBIEN CULTIVAN, URSULO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GRANIZADAS, EL VENDE DE AMBULANTE, TODOS NECESITAN SU CREDITO PARA PODER OBTENER MATERIA PRIMA Y PODER OBTENER MAS VENTA Y MAS GANANCIAS Y DARLE UN MEJOR FUTURO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
"Solidario El Campo" [Rural Solidarity]

The group is made up of Marta, 35, Rebeca and Ursulo who have various businesses. Marta Lidia earns a living making huipiles (colorful Mayan tunics) and sashes by hand, but also sells tortillas. Her primary business activity is the weaving. Rebeca also earns a living making huipiles by hand, but also raises crops. Ursulo earns a living selling slushees (sweet crushed-ice beverages) as a street vendor. 

All of them require their loan in order to get supplies and increase their sales and profits, so as to give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making woven items.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Irene has operated a tailoring business, offering tailoring services to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Mildred has a shop that sells candies, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Mildred has been a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mildred hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
