Adelaida is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelaida is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Adelaida has an ambulatory business vending bananas in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stocks of bananas to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es:
María Delia tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo de 2 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, siembra de maíz, trigo, fréjol, cebada, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, incrementar su negocio y mejoramiento de sus actividades agrícolas. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Enfrenta desafíos como la inestabilidad del precio de los animales. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y trabajar con capital propio.

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar.
texts.en:
María Delia, 23 years old, is married and lives with her husband and 2 year old son in Guaranda Canton in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Alli Kausay Communal Bank, located in the Tolapungo community, in the Veintimilla sector of Guaranda Canton, do agricultural work, raising animals, vegetables and other crops, or work in the cattle business.

María works in the agricultural and vegetable trade, raising animals and planting corn, wheat, beans, and barley. She buys and sells her products in the largest market in Guaranda. Her husband works in construction. 
 
She requests the loan in order to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities. The loan will allow her to meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life. She faces challenges like fluctuating animal prices. Her dream is to increase her business and work with her own capital. 

She enjoys doing the housekeeping.

loans.use: to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities.

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORECITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura, tejido de guantes, venta de pollos, venta de verduras, macramé, tienda de abarrotes, peluquería, venta de guantes.

La señora Hilda, indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que viene trabajando hace quince años atrás por el apoyo de sus padres. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para  la compra de un refrigerador, para la refrigeración de la carne, este equipo lo comprará del matadero y lo acomodará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los pagos quincenales, ya que se pagan mas rápidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Florecitas” (Little Flowers) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group has nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Hilda. The members engage in different business activities so that they can get ahead such as sewing, knitting gloves, selling chickens, selling vegetables, producing macramé, selling groceries, operating a beauty salon, and selling gloves.

Sra. Hilda says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a friend. Hilda currently manages a business in which she sells meat. She started working in this business 15 years ago with the help of her parents.

The loan she is currently seeking will be used to buy a refrigerator for preserving meat. She will buy this piece of equipment from the slaughterhouse and set aside space for it in her shop. Working in this manner allows her to generate income to support her family. Hilda is married and has three children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, Hilda said that she likes the biweekly payments because they allow her to pay off her loan more quickly.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Esperance, leader du groupe d’affaire « Changamuka », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 35  ans, veuve, mère de 4 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école primaire. Elle est  vendeuse de poissons (frais, fumés et salés). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal Himbi-katindo. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  4 paniers de poissons à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Our client, Esperance, is the leader of the business group “Changamuka”. She is a young entrepreneur, 35 years old, a widow, and the mother of four young children, who are still in primary school. Esperance sells fish (fresh, smoked, and salted). She sets up her merchandise at the communal market Himbi-katindo. She has been working in these kinds of small-scale businesses for nine years.

However, Esperance just completed eight loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve to supply her with four baskets of fish to sell. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her enterprise. 

Our client thanks Hekima for the actions it takes in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to pay for 4 baskets of fish

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est célibataire avec 01 enfant.
Awa travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois (un combustible très utilisé par les femmes togolaises depuis 2008. Elle achète à l’intérieur du pays et revend à domicile.
Awa est à son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES et ce prêt l’aidera à s’approvisionner en marchandises.
texts.en: Awa is a 28-year old woman. She is single with one child. She  has been working as a vendor of charcoal ( a fuel very popular with Togolese women) since 2008. She stocks up in the interior of the country and sells out of her home. Awa is on her second loan cycle with WAGES, and this loan will allow her to restock.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Aida Emma

texts.es:
Aida aprendio esta actividad hace 10 años pero la paralizo por trabajar en una empresa atunera y ahora con tres hijos ya no puede estar en el empresa retorno su actividad hace 4 años con lo que ahora esta trabajando.
Labora de lunes a sabado de 8:30am hasta las 7:00pm y se dedica la Produccion No tiene ninguna dificultad en su trabajo La Sra Aida  esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la pesca y tienen 3 hijos Con el prestamo va comprar una maquina de coser. Unas de sus metas para el futuro es incrementar su negocio
texts.en:
Aida learned this business ten years ago but she stopped working in it in order to work for a tuna company.  Now, with her three children, she can no longer work for the company and so she has returned to her sewing business.  She has been working in the sewing business for four years now.

Aida works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.30am to 7.00pm.  She works in production.  She doesn't have any problems with her work.  Aida is married and her husband is a fisherman.  They have three children.  Aida will use her loan to buy a sewing machine.  One of her goals for the future is to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Domithila

texts.en: Domithila is 46 years old and has 4 children between the ages of 17 and 22. They all are attending school. She runs a general store that she started 2 years ago where she sells bananas and sorghum beer. She would like to expand her business by buying more bananas and sorghum for sale. She will use the profits to provide for her family and create some savings.  She would like her business to expand and get more profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is married with 4 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Guillerma operates a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 22 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase 2 sacks of rice and additional groceries to sell. She has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Guillerma hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has operated his retail shop in Naivasha, Kenya, for the last two years. He is 47 years old and is a father to three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers; this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Martin hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Berita

texts.es: Berita, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy dinámica, deseosa de progresar. Vive con  Dan, su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años en su casa propia. La actividad a la que de dedica Berita es la costura, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven, ayudando  a su prima en este oficio durante tres años, en los que logró conocer todo lo necesario para desempeñar este trabajo y hacerse conocida ganándose algunos clientes. Así se independizo e instaló su propio taller en su casa, desde donde atiende los requerimientos de sus clientes, que han ido en aumento, por lo que ya tiene seis años realizando esta actividad sola. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico, con el cual pueda solventar los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo viaja constantemente siendo extractor de oro, actividad que realiza en los ríos de la selva. Lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el cansancio físico por las largas horas de estar en la misma posición, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando. Mas adelante desea ampliar su negocio, y abrir una boutique en su propia casa. Este sería el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con los miembros de su grupo comunal, los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con  el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales  para costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, botones.
texts.en: Berita, age 33, is a happy, very dynamic, and hard-working woman who wants to succeed. She lives with her partner, Dan, with whom she has two children ages 16 and 14. They have their own home. Berita is a seamstress, a job that she learned at a very young age. She helped her cousin to to this work for three years, during which time she has been able to learn everything she needs to know to do this work, gain clientele, and become known. Then, she became independent and opened her own workshop in her home. Her customers' demand has increased, and she has now been working alone for six years. She enjoys being able to count in an income with which to cover her household costs, since her husband travels a lot--he is a gold miner and works in the jungle rivers. Berita does not enjoy the physical strain caused by the long hours of sitting in the same position, but this does not discourage her and she keeps working. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a boutique in her home. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels comfortable with the members of her communal group; she considers them to be responsible and united people. With the amount requested, she will invest in the purchase of materials for sewing, such as fabric, thread, elastics, and buttons.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Amani Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amani Group in Western Kenya! Ezekiel is the facilitator of the Amani SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ezekiel takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ezekiel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Ezekiel was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ezekiel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ezekiel will educate his children and expand his farmland.

In 2012, the members of Amani SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Ezekiel with his group members and the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
С помощью предыдущего кредита Александр смог сделать отопление в теплице, а также усовершенствовал теплицу для рассады. Также Александр приобрел участок земли рядом с домом и начал строить там дополнительную теплицу. Теперь ему нужен кредит, чтобы закончить новую теплицу и сделать там отопление, а также приобрести новые семена
Александр очень предприимчивый. Он  взял в аренду несколько садов в соседнем селе; зимой обрезает ветки в садах и использует дрова для отопления теплиц.
texts.en: With the help of the previous loan, Alexander was able to build a heating system in his greenhouse and improved the greenhouse for seedlings. Alexander also bought a plot of land next to his house and began to build an additional greenhouse. Now he needs a loan to finish the new greenhouse and build a heating system, as well as purchase new seeds. Alexander is very enterprising. He rented a few gardens in the nearby village. In winter, he trims the branches in the gardens and uses firewood to heat his greenhouses.

loans.use: to build a heating system in his new greenhouse and buy seeds.

loans.name: Houénagnon Marcellin

texts.fr: Houénagnon Marcellin est âgé de 35 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Janviette. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Houénagnon Marcellin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure, activité qu’il exerce depuis cinq ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de répondre aux exigences de sa famille. Houénagnon Marcellin exerce cette activité dans son atelier. Dans le but de mieux équiper son atelier par l’acquisition de matériels de coiffure, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Houénagnon Marcellin sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Houénagnon Marcellin is 35 years old and married to a hairdresser called Janviette. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school. They are also raising a 3rd child who is not their own. Both parents contribute to the household expenses.

Houénagnon Marcellin left school during his primary education and learnt the hairdressing trade. He has been a hairdresser for 5 years and his income allows him to take care of his needs and meet the demands of his family.

Houénagnon Marcellin has his own hairdressing studio and is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé in order to restock his studio with new hairdressing products, so that he is better able to meet customer demand. His previous 2 loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing products.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the old stove he has in the stall. 

Shireen. who is a 32-year-old young woman, is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has a food stall in order to improve his income. Shireen wants to help her husband by getting a $2,000 loan from FATEN to purchase new stoves to be used for cooking food and also to purchase bulk ingredients such as chick peas, flour, etc, since her husband's decent salary isn't enough to cover all these purchases. 

When Shireen gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband to expand and improve his stall which has a large number of loyal customers who come daily to eat. This will improve the quality of food he makes and increase his sales which means an increase in his income which will enable Shireen to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stoves and bulk ingredients

loans.name: Kis

texts.en:
Mrs. Kis runs a poultry business as well as a fish selling business to generate income. She is also a proud farmer who owns 4 hectares of farmland on which she usually grows rice in two seasons of the year. She is really busy with her daily business so she always manages her time carefully. She is now 31 years old and has been blessed with two young kids.
She is asking for this loan from our lenders to buy rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers for her farming business. She will start planting her dry-season rice after this loan is given to her. She hopes to upgrade her standard of living someday as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Cristobal Antonio

texts.es:
Don Cristobal, habitante de col, Los pintos desde hace aproximadamente 12 años trabaja en conjunto con un amigo llamadoTomas en su unidad de produccion, en la que realiza actividades agricolas y pecuarias siendo su principal fuente de trabajo  y a la vez las que le generan su ingreso para el bien socio economico de la unidad familiar.

Solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en el establecimiento del cultivo de yuca el cual realizara de manera tecnificada esperando mayores y mejores rendimientos; en su comunidad es conocido por ser una persona trabajadora y de buenas culturas.

loans.use: Siembra de yuca

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur    Alioune    est   un   homme   marié  qui  vit  au  Sénégal. C’est un restaurateur qui s’active en même temps dans le commerce et la vente de cartes de crédit. Il a une expérience de 2 ans dans ses activités. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC  ou il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de cartes de crédit à revendre. Les bénéfices que lui  procurent ses activités lui permettent de supporter les charges familiales (nourritures, transport et paiement de factures). Son projet futur consiste à acquérir un terrain.

loans.use: acheter des cartes de crédit a revendre

loans.name: Adjouavi

texts.fr: Adjouavi âgée de 62 ans, a arrêté  l’école au niveau primaire. Adjouavi est mariée à un boucher du nom de Mathias. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Adjouavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Adjouavi vend depuis dix-huit  ans à son domicile, du Kom (aliment à base de maïs fermenté). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Adjouavi achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle,Adjouavi sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Don Marvin es un hombre de 45 años, toda su vida  ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia, labora como Responsable ambiental en la Municipalidad, llevando el control de los Recursos Naturales del Municipio, ademas  hace trabajos privado enfocado en sus conocimientos sobre elaboración de Proyectos a personas que lo soliciten, esto lo hace ante la necesidad económica que presenta al tener un salario mensual bajo.  Si bien es cierto cuenta con la ayuda de su Conyuge, pero en un hogar para verlo bonito y con buenas condiciones siempre hace falta algo y en este momento desea aprovechar el trabajo extra de elaboración de proyecto que tiene demanda por la temporada alta de Construcción y así se anima a solicitar nuevamente crédito a Kiva con ese monto y modalidad para poder comprar cemento, Hierro, Arena, Tubos, Inodoro mangueras, Pegas, y demás materiales que utilizara en la construcción del Sumidero e instalación del Servicio Higiénico en su hogar; obra que dará mayor realce a su Vivienda y mejores condiciones habitables a su familia

Su próximo proyecto es hacer un Anexo de concreto para una habitación, Ruega a Dios que le deje cumplir este deseo para el bien de su Familia.

loans.use: Hacer Inodoro con su pila séptica para tener mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar.

loans.name: Albatiha

texts.en:
Albatiha works hard to support five children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Albatiha requested a PHP 10400 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Albatiha is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice retails home products such as baby powder, napkins, small diepers and skin care lotions for children. Her sales attracts lots of customers as he carries it on her heard and trek to several villages to sell her wares. She has been introduced to the TEACH lending programme. She hopes that if given the $700 KIVA loan she would expand her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lydia Aseh

texts.en:
Lydia is a widow with six children. To provide for herself and the children, she had to start working very hard after the death of her husband. With her two previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with palm oil, manure and meat.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to buy piglets, sticks to reinforced the pig fence and tins of palm-oil. She plans to pay the monthly installments with sales of palm oil and vegetables.  The vegetables will be harvested from her vegetable garden, which is cultivated with manure from her pig farm. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: selling palm oil and pig farming

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en: Shafiga B. lives in Beylagan and has been in trade since 2000. She is married and has 2 children. She sells women's clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. In 2004 she applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for her first loan. She has taken out 3 loans from Normicro totaling $1500. Now she is asking for a loan of $1200 to expand her business further.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and repair her house

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
Orifjon S. has been engaged in business since 1999. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a housewife. His elderly parents also live with him, so he is the one who earns money for all the family needs.

Orifjon's business is selling men's shoes in Panjshanbe market in Khujand. He brings his goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. One batch of his goods consists of 60-70 pairs of shoes. He goes to purchase shoes one or two times a month. The turnover of his goods is good, but his business place is not large and he would like in future to rent another space near his place. For this purpose he wants to increase the number of shoes in his inventory and spend the profit he will make from increased sales for renting additional space. For the coming season he is going to purchase a batch of warm shoes. He needs a loan of US$ 1200.

loans.use: to develop his business by buying warm shoes to sell this winter

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto lives in San Bartolomé street, Villa Cooperativa neighborhood, El Alto city. He lives with his wife and 3 children aged 16,12 and 9 years old respectively. He'll use the loan money to purchase merchandise for the workshop he owns wiht his cousin. They fold metal plates which are used to build doors afterwards. It's his third credit with Impro and his good payment record qualifys him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Roberto vive en la calle San Bartolomé de la zona Villa cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y 3 hijos de 16,12 y 9 años respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería, pues se dedica al plegado de planchas metálicas las cuales los comercializa para la construcción de puertas metálicas en un taller que comparte con su primo. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo, además de tener un buen record de pagos con nuestra Institución.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.en: Diomandé Fatoumata is a 43-year-old dynamic and ambitious woman. She lives with her husband and their two children in Yopougon-Sideci, in the north of the Abidjan district. Her eldest boy will finsih primary school next year, and her younger kid is in the 3rd class in primary school. Her husband is a truck driver at the Ministry of Agriculture. He travels a lot so that Fatoumata is left alone with the children a good deal of the time. Fatoumata owns a cosmetic products store in Sideci market where she sells various fashion products that are very much in demand by her customers. With the revenue she earns from this business, she cares for her children and contributes to household and education expenses. Fatoumata is an excellent performer.

loans.use: To purchase goods and replenish stock
